children.definition: decisive, critical, κ. ἡμέρα the crisis of a disease, Hp. Aph. 7.85, al., Arist. Ph. 230b5; κ. γὰρ αὕτη γίγνεται (sc. the seventh day) Men. 890; also κ. φάεα AP 11.382.11 ( Agath.); ἐν κρισίμοις Hp. Epid. 1.7: Comp. - ώτερος Id. Acut. 23. Adv. - μως Id. Epid. l.c.
litigation, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).130 (pl.).
separating, distinguishing, τοῦ πλέω καὶ τοῦ μὴ πλέω Meliss. 7; τῶν ὁμοιογενῶν, τῶν διαφερόντων, dub. l. in Arist. EN 1165a34.

data.quote: τοῦ πλέω καὶ τοῦ μὴ πλέω

children.definition: decision, judgement, περὶ τούτων Parm. 8.15; τὴν Κροίσου κ. Hdt. 3.34; ἐν θεῶν κρίσει A. Ag. 1289; κατὰ δύναμιν καὶ κ. ἐμήν Hp. Jusj. 1; κ. οὐκ ἀληθής no certain means of judging, S. OT 501 (lyr.); πολίτης ὁρίζεται τῷ μετέχειν κρίσεως καὶ ἀρχῆς Arist. Pol. 1275a23; κρίσεως προσδεόμενα Epicur. Nat. 32 G., cf. Herc. 1420.3; αἱ τῶν πολλῶν κ. Phld. Mus. p.75 K.; Κρίσις, title of a play by Sophocles on the Judgemént of Paris; κ. τινός judgement on or respecting, τῶν μνηστήρων Hdt. 6.131; ἀέθλων Pi. O. 3.21, N. 10.23; μορφῆς E. Hel. 26: ἡ τῶν ὅπλων κ., referring to the story of Ajax, Pl. R. 620b, cf. Arist. Po. 1459b5; κρίσιν . . τοῦ βίου πέρι ὧν λέγομεν Pl. R. 360e; κ. ἀμφʼ ἀέθλοις Pi. O. 7.80; κ. διημαρτημένη Stoic. 1.50; κ. συνετή Cleanth. ib. 128; power of judgement, κρίσει πραγμάτων διαφέρεσθαι Plb. 18.14.10; κατὰ κρίσιν with judgement, advisedly, Id. 6.11.8.

data.quote: πολίτης ὁρίζεται τῷ μετέχειν κρίσεως καὶ ἀρχῆς
κρίσιν . . τοῦ βίου πέρι ὧν λέγομεν

children.definition: choice, election, κ. ποιεῖσθαι τῶν ἀξίων Arist. Pol. 1321a30, cf. 1271a10.
interpretation of dreams or portents, LXX Da. 2.36, D.S. 17.116, J. AJ 2.5.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: judgement of a court, οὐδὲν ἂν τῆς ὑμετέρας κ. ἔδει Antipho 4.4.2; trial, suit, προκληθέντας ἐς κρίσιν περί τινος Th. 1.34; καθιστάναι ἑαυτὸν ἐς κ. ib. 131; κρίσιν ποιεῖν τινι Lys. 13.35; κρίσεως τυχεῖν to be put on oneʼs trial, Pl. Phdr. 249a; εἰς κ. ἄγειν Id. Lg. 856c; ἡ κ. γίγνεταί τινι ibid.; κρίσιν ὑποσχεῖν ib. 871d, D. 21.125; τὰς κρίσεις ποιεῖσθαι περί τινος Isoc. 4.40, cf. Th. 1.77; τὰς κ. διαδικάζειν Pl. Lg. 876b; κρίσιν λελογχότα Μειδίᾳ ἐξούλης Test. ap. D. 21.82; αἱ κ. τῶν συμβολαίων Plu. Virt.mor. 2.447e.

data.quote: οὐδὲν ἂν τῆς ὑμετέρας κ. ἔδει

children.label: b
children.definition: result of a trial, condemnation, X. An. 1.6.5.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἡμέρα κρίσεως Day of Judgement, Ev.Matt. 10.15.
trial of skill or strength, πρὸς τόξου κρίσιν in archery, S. Tr. 266; δρόμον . . , οὗ πρώτη κ. Id. El. 684; κ. ποιεῖν ὁπότερος εἴη τὴν τέχνην σοφώτερος Ar. Ra. 779; θεῶν ἔριν τε καὶ κ. Pl. R. 379e.

data.quote: κ. ποιεῖν ὁπότερος εἴη τὴν τέχνην σοφώτερος

children.definition: dispute, περί τινος Hdt. 5.5, 7.26.

children.label: III
children.definition: event, issue, κρίσιν σχεῖν to be decided, of a war, Th. 1.23, Plb. 31.29.5; κρίσεως τυχεῖν Id. 1.59.11; ἐν τοῖς πεπολιτευμένοις τὴν κ. εἶναι νομίζω I suppose the issue depends upon my public measures, D. 18.57.
turning point of a disease, sudden change for better or worse, Hp. VM 19 (pl.), Gal. 9.550, etc.; κ. ξύντομος ἐπὶ τὸ κάκιον Hp. Judic. 34, cf. Gal. 18(2).231.
thistle, Carduus pycnocephalus, Dsc. 4.118.
suffering from varicocele, of horses, Hippiatr. 14.
Dsc. 4.118, Hippiatr. 77, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: knot in oaks from which mistletoe springs, Id.
Att. for κιρσώδης, Gal. 19.123, Hsch. s.v. βδαλοί ( κροσσ- cod.).
to be decided or judged, Hp. de Arte 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: κριτέον one must decide or judge, Pl. Grg. 523e, etc.
IG 4.493 ( Mycenae).

children.label: II
children.definition: interpreter of dreams, Nic.Dam. 66.9J.

children.label: III
children.definition: Arist. ap. EM 742.37.

means for judging or trying, standard, freq. of the mental faculties and senses, ἔχων αὐτῶν τὸ κ. ἐν αὑτῷ Pl. Tht. 178b, cf. R. 582a, Plu. Virt.mor. 2.448b, etc.; τὸ αἰσθητήριον καὶ κ. τῶν . . χυμῶν Arist. Metaph. 1068a3, cf. Epicur. Ep. 1p.5U. (pl.), Sent. 24, al.; περὶ κριτηρίου, title of works by Epicurus ( D.L. 10.27), Posidonius ( Diocl. ap. D.L. 7.54), and Ptolemy: generally, χρόνον εἶναι μέτρον καὶ κ. τάχους measure, test, Zeno Stoic. 1.26, etc.

data.quote: ἔχων αὐτῶν τὸ κ. ἐν αὑτῷ
τὸ αἰσθητήριον καὶ κ. τῶν . . χυμῶν

children.definition: court of judgement, tribunal, Pl. Lg. 767b; καθίζειν κ. Plb. 9.33.12, cf. PHib. 1.29 ( a) (iii B. C.), 1 Ep.Cor. 6.2, IG 14.951.20, Paus. 2.20.7, POxy. 2134.6 (ii A. D.), etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: decision of a tribunal, judgement, SIG 826 K 9 ( Delph., ii B. C.).

definition: κριτής, οῦ, ὁ, voc. κριτή Hippon. 118: ( κρίνω):—

children.definition: judge, umpire, A. Supp. 397, Hdt. 3.160, etc.; ἐν πέντε κριτῶν γούνασι κεῖται Epich. 229; κ. τῶν ἀληθῶν, opp. δοξαστής, Antipho 5.94; κριταὶ ἀπὸ τοῦ ἴσου, opp. ἀγωνισταί, Th. 3.37; τῶν . . λεγομένων μὴ κακοὺς κ. Id. 1.120; κ. περί τινος Lys. 16.21, Pl. Phlb. 65a; at Athens, usu. of the judges in the poetic contests, Ar. Ach. 1224, Nu. 1115, Av. 445, cf. And. 4.21; rarely, = δικαστής, Demad. 3: so metaph. in Aeschin. 3.232; πάντα τὰ στοιχεῖα κριτὴν εἴληφε, i. e. each element has found favour with some philosopher, Arist. de An. 405b8, cf. Pol. 1337a42; of the Judges of Israel, LXX Jd. 2.16, al.; κ. δοθείς, = Lat. judex datus, POxy. 1195.1 (ii A. D.); ἐπίλεκτος κ., = judex selectus, OGI 567.10 ( Attalia, ii A. D.).
κ. ἐνυπνίων interpreter of dreams, A. Pers. 226.

children.label: II
children.definition: κριτάς· ὀδόντας, Hsch.; cf. κραντήρ.
imitate the style of Critias, Philostr. VS 1.16.2; Κριτιάζουσα ἠχώ ib. 2.1.14.

able to discern, critical, δύναμις σύμφυτος κ. Arist. APo. 99b35; οὐκ ἔχει ῥῖνα κριτικὴν πρὸς τοὖψον Posidipp. 1.4; αἰσθήσεις κ. Phld. Mus. p.8 K.; τὸ κ. the power of discerning, Arist. de An. 432a16; ἡ κριτική (sc. τέχνη) Pl. Plt. 260c, etc.: c. gen., ἡ γεῦσις τῶν σχημάτων κριτικωτάτη Arist. Sens. 442b17, cf. Thphr. Sens. 43, Ocell. 2.7; of persons, [ τὸν ὅλως πεπαιδευμένον] περὶ πάντων ὡς εἰπεῖν κ. τινὰ νομίζομεν εἶναι Arist. PA 639a9: esp. in language, grammarian, scholar, literary critic, Pl. Ax. 366e, Phld. Po. 5.24, Str. 9.1.10, etc.; of Crates, Ath. 11.490e, who distd. κ. and γραμματικός, S.E. M. 1.79; εἰ δύναταί τις εἶναι κ. καὶ γραμματικός, title of work by Galen ( Libr.Propr. 17); but τῶν ὕστερον γραμματικῶν κληθέντων πρότερον δὲ κ. D.Chr. 53.1, cf. Apollod. ap. Clem.Al. Strom. 1.16.79; οἱ κ. τῶν λόγων Philostr. VS 2.1.14; πρὸς τοὺς κ., title of work by Chrysippus, Stoic. 2.9; ἡ κ., opp. ἡ γραμματική, Taurisc. ap. S.E. M. 1.248, cf. Sch. DT p.3 H. Adv. -κῶς, ἔχειν τινός Artem. 4 Praef., cf. Erot. Praef. p.7 N., Men.Rh. p.391 S.

data.quote: οὐκ ἔχει ῥῖνα κριτικὴν πρὸς τοὖψον
τὸν ὅλως πεπαιδευμένον] περὶ πάντων ὡς εἰπεῖν κ. τινὰ νομίζομεν εἶναι
τῶν ὕστερον γραμματικῶν κληθέντων πρότερον δὲ κ.

children.definition: of or for judging, ἀρχὴ κ. the office of judges, opp. ἀρχὴ βουλευτική, Arist. Pol. 1275b19.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ph. 1.45 ( Sup.), cf. Plu. Sanit. 2.134f, Gal. 9.93, al. Adv. -κῶς Id. UP 17.2, al.
separated, picked out, chosen, Il. 7.434, Od. 8.258.
choice, excellent, Pi. P. 4.50, S. Tr. 27, 245, etc.; δάμαλις SIG 1026.6 (Cos, iv/ iii B. C.).
ram-like, Ph. 1.113.
Apollod. Poliorc. 139.1.

definition: κρίως, Cret. gen. sg. of κρέας (q.v.).
κροαίνω, only pres. part., of a horse,

children.definition: stamp, strike with the hoof, θείῃ πεδίοιο κροαίνων Il. 6.507 (where Sch.A rejects the expl. ἐπιθυμῶν, quoting Archil. 176, cf. κρυαίνω) ; κροαίνοντες πεδίοισι ( v.l. - ίοιο) Opp. C. 1.279: abs., Philostr. Im. 1.30: metaph., luxuriate, wanton, of a rhetorician, Id. VS 1.25.7; also πλήκτρῳ λιγυρὸν μέλος κ. striking, Anacreont. 58.6.

definition: κρόβαλος ὁ μαλλὸς τῶν παιδίων, καὶ αἱ τρίχες τῶν αἰδοίων, Hsch. κροβάντιον· πολίον, Id.

children.definition: Theognost. Can. 21; ἐάν τις τῶν λίθων ἔχει τι κροιόν IG 2(2).244.63 (iv B. C.); ἐγκολλᾶν τῶν λίθων τὰ κροιά, Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1923.39. (Cf. Lith. kreĩvas ‘crooked’.)

data.quote: ἐάν τις τῶν λίθων ἔχει τι κροιόν

definition: κρόκα, heterocl. acc. sg. of κρόκη.

children.definition: AP 7.479 ( Theodorid.): pl., sea-shore, beach, E. IA 210 (lyr.), AP 7.651 ( Euph.), 6.186 ( Diocl.); κροκάλην . . ἠϊόνα ib. 7.294 (perh. f.l. for ἠϊόνος) (Tull. Laur.): in late Prose, Agath. 2.2.
yellow parchment, Edict.Diocl.Asin. 7.38.
saffron-coloured, Pi. P. 4.232 (nisi leg. κροκόεν), E. Hec. 468 (lyr.), Ion 889 (lyr.).

definition: κρόκες, αἱ, metapl. nom. pl. of sq.
κρόκη, ἡ, heterocl. acc. κρόκα Hes. Op. 538, nom. pl. κρόκες AP 6.335 (Antip.): nom. κρόξ only in Hsch.: ( κρέκω):—

children.definition: thread which is passed between the threads of the warp, woof, Hes. l.c., Hdt. 2.35, Pl. Plt. 282d, 282e, Cra. 388b; κ. καὶ στήμων PLille 6.12 (iii B. C.); νῶσαι μαλθακωτάτην κ. Eup. 319, cf. Men. 892; κρόκας ἐμβάλλειν Arist. HA 623a11.
thread, Hp. Morb. 2.18, Luc. Nav. 26, etc.

flock or nap of woollen cloth, ἐν Ἐκβατάνοισι γίγνεται κρόκης χόλιξ; Ar. V. 1144: pl., μαλακαῖσι κρόκαις with cloths of soft wool, Pi. N. 10.44; κρόκαισι with flocks of wool, S. OC 474; τρίβωνες ἐκβαλόντες . . κρόκας having lost the nap, worn out, E. Fr. 282.12; τῆς κ. φορουμένης the wool being torn to pieces, Ar. Lys. 896, cf. Th. 738; κρόκη θαψίνη yellow wool, IG 1(2).330.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: pebble on the sea-shore, Arist. Mech. 852b29; ἐν κρόκῃσι on the pebbles of the shore, Lyc. 107, 193, etc.
of saffron, ἄνθος h.Cer. 178.
made with saffron, φάρμακον Gal. 13.182, Paul.Aeg. 6.8.
saffron-coloured stone, Plu. Isid. 2.375e; dub. in S. Ichn. 186 (lyr.).
to be like saffron, Dsc. 2.179; ὀσμὴ -ουσα Plu. Them. 8.
of or made from saffron, μύρα AP 11.34 ( Phld.), cf. Thphr. Od. 27, Plb. 30.26.1, Apollon. ap. Gal. 12.475, Aret. CA 1.6; τὸ κ. LXX Pr. 7.17, Dsc. 1.54.
yellow, Stratt. 69, Thphr. HP 1.13.1, 3.4.5, POxy. 1679.5 (iii A. D.), Democr.Eph. ap. Ath. 12.525c:—the form κρόκιος in Artem. 1.77 is corrupt.
Dim. of κρόκη, woollen fillet, Anticl. 13.
fly-trap, Silene Muscipula, Apollod. ap. Plin. HN 24.167.

children.label: II
children.definition: Gloss.
weaving, web, Sch. S. OC 475.
pebbles, Hsch. κροκκάω, cluck, of birds, Gloss.
saffron-dyed, A. Pers. 660.

definition: κροκοβαφής, ές, = foreg., Sch. Pi. N. 1.58: metaph., ἐπὶ δὲ καρδίαν ἔδραμε κ. σταγών the

children.definition: sallow, sickly blood-drop such as might be supposed to run to the heart of dying men, A. Ag. 1121 (lyr.).
dung of the κροκόδιλος χερσαῖος, used as an eye-salve, Plin. HN 28.108.
sea-holly, Eryngium maritimum, Dsc. 3.10, Gal. 12.47.
= foreg., Gal. 12.565; ἀρτεμισία κ. Alex.Trall. Febr. 6.
= sq. [κροκοδιλίτης], [ ambiguitates] Quint. 1.10.5.

definition: κροκοδιλίτης [ῑτ] (sc. λόγος), ου, ὁ, a sophistic fallacy, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.93.

children.definition: feeder of sacred crocodiles, BGU 734 ii 7 ( iii A. D., abbrev.).
bitten by a crocodile, Dsc. 5.109.
in the form of a crocodile, PMag. Leid. V.3.15 ( κορκ- Pap.).

definition: κροκοδιλοπάρδαλις, εως, ἡ, fabulous animal, IG 14.1302 ( Praeneste).
κροκόδιλος, ὁ, prop. Ion. word for

children.definition: lizard, acc. to Hdt. 2.69, etc.; κ. τριπήχεες χερσαῖοι, of the desert monitor, genus Varanus, Id. 4.192; of other lizards, Arist. Fr. 362, LXX Le. 11.30, Ael. NA 1.58; κ. μικρός, in a fountain at Chalcedon, Str. 12.4.2; cf. κροκύδιλος Hippon. 119 (- δειλ- Eust.; κρεκύδειλος Et.Gen. in Indogerm.Forsch. 15.7).

crocodile found in the Nile, Hdt. 2.68 sq.; also in Indian rivers, Id. 4.44, cf. Ael. NA 12.41; ὁ κ. ὁ ποτάμιος Arist. HA 492b24, cf. 558a18. (Correctly written κροκόδιλος PCair.Zen. 354.13, 443.4 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 63.25 (ii B. C.), etc.; later κροκό-δειλος PAmh. 2.45.8 (ii B. C.), etc., freq. in codd.; κορκόδιλος PCair.Zen. 379.5 (iii B. C.); κορκότιλος Stud.Pal. 20.75 ii 16 (iii/iv A. D.); κορκόδριλλος and Dim. κορκοδρίλλιον, Gloss.
burial-place of sacred crocodiles, PGrenf. 2.14 ( d) (iii B. C.), PTeb. 88.4 ( ii B. C., κορκ-), BGU 1303.9 (i B. C.).
saffron-coloured, Arist. Col. 795b1, Sch. Pi. N. 1.58; χολή Aret. SD 1.15.
saffron-clad, Sch.D Il. 8.1.
saffron coloured, prob.l. in Pi. P. 4.232, cf. Sapph. Supp. 22.7; δαῦκον Thphr. HP 9.15.5; κισσός Theoc. Ep. 3; στολίδος κ. τρυφά E. Ph. 1491 (lyr.); χιτών Phalaec. ap. Ath. 10.440d.
κροκόεις (sc. χιτών), ὁ, = κροκωτός, dress-robe of saffron, ὃς ἐμὲ κροκόεντʼ ἐνέδυσεν Ar. Th. 1044.
residuum after the saffron-unguent has been expressed, Dsc. 1.27, Asclep. ap. Gal. 13.210, PMasp. 141 ii a 23 (vi A. D.).
a compound drug, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.133, Paul.Aeg. 7.12.
conserve of quince and saffron, Alex.Trall. Febr. 7.
the art of spinning the woof, opp. στημονονητική, Pl. Plt. 283a.
with yellow veil, Ἠώς Il. 8.1, 19.1, al.; Ἐνυώ Hes. Th. 273; of a river-nymph, ib. 358; of the Muses, Alcm. 85 A.
saffron, Crocus sativus, Il. 14.348, h.Cer. 6, Hippon. 41, S. OC 685 (lyr.), Cratin. 98 (pl.), A.R. 3.855, cf. Thphr. HP 4.3.1, al., Dsc. 1.26, etc.

saffron (made from its stigmas), Ar. Nu. 51, etc.; κρόκου βαφάς A. Ag. 239 (lyr.); κ. Ἀραβικός Edict.Diocl. in Ἀθηνᾶ 18.6.
saffron meadow, Eust. 1698.30.
σὺν κρόκῳ ᾠῶν yolk of egg, Alex.Trall. 1.1: pl., ᾠῶν τὰ κρόκα Paul.Aeg. 3.78.
hyena, Ctes. Fr. 87, Agatharch. 77, Peripl.M.Rubr. 50, IG 14.1302 ( Praeneste): κροκούττας Str. 16.4.16: κοροκόττας Ael. NA 7.22, Porph. Abst. 3.4, Plin. HN 8.107: κοροκότας D.C. 76.1.
crown with yellow ivy (cf. κροκόεις I), AP 13.29 ( Nicaenet., Pass.).

picking of flocks, Gal. 19.412:—hence κροκῠδ-ιον, τό, Dim. of κροκύς, Id. 10.867, Theognost. Can. 125.
Hp. Epid. 7.25.
Hsch.

flock or nap on woollen cloth, Hdt. 3.8, Luc. Fug. 28, etc.; piece of wool, Hp. Prog. 4, Plu. Sull. 35; κροκύδα ἀφαιρεῖν, typical of a flatterer, Thphr. Char. 2.3: metaph., ἀνήσω κροκύδα μαστιγουμένη Ar. Fr. 651.
κ. ἑδρική suppository, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.72, cf. Aët. 3.161.
woven: as Subst., gloss on κεκρύφαλος, Erot., Eust. 1280.59: metaph., network of the human body, in contempt, M.Ant. 2.2.
saffron-coloured, Dsc. 1.27, Aret. SD 1.15; containing saffron, Id. CA 2.2; κολλύριον Gal. 12.715, cf. CIL 13.10021.66.

Ezek. Exag. 260, CPR 27.9 (ii A. D.), PHamb. 10.24 (ii A. D.).
Poll. 7.56.
saffron-dyed, saffron-coloured, Pi. N. 1.38.

Subst., κροκωτός (sc. χιτών), ὁ, saffron-coloured robe, worn by women on special occasions, Ar. Th. 138, Ec. 879; as an offering in temples, IG 1(2).386.22, 2(2).1514.60, 62; worn by Dionysus (or at his festivals) over the χιτών, Cratin. 38, Ar. Ra. 46; by effeminate men, παρθένος δʼ εἶναι δοκεῖ φορῶν κροκωτούς (prob. for κροσ-) Arar. 4, cf. Callix. 2, Duris 12 J., etc.: neut. pl. κροκωτά (sc. ἱμάτια) v.l. in Ar. Lys. 44.
wear the κροκωτός, Ar. Lys. 44, 219.
wearing the κροκωτός, Plu. An seni 2.785e.

definition: κρολίαζε πλησίαζε θᾶττον, Hsch. ( Lydian). κρόμβος· ὁ κόνδυλος, καὶ ὁ καπυρός, Id.: Sup. - ότατον· καπυρώτατον, κατακεκονδυλωμένον, Id.

small onion, Gp. 12.1.2 ( κρομύδιν codd.), Sch. Opp. H. 3.173.
horn-onion, Thphr. HP 4.6.2.
onion, Allium Cepa, κρομύοιο λοπόν Od. 19.233; κρόμυον ποτῷ ὄψον Il. 11.630, cf. Hdt. 2.125, 4.17; freq. in Ar., Lys. 798, etc.; κελεύω κρόμμυα ἐσθίειν, = κλαίειν κελεύω, Bias ap. D.L. 1.83.

D.), etc.: prob. assim. fr. κρέμμυον, cf. place-name Κρεμμυών B. 17.24, etc.)
a belch of onions and crudities, Ar. Pax 529.

onion-shop, Hsch.

data.quote: τὸν λόφον τὸν ἰν τῷ κρόμποι

children.definition: temple of Cronos, PGrenf. 1.11i16 (ii B. C.).

definition: Κρονιάς, άδος, ἡ, fem. of Κρόνιος: αἱ K. (sc. ἡμέραι), = Saturnalia, Plu. Cic. 18.

children.definition: son of Cronos, i.e. Zeus, Il. 1.498, al.; Ζεὺς K. 2.111, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Lacon. Κρονίδαρ, an aged man, Hsch.

definition: Κρονικός, ή, όν, = sq.; K. ἀστήρ the planet

children.definition: Saturn, AP 11.227 ( Ammian.); ζῴδια Paul.Al. O. 3; K. ἑορτή, = Saturnalia, Plu. Pomp. 34, Porph. Antr. 23; K. λόφος, = Κρόνιον, Pi. O. 5.17; also K. ὄχθος ib. 9.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: old-fashioned, out of date, Ar. Pl. 581, Pl. Ly. 205c ( Comp.); πρᾶγμά τι γιγνόμενον ἀεί, Κρονικόν Alex. 62.2, cf. Com.Adesp. 1052.
λῆμαι, of the short-sighted, Diogenian. 5.63, Hsch.
of Cronos or Saturn, ὦ Κρόνιε παῖ A. Pr. 577, Pi. O. 2.12; K. ἅλς the Adriatic, A.R. 4.327, 509; but K. πόντος the North Sea, Orph. A. 1081.

children.label: b
children.definition: Κρόνιον ὄμμα εἰς τὸν οἶκον ἐνέσκηψε, i.e. disaster, Hld. 2.24.

Κρόνια (sc. ἱερά), τά, festival of Cronos at Athens on the twelfth of Hecatombaeon (hence called μὴν Κρόνιος, Plu. Thes. 12); ὄντων Κρονίων D. 24.26; K. ἐνστάντων Alciphr. 3.57; later, = Lat. Saturnalia, D.H. 4.14, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.272e, etc.
Κρόνιον (sc. ὄρος), τό, the hill of Cronos, near Olympia, Pi. O. 1.111; = Lat. templum Saturni, D.C. 45.17.
Κρόνιον, τό, = δελφίνιον, Ps.- Dsc. 3.73.

children.label: II
children.definition: Κρονίων ὄζειν to smell of the dark ages, Ar. Nu. 398, cf. Sch.ad loc.
an old dotard, Ar. Nu. 1070.
son of Cronos, i.e. Zeus, Il. 1.397, al.; Ζεὺς Κρονίων ib. 502, al.: gen. Κρονίονος only Il. 14.247, Od. 11.620.

children.label: II
children.definition: Κρονιών (sc. μήν), name of a month at Samos, etc., SIG 976.2 (ii B. C.), al. [ Hom. has ῑ in Κρονίων, Κρονίονος, in other cases ῐ: but Tyrt. 2.1, Pi. P. 4.23, etc., use ῐ in Κρονίων.]
Com.Adesp. 1053.
receptacle for old follies, Com.Adesp. 1054.
old twaddler, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.13b, Com.Adesp. 1052.

Cronos, Hes. Th. 137, Op. 111, Il. 8.479, 14.203, A. Pr. 203, Eu. 641; οἷς δὴ βασιλεὺς Κ. ἦν ‘in the golden age’, Cratin. 165; ὁ ἐπὶ Κρόνου βίος Arist. Ath. 16.7.—Later interpreted as, = χρόνος, cf. Arist. Mu. 401a15.

data.quote: οἷς δὴ βασιλεὺς Κ. ἦν ‘in the golden age’,

children.definition: ὁ τοῦ Κ. (sc. ἀστήρ) the planet Saturn, Id. Metaph. 1073b35, Mu. 392a24, 399a11; so later Κρόνος, ὁ, Placit. 2.32.1, Cleom. 2.7; ἡ τοῦ Κ. ἡμέρα Saturday, D.C. 37.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: a dotard, old fool, Ar. Nu. 929, V. 1480, Pl. Euthd. 287b, Hyp. Fr. 252.
Gloss.
father of Cronos, epith. of Uranos in Orph. H. 4.8.
κρόπιον, τό, two-edged axe, Id. (cf. κρώπιον).

definition: κροσός, Rhod. for κρωσσός, Chron.Lind. B. 9.

children.definition: = stepped copings of parapets, κρόσσας μὲν πύργων ἔρυον καὶ ἔρειπον ἐπάλξεις Il. 12.258; κροσσάων ἐπέβαινον ib. 444 (expld. by Aristarch. as scaling ladders).

data.quote: κρόσσας μὲν πύργων ἔρυον καὶ ἔρειπον ἐπάλξεις

children.definition: courses, steps of the Pyramids, Hdt. 2.125.

definition: κροσσίον, τό, Dim. of sq., Hdn. Epim. 72.

children.definition: tassels, fringe, Poll. 7.64, Hsch.; lappets, θώρακος Gal. 18(1).818.

definition: κροσσόω, assumed as etym. of sq., EM 541.8, Et.Gud. 349.33.
κροσσωτός, ή, όν, also ός, όν Lyc. 1102:—

children.definition: tasselled, fringed, l.c., Plu. Luc. 28, Poll. 4.120, POxy. 1273.14 (iii A. D.): Subst. κροσσωτός (sc. χιτών), ὁ, LXX Ps. 44(45).14; cf. κροκωτός 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: κρόσσαι) stepped, σταυροῖσι -ωτὴ πτέρυξ, of a wall, Lyc. 291 ( v.l. κορσ-).
Hsch. κρόστινα· φυλακτήρια, Id.

definition: κροταίνω, poet. collat.form of κροτέω, Opp. C. 4.247.

children.definition: ear-rings with pendants of pearl, which rattled against each other, Petron. 67, Plin. HN 9.114.
use rattles or castanets, τινὲς τῶν γυναικῶν, κρόταλα ἔχουσαι, κροταλίζουσι Hdt. 2.60: hence ἵπποι κείνʼ ὄχεα κροτάλιζον rattled them along, Il. 11.160.

data.quote: τινὲς τῶν γυναικῶν, κρόταλα ἔχουσαι, κροταλίζουσι

children.label: II
children.definition: clap, applaud, Anaxil. 2, D.Chr. 31.162, Alciphr. 2.4:— Pass., Ath. 4.159e, 11.503f.
applause, Gloss.
female castanet-player, Sammelb. 6945 (iii A. D.); Lat. crotalistria, of the stork, from the noise made by its mandibles, Publilius ap. Petron. 55.

definition: κροταλιστρίς, ίδος, ἡ, = foreg., POxy. 475.17, 24 (ii A. D.).

children.definition: clapper, used in the worship of Cybele, h.Hom. 14.3, Pi. Fr. 79, Hdt. 2.60, Arist. Mir. 839a1; of Dionysus, E. Hel. 1308 (lyr.), cf. Cyc. 205: generally, in dances, AP 5.174 ( Mel.), 11.195 ( Diosc.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ‘rattle’, Ar. Nu. 260, 448 (anap.); οἶδʼ ἄνδρα, κρόταλον δριμύ E. Cyc. 104.

children.label: III
children.definition: narcissus, Eumach. ap. Ath. 15.681e.

children.label: IV
children.definition: κόρταλος σημαίνει τὸν κρότον τῆς ψυχῆς EM post κορυθαίολος (cod. Voss.); κορτάλων is perh. required by the metre in E. Hyps.Fr. 1 ii 9 (lyr.).
strike on the temples, PLips. 40 iii 24 (iv/v A. D.).
on or of the temples, Gal. 14.720.
pointed hammer, resembling the κέστρα, IG 2(2).1672.120, Poll. 10.147.
one who strikes on the temples, Gloss., Hsch. s.v. κόβαλος.
temporal muscle, Hp. Art. 30, Gal. UP 16.6, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.16.2, Arch.Pap. 4.270 (iii A. D.):—fem. κροτᾰφ-ίτιδες πληγαί blows on the temples, Hp. l.c.

side of the forehead, Il. 4.502, 20.397, Ar. Ra. 854: mostly in pl., temples, Il. 13.188, al., Hdt. 4.187, Hp. Prog. 2, etc.; πρᾶτον ἴουλον ἀπὸ κροτάφων καταβάλλων Theoc. 15.85, cf. 11.9, IG 5(1).1355 ( Abia); τοὺς κ. πολιοῦνται πρῶτον Arist. GA 784b35.
side edge, profile, Procl. Hyp. 3.6; κύκλου ib. 17; of a brick, PMag.Par. 1.30; κατὰ κρόταφον sideways, horizontally, Hero Bel. 98.2, Ph. Bel. 64.25, cf. 60.7; ἐπὶ κρορόταφον on its side, ib. 66.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: slope of a mountain, A. Pr. 721; ὑπὸ κροτάφοις Ἑλικῶνος Philiadas ap. St.Byz. s.v. Θέσπεια.

children.label: III
children.definition: back of a book, Anon. ap. Suid.

children.label: IV
children.definition: edge or narrow side of a stele, IG 42(1).109 iii 162, iv 129 (Epid.). ( κόρταφος EM 541.23, Et.Gud., Zonar., prob. to be read in Pl.Com. 84; κότραφος PMag.Osl. 1.152, etc.)

definition: κροτέω, poet. κορτέω Hsch., cf. ἀνακροτέω: ( κρότος):—

children.definition: make to rattle, of horses, ὄχεα κροτέοντες rattling them along, Il. 15.453, cf. h.Ap. 234.

children.label: II
children.definition: knock, strike, λέβητας Hdt. 6.58; θύρσῳ γῆν E. Ba. 188; τοῖς ἀγκῶσι τὰς πλευράς D. 54.9; τινα Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10d: sens. obsc., IG 12(7).414 (Amorgos, cf. διακροτέω 1):— Pass., to be beaten by rain, Ael. NA 16.17.

clap in sign of applause, κ. τὰς χεῖρας, τὼ χεῖρε, Hdt. 2.60, X. Cyr. 8.4.12; ταῖς χερσί Thphr. Char. 19.10: abs., applaud, X. Smp. 9.4, D. 21.226, etc.; ἐν θεάτρῳ Thphr. Char. 11.3: c.acc., κ. τινά D.L. 7.173:— Pass., Arist. Po. 1456a10 (sed leg. κρατεῖσθαι), Pl. Ax. 368d, etc.; τέλειος ῥήτωρ καὶ κεκροτημένος Phld. Rh. 2.128 S.; παρὰ Ὁμήρῳ κεκρότηται τὰ σώφρονα συμπόσια are commended, Ath. 5.182a (sed leg. <συγ>κεκρ.).

children.label: b
children.definition: Plu. Vit.pud. 2.533a.
κ. ὀδόντας gnash the teeth, Archil. Supp. 2.9.

hammer, weld together, Luc. Lex. 9: metaph., in Pass., to be wrought, κεκρότηται χρυσέα κρηπίς Pi. Fr. 194, cf. Lyc. 888: hence ἐξ ἀπάτας κεκροτημένοι ἄνδρες one mass of trickery, Theoc. 15.49; εὐθὺς τὸ πρῆγμα κροτείσθω ‘strike while the iron is hot’, AP 10.20 ( Adaeus).

rattle, clash, χαλκώματα Plu. Fac.lun. 2.944b: c. dat., κ. ὀστράκοις καὶ ψήφοις make a rattling noise with them, in order to collect a swarm of bees, Arist. HA 627a16; κ. κυμβάλοις Luc. Alex. 9; satirically, ἡ τοῖς ὀστράκοις κροτοῦσα [Μοῦσʼ Εὐριπίδου] Ar. Ra. 1306, cf. Ael. NA 2.11.
strike the woof home with the weaverʼs sley, σινδόνες λίαν κεκροτημέναι close-woven, Str. 15.1.67.
work wrought with the hammer: metaph., of Odysseus, ‘piece of mischief’, S. Fr. 913, E. Rh. 499.
with chattering teeth, Cerc. 6.4.
clapping, striking, χειρῶν, as a sign of grief, Pl. Ax. 365a; [ σιδήρου] Ph. Bel. 71.44 (pl.); τοῦ πνεύματος D.H. Comp. 14 (v.l. for κροῦσις).
plausible, αἴτησις Dosith. p.427 K.
stricken, sounding with blows, κάρα A. Ch. 428.
κ. ἅρματα rattling, bumping chariots, S. El. 714; κροτητὰ πηκτίδων μέλη music struck from the harp, Id. Fr. 241.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὰ κροτητά,
cakes of some kind, E. Fr. 467.4.
much-trodden places, Thphr. HP 6.6.10.
loud applause, Epicur. Fr. 143, Plu. Aud. 2.45f, Col. 1117a, Eun. Hist. p.259 D.

rattling noise, made to collect a swarm of bees, Arist. HA 627a16; κ. ποδῶν beat of the feet in dancing, E. Heracl. 783 (pl.), Tr. 546 both lyr.); κ. σικινίδων Id. Cyc. 37; ὁ τῶν δακτύλων κ. snapping of the fingers, Ael. NA 17.5; ἐνόπλιος κ. clash of arms, Plu. Mar. 22; ὁ κ. τῶν λόγων Luc. Dem.Enc. 15 (but perh. ‘weldingʼ); ἡ εὔροια καὶ ὁ τῆς γλώσσης κ. Philostr. VS 2.25.6; ῥυθμοῖο κ. APl. 16.226 ( Alc. Mess.).

data.quote: ἡ εὔροια καὶ ὁ τῆς γλώσσης κ.

children.definition: κ. χειρῶν clapping of hands, applause, Ar. Ra. 157: abs., X. An. 6.1.13, etc.; θόρυβον καὶ κ . . . ἐποιήσατε D. 21.14, cf. 19.195.

children.label: b
children.definition: γέλως καὶ κ. Pl. La. 184a.
tick, Ixodes ricinus, Arist. HA 552a15, Agatharch. 58, Dsc. 1.77, Plu. Adul. 2.55e: prov., ὑγιέστερος κροτῶνος Men. 318 (but Str. 6.1.12 has Κρότωνος).

children.label: II
children.definition: castor-oil tree, Ricinus communis (cf. κίκι), Hp. Mul. 2.201, Thphr. HP 1.10.1, 3.18.7, PRev.Laws 39.3, al. (iii B. C.), etc.
seeds of the tree, PCair.Zen. 499.10 (iii B. C.); in full, κ. κίκεως Gal. 19.743.

children.label: III
children.definition: part of the ear, Poll. 2.85. ( Hdn. Gr. 1.36 distinguishes κροτών from Κρότων the place-name.)
excrescence on trees, esp. on the olive, = γόγγρος II, Thphr. HP 1.8.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: fragments of bronchial cartilage, Hp. Morb. 2.53, cf. Gal. 19.115.
Hp. Nat.Mul. 32.
bearing castor-oil plants, [ γῆ] Sammelb. 6797.16, al. (iii B. C.), PPetr. 2p.110 (= 3p.69) (iii B. C.).

definition: κρουεροῦ τοῦ φοβεροῖ, Hsch.; cf. κρυερός.

children.definition: beat, stroke, Ar. Ec. 257 (sens. obsc.):— also κροῦσμα AP 6.27 ( Theaet.), Poet. de herb. 121, Porph. Abst. 1.43; κρούσμασι καὶ στρέμμασι blows and sprains, Paul.Aeg. 3.78, cf. Poll. 2.199.

sound produced by striking stringed instruments with the plectron, note, κρούεται τὰ κρούματα . . , τὰ μὲν ἄνω, τὰ δὲ κάτω Hp. Vict. 1.18, cf. Ar. Th. 120 (lyr.), Pl. R. 333b, Min. 317d, etc.; τὸ πόημα οὐχ ὡς τερέτισμα καὶ κ. νοοῦμεν Phld. Po. 2p.228H.; also of wind instruments, κρούματα τὰ αὐλήματα καλοῦσιν Plu. QConv. 2.638c, cf. Poll. 4.83, 7.88; σαλπιστικὰ κ. Id. 4.84; τοιαῦτα . . νιγλαρεύων κ. Eup. 110; αὐλεῖ . . σαπρὰ κ. Theopomp.Com. 50; ἡ τοῦ κρούματος ἁρμονία the melody (on the pan-pipes), Ach.Tat. 8.6, cf. APl. 16.8 ( Alc. Mess.); so, musical air, melody, BGU 1125.4 (i B. C.); ᾠδαὶ καὶ κ. Jul. Or. 2.49d:—also κροῦσμα, AP 5.291.8 ( Agath.).

data.quote: κρούεται τὰ κρούματα . . , τὰ μὲν ἄνω, τὰ δὲ κάτω
τὸ πόημα οὐχ ὡς τερέτισμα καὶ κ. νοοῦμεν

children.definition: of or for playing on a stringed instrument, σοφίη AP 11.352.2 ( Agath.): in a general sense, ἡ κ. μουσικὴ ἡ διὰ τῶν αὐλῶν Suid. s.v. Ὄλυμπος; διάλεκτος κ. style in playing, Plu. Mus. 2.1138b; λέξεις κρουσματικαί sounds of music, i.e. inarticulate sounds without sense, Plb. 3.36.3.
Dim. of κροῦμα, musical phrase, Ach.Tat. 1.5, Sch. Ar. Eq. 276, Pl. 290.
musician, Macho ap. Ath. 8.337c, Aristodem. 8; composer of instrumental music, Phld. Mus. pp. 95,99 K.

definition: κροῦναι τὰ ἄφορα δένδρα, Hsch.; also,

children.definition: drinking vessel, Epig. 6.
like a spring, gushing, LXX 2 Ma. 14.45, Ph. 2.96, Harp.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).136.
discharge liquid in a slender stream, of the ῥυτόν (q.v.), κ. λεπτῶς Doroth. ap. Ath. 11.497e:— Med., catch the liquid so running in oneʼs mouth, Epin. 2.3.

definition: κρουνίον, τό, Dim. of κρουνός, Hdn.Gr. 1.356, 360.

children.definition: cock, tap of the clepsydra, Sch. Luc. Pisc. 28.
gush, stream, APl. 16.12.
small nozzle or spout, Hero Spir. 1.8; small pipe, ib. 29.
gushing out of water, Aq. 2 Ki. 5.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: douche, Aët. 5.119, Paul.Aeg. 2.52.

definition: κρουνίτης [ ῑ], ου, ὁ, fem. κρουν-ῖτις, ιδος,

children.definition: of springs, Νύμφαι Orph. H. 51.10.

spring, well head, whence streams ( πηγαί) issue, Il. 22.147, 208; χείμαρροι ποταμοὶ . . κρουνῶν ἐκ μεγάλων 4.454, cf. Pi. O. 13.63, Men. 530.22, PLond. 3.1177.290 (ii A. D.), etc.; κρουνοὶ κρηναίου ποτοῦ S. Tr. 14.

κ. αἵματος E. Rh. 790, cf. Hec. 568; κρουνοὶ Ἁφαίστοιο streams of lava from Etna, Pi. P. 1.25; of streaming perspiration, Hp. Aph. 7.85, Lib. Ep. 316.3: metaph., torrent of words, θαρρῶν τὸν κ. ἀφίει Ar. Ra. 1005.
watercourse, Str. 5.3.8.
spout, nozzle, Hero Spir. 2.25, al.
pourer forth of washy twaddle, with collat.notion of water-drinker, Com.word in Ar. Eq. 89.
κ. βρότειον Emp. 6.3.
high wooden shoes, used in Boeotia for treading olives, and worn on the stage by flute-players to beat time, Paus.Gr. Fr. 239, Poll. 7.87 (sg.), Phot.:—also κρούπαλα, τά, S. Fr. 44; κρούπετα, Hsch.

definition: κρουπέζιον, τό, Dim. of foreg., Poll. 10.153, Hsch.

children.definition: have wooden shoes on, Hsch.
wearing wooden shoes, of the Boeotians, Cratin. 310.
cheat the people, Ar. Eq. 859.
knocking at the door: τὸ κ. (sc. μέλος) serenade, Trypho ap. Ath. 14.618c.
striking the lyre, Orph. H. 31.3.
cheat in measuring corn, by striking off too much from the top of the measure, Hsch., Poll. 4.169.
false measurer, cheat, Sch. Ar. Nu. 450.
striking, smiting, collision, αἱ πρὸς ἀλλήλας κ., of atoms, Epicur. Nat.Herc. 1431.16; ἡ πρὸς ἄλληλα κ. τῶν ὅπλων Plu. Aem. 32; ποδὸς κρούσει χρώμενος spurring with the heel, of a rider, Id. Alex. 6.

data.quote: ἡ πρὸς ἄλληλα κ. τῶν ὅπλων

children.definition: tapping or ringing of earthen vessels, to see whether they are sound: hence, generally, scrutiny, Suid.
attempts to deceive, chicanery, Ar. Nu. 318.

playing on a stringed instrument, Plu. Per. 15, 2.1137b, etc.: generally, instrumental music, Plb. 30.22.5; κρούσεις καὶ μέλη Phld. Mus. p.13 K.; παρὰ τὴν κροῦσιν λέγειν, of the recitative, ᾄδειν, of the air sung to the accompaniment of instrumental music, Plu. Mus. 2.1141a; κ. ἡ ὑπὸ τὴν ᾠδήν heterophone accompaniment, ib. b.
Procl. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.320 B.

children.label: II
children.definition: κ. ὀδόντων gnashing of teeth, Aus. Ep. 8.8.
one must knock at, τηνδεδί (sc. θύραν) Ar. Ec. 989.
= Lat. petulcus, Dosith. p.397 K.
fit for striking, butting, of a ram, Ph. 1.113.

children.label: II
children.definition: able to sound the right note, ὄργανα Arist. Pr. 918a33; κ. θίξις χορδῶν, opp. ἠθική, Plu. Praec. 2.802f.
striking, impressive, Ar. Eq. 1379; τὸ κ. striking eloquence, Luc. Dem.Enc. 32.
played by striking, ὄργανα Nicom. Harm. 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: κρουστὰ γράμματα· ἀπὸ τοῦ παρακρούεσθαι καὶ μὴ εὐθέως λέγειν, Phot.

definition: κρουτεῖται κοκκίζει, Hsch. κρουφάδαν, v. κρυφάδην.

κρούω, fut. - σω E. El. 180: aor. ἔκρουσα X. An. 4.5.18, Hyp. Fr. 201: pf. κέκρουκα Diogenian. 3.38, ( ἐκ-) Pl. Phdr. 228e, ( προσ-) D. 21.206:— Med., aor. ἐκρουσάμην Th. 7.40:— Pass., aor. ἐκρούσθην Eratosth. Cat. 32: pf. κέκρουμαι ( ἀπο-) X. HG 7.4.26, or - ουσμαι ( ἀπο-) Ar. Ach. 459:—

children.definition: strike, smite, ῥυτῆρι κ. γλουτόν S. Fr. 501; κρούσας δὲ πλευρὰ [τῶν ἵππων] E. Fr. 779.6; τὸν λυχνοῦχον Lys. Fr. 83; τοῖς ποσὶ τὴν γῆν Arr. An. 7.1.5; also εἰς τὴν χεῖρα τοῖς δακτύλοις κ. with the fingers, D.C. 40.16: metaph., κνῖσα κ. ῥινὸς ὑπεροχάς tickles, Ephipp. 3.3.

strike one against another, strike together, κ. χεῖρας clap the hands, E. Supp. 720; τὰ ὅπλα κρουόμενα πρὸς ἄλληλα Th. 3.22; τὰς ἀσπίδας πρὸς τὰ δόρατα X. An. l.c.: metaph., ἀλλήλων τοὺς λόγους τοῖς λόγοις ἐκρούομεν ἄν would have knocked their heads together, Pl. Tht. 154e.
κ. πόδα (i.e. κ. τὴν γῆν τῷ ποδί), in dancing, E. El. l.c. (lyr.); ἴχνος ἐν γᾷ κ. Id. IA 1043 (lyr.).

tapping an earthen vessel, to try whether it rings sound (cf. κροῦσις 2): examine, try, prove, κρούετε ἀπολαμβάνοντες τὸ καλόν Pl. Hp.Ma. 301b; κἂν διαπειρώμενος κρούσῃς [τὸν κόλακα] Plu. Adul. 2.64d.

strike a stringed instrument with a plectron, Simon. 183, Pl. Ly. 209b: generally, play any instrument (v. κροῦμα, κρουματικός) , αὐλεῖ . . κρούων ἰαστί Com.Adesp. 415: c. dat., κ. κρεμβάλοις, = κρεμβαλίζειν, Ath. 14.636d.

κ. τὴν θύραν knock at the door on the outside, Ar. Ec. 317, 990 (with play on signf. 8), X. Smp. 1.11, Pl. Prt. 310b, 314d, etc.; κόπτειν is better Att. acc.to Phryn. 154; later κ. ἐπὶ τὴν θύραν LXX Jd. 19.22.
κ. σταθμὸν ἑτερόζυγον, = κρουσιμετρέω, Ps.-Phoc. 15; ὡς μήτε κρούσῃς μήθʼ ὑπὲρ χεῖλος βάλῃς S. Fr. 796; κρούων γε μὴν αὐτὰς ἐωνούμην Eup. 184.

data.quote: ὡς μήτε κρούσῃς μήθʼ ὑπὲρ χεῖλος βάλῃς

children.definition: AB 101, cf. Ar. Ec. 990; κ. πέπλον E. Cyc. 328.

Med., κρούεσθαι πρύμναν back water, Th. 1.51, 54, 3.78; αἱ πρύμναν κρουόμεναι νῆες Arr. An. 5.17.7 (also in Act., Plb. 16.3.8); κ. ἐπὶ π. τὴν ναῦν App. BC 5.119: hence κρούεσθαι τὸ πτερόν fly backwards, Ael. NA 3.13:—also in Act., Plot. 2.9.18.
κρούειν ἀκράτῳ, v. πατάσσω II.2. (Cf. Lith. krùšti ‘bruise’, ‘pound’, Lett. krausēt ‘thresh’.)
Theognost. Can. 21 (cf. Archil. 176).
Hsch.:—hence κρῠβ-αστός, - κρυπτός, prob.l. for κυρβαστός, EM 547.46.

definition: κρύβακτος, ὁ, dub. sens. in Stud.Pal. 20.230.8 (iv A.D.).

children.definition: without the knowledge of, c. gen., κ. Διός Il. 18.168; Ὀρέστου κ. A. Ch. 177.
secretly, Pi. P. 4.114.
secretly, Od. 11.455, 16.153, Hp. Mul. 1.54, Ar. V. 1018, etc.; κ. ψηφίζεσθαι Lex ap. And. 1.87, cf. Lys. 12.91, Pl. Lg. 766b, Arist. Rh.Al. 1433a23, IG 2(2).1237.82.
= foreg. 1, κ. πατρός Pi. P. 3.13.
v.l. in LXX 2 Ki. 12.12, cf. 3 Ma. 4.12, POxy. 83.14 (iv A.D.):—also κρυβ-ήν, Corp.Herm. 13.1 (s.v.l.).
hidden, Hsch.:—also κρυβ-ήτης, ου, ὁ, one hidden in the earth, and κρυβ-ήσια, τά, = νεκύσια, Id.

definition: κρύβω, late form of κρύπτω, Conon 50.2, Phlp. in APr. 448.17, PMag.Par. 1.385, PMag.Leid.V. 10.10, Gp. 2.24.2, Sch. E. Hec. 739:— Pass., LXX 4 Ki. 11.3, al. (also v.l. in Hp. Mul. 2.154); mostly found in compds.
κρυερός, ά, όν, but ἀρῆς κρυεροῖο Hes. Th. 657: ( κρύος):—

children.definition: icy, cold, chilling, in Hom. only metaph., κρυεροῖο γόοιο Od. 4.103, al.; κμυεροῖο φόβοιο Il. 13.48; κρυεροῦ Ἀΐδαο Hes. Op. 153; θανάτου τελευτή E. Fr. 916.6 (anap.); πάθεα Ar. Ach. 1191 (lyr.); θάλαμος, of the grave, Epigr.Gr. 241.4 ( Smyrna): in the lit. sense, icy-cold, κ. νέκυς Simon. 114.5, cf. Ar. Av. 951, 955, Hdn. 1.6.1, etc.
make cold, Hdn. Epim. 75.
icy, chilly, Heraclit. All. 50, S.E. M. 9.83.

definition: κρυμνός, κρῡμ-νώδης, dub. forms for κρυμός, κρυμώδης (qq. v.).

children.definition: frost-congealing, Βορέης Orph. H. 80.2.
icy cold, frost, Hdt. 4.8, 28, etc.; ἀνὰ κρυμόν in frost, Nic. Th. 681: in pl., κατὰ τοὺς κρυμούς Str. 11.2.8, cf. D.H. 1.37, Onos. 10.5, Polyaen. 3.9.34, Ael. NA 2.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: chill, cold fit, S. Fr. 507, Hp. Morb. 4.53, Call. Aet. 3.1.19 [Fr. 75.19 Pf.] (nisi leg. καυμός), Ruf. ap. Orib. 45.30.21; κ. χολῆς E. Fr. 682, cf. Dsc. 3.53 (pl.). ( κρυμνὸς ἢ κρυμός, Hsch.)
delighting in frost, f.l. in Orph. H. 51.13 for δρυμο-.
icy-cold, frozen, Hp. Vict. 2.65 ( κρυμν- codd.), D.P. 780, Men.Prot. p.47 D.; Ἄλπεις AP 9.561 ( Phil.): Comp., Ph. 2.298, Metop. ap. Stob. 3.1.116: Sup., Ael. NA 3.13.
to be stiff with cold, Theognost. Can. 21.

chilling, in metaph. sense, φόβου κρυόεντος Il. 9.2; κρυόεσσα Ἰωκή 5.740; ἐν πολέμῳ κρυόεντι Hes. Th. 936; συντυχία Pi. I. 1.37: later in lit. sense, icy-cold, ἅλς, πάγος, A.R. 1.918, AP 6.221 ( Leon.); Τάρταρος Orph. Fr. 222; of Saturn, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.172; cf. ὀκρυόεις.
to be icy-cold, κρυοῦται it freezes, Gloss.
icy cold, frost, Hes. Op. 494, Pl. Ax. 368c, Jul. Or. 6.181d; κ. ἰσχυρόν Arist. Mete. 367a22: metaph., κακόν με καρδίαν τι περιπίτνει κρύος A. Th. 834, cf. Eu. 161 (both lyr.).

data.quote: κακόν με καρδίαν τι περιπίτνει κρύος

children.label: II
children.definition: κ., ὁ, = κρύσταλλος, Sch. Ar. Nu. 766. (Cf. Lat. crusta.)

definition: κρυπτάδιος [ ᾰ], α, ον (and ος, ον A. Ch. 946 (lyr.)),

children.definition: secret, clandestine, κρυπταδίῃ φιλότητι Il. 6.161; κρυπταδίου μάχας A. l.c.; κρυπτάδια φρονέοντα Il. 1.542. Regul. Adv. - ίως Man. 2.195, 6.182.
secret service at Sparta, Pl. Lg. 633b; employed against the Helots, Arist. Fr. 538; ὁ ἐπὶ τῆς κ. τεταγμένος Plu. Cleom. 28.

children.label: II
children.definition: hiding-place, Agath. 5.19 (pl.).
one must hide, S. Ant. 273, AP 5.251 ( Paul.Sil.).
hide oneself, lie concealed, E. Ba. 888 (lyr.), X. Cyr. 4.5.5:— Pass., = ἐνεδρεύομαι (cf. Hsch.), E. Hel. 541.
crypt, vault, Callix. 1.

definition: κρυπτήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq., τόποι Sch. Opp. H. 3.235.

children.definition: convenient for concealing, ἄντρον Orac. ap. Paus. 8.42.6; κρυπτήριον, τό, dungeon, prob.l. in E. Cret. 48.
member of the Spartan κρυπτεία, E. Fr. 1126 (s.v.l.).
obscuring, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 528.12, 530.1. Adv. -κῶς, πυνθάνεσθαι Arist. Top. 156a14; εἰπεῖν Alex.Aphr. in SE 100.10.
hide-and-seek, Theognost. Can. 15.
with undescended testicles, PSI 3.252.25 ( iii A.D.).

hidden, secret, κληῗδι κρυπτῇ Il. 14.168, cf. Ar. Th. 422; ἐπεποίητό οἱ κ. διῶρυξ Hdt. 3.146; κ. τάφρος a trench covered and concealed by planks and earth, Id. 4.201: freq. in Trag., κ. λόγος A. Ch. 773; ἔπη S. Ph. 1112 (lyr.); κρυπτᾷ ἐν ἥβᾳ, of young Orestes who was concealed in Phocis, Id. El. 159 (lyr.); κ. πένθος E. Hipp. 139 (lyr.), etc.; κρυπτῇ ψήφῳ Arist. Rh.Al. 1424b1; τῆς πολιτείας τὸ κ. the secret character of the [Spartan] institutions, Th. 5.68; ἡ κρυπτή (sc. ἀρχή) secret service, used by the Athenians in the subjectstates, AB 273; also, = κρυπτεία I, Heraclid. Pol. 10; of persons, in disguise, Ar. Th. 600, E. El. 525: Medic., deep-seated, καρκίνος Hp. Aph. 6.38, Mul. 2.133, Gal. 5.116; κ. πάθος BGU 316.28 (iv A.D.).

definition: κρύπτω, Ep. Iterat. κρύπτασκε Il. 8.272, - εσκε h.Cer. 239: fut. κρύψω Od. 4.350, etc.: aor.1 ἔκρυψα, Ep. κρύψα 11.244: pf. κέκρῠφα ( συγ-) D.H. Comp. 18:— Med., fut. κρύψομαι S. Tr. 474, E. Ba. 955: aor. ἐκρυψάμην S. Aj. 246 (lyr.), etc.:— Pass., fut. κρυφθήσομαι Dialex. 2.4, κρῠβήσομαι E. Supp. 543, LXX Je. 39(32).27, κεκρύψομαι Hp. Mul. 1.36: aor. ἐκρύφθην, Ep. κρ-, Il. 13.405, E. Ba. 955, ἐκρύβην [ῠ] Ev.Jo. 8.59, Aesop. 127, Apollod. 3.2.2, ( κατ-) Alciphr. 3.47; part. κρῠφείς S. Aj. 1145: pf. κέκρυμμαι Od. 11.443, Pi. O. 7.57, etc.; Ion. 3 pl. κεκρύφαται Hes. Th. 730, Hp. Mul. 2.163:—

children.definition: hide, cover, in Hom. with collat. notion of protection, κεφαλὰς . . κορύθεσσι κρύψαντες Il. 14.373; ὁ δέ μιν σάκεϊ κρύπτασκε φαεινῷ 8.272, cf. 13.405 ( Pass.); κ. με . . πόδα S. OC 114; later, simply, hide, κ. φάος ὀμμάτων Pi. N. 10.40; cover, τινά τινι A. Eu. 461, etc.; ὑφʼ εἵματος κ. χεῖρα E. Hec. 343:— Med., κάρα κρυψάμενος having cloaked his head, S. Aj. 246 (lyr.); φύει τʼ ἄδηλα καὶ φανέντα κρύπτεται hides in its own bosom, ib. 647; παῖδά μʼ ἐκρύψατο κρωσσός IG 14.1909:— Pass., hide oneself, lie hidden, οὐρανῷ κρύπτεται E. Hel. 606; δαλὸς κρύπτεται ἐς σποδιάν Id. Cyc. 615 (lyr.); ὑφʼ εἵματος κρυφείς S. Aj. 1145: c. acc. cogn., κρύψει σὺ κρύψιν ἥν σε κρυφθῆναι χρεών E. Ba. l.c.

data.quote: ὁ δέ μιν σάκεϊ κρύπτασκε φαεινῷ
κρύψει σὺ κρύψιν ἥν σε κρυφθῆναι χρεών

children.definition: cover in the earth, bury, Hes. Op. 138, S. OC 621 ( Pass.); χθονί ib. 1546 ( Pass.); τάφῳ Id. Ant. 196; ἐν κατώρυχι ib. 774; κατὰ χθονός ib. 25; ὑπὸ γᾶν Pi. P. 9.81; γῇ κ. Hdt. 2.130 ( Pass.), cf. S. Ant. 946 (lyr., Pass.):— Pass., Τιτῆνες ὑπὸ ζόφῳ . . κεκρύφαται Hes. Th. l.c.; ἐν βένθεσιν νᾶσον κεκρύφθαι Pi. O. l.c.
occult, Theo Sm. p.193 H., al.:— Pass., of stars not seen in any part of the night, κεκρύφαται Hes. Op. 386; of the heliacal setting of stars, Ptol. Phas. p.8 H.

conceal, keep secret, οὐδέν τοι ἐγὼ κρύψω ἔπος Od. 4.350, cf. Ar. Th. 74, etc.; κ. τι ἔνθα μή τις ὄψεται S. Aj. 658, cf. Tr. 903, El. 436:— Med., πᾶν σοι φράσω τἀληθές, οὐδὲ κρύψομαι Id. Tr. 474:— Pass., τὸ μὲν φάσθαι, τὸ δὲ καὶ κεκρυμμένον εἶναι Od. 11.443; φάρμακα κεκρ. secret, E. Andr. 32; κεκρ. νάπη secret, S. OT 1398; κεκρ. παγίς Men. 689; κεκρ. σκευωρία secret intrigue, Mitteis Chr. 31 vi 14 (ii B.C.); κρυπτόμενα πράσσεται in secret, opp. ἐπὶ μαρτύρων, Antipho 2.3.8, cf. Th. 6.72.

data.quote: κ. τι ἔνθα μή τις ὄψεται
πᾶν σοι φράσω τἀληθές, οὐδὲ κρύψομαι
τὸ μὲν φάσθαι, τὸ δὲ καὶ κεκρυμμένον εἶναι

children.label: b
children.definition: connive at, S. El. 825 (lyr.).
conceal something from one, μή με κρύψῃ τοῦτο A. Pr. 625, cf. S. El. 957, E. Hec. 570, Ar. Pl. 26, Lys. 32.7, etc.; so κ. τι πρός τινα S. Ph. 588.
argue so that the opponent is unwarily led to an adverse conclusion, Arist. Top. 156a7.
Pass., to be suppressed, of the menses or lochia, Hp. Mul. 1.36, 154, 2.163.

children.label: II
children.definition: lie hidden, τὰ μὲν . . ὄμματα βλέποντα, τὰ δὲ κρύπτοντα E. Ph. 1117 (s.v.l.); also κ. τινά conceal oneself from . . , h.Hom. 1.7.— ( καλύπτω is simply cover; κεύθω cover so that no trace of it can be seen; κρύπτω keep covered, esp. for purposes of concealment.)

data.quote: τὰ μὲν . . ὄμματα βλέποντα, τὰ δὲ κρύπτοντα

children.definition: to be congealed with cold, freeze, Nic. Al. 314.
to be clear as crystal, Apoc. 21.11.
icy, χεῖρες Hp. Epid. 7.25.

children.label: II
children.definition: of crystal, κύλιξ D.C. 54.23; νίπτρα AP 9.330 ( Nicarch.).
Dsc. 4.69 ( Sicel).

children.label: II
children.definition: rock-crystal, in pl., PHolm. 11.43, Anon.Alch. p.359 B.
like ice, πῆξις Epicur. Ep. 2p.45U., cf. LXX Wi. 19.21; v.l. for - ώδης in Str. 4.6.6. Adv. -δῶς Placit. 2.11.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: like crystal, ἰασπίς Dsc. 5.142; κ. ὑγρόν the crystalline lens, Ruf. Onom. 153, Gal. UP 8.5, al.; κ. χιτών Poll. 2.71: Astron., τὸ κ. the crystalline sphere, Placit. 2.14.3.
to be frozen, Ph. 2.174, Anon. ap. Gell. 17.8.7.
congealed to ice, frozen, E. Rh. 441:— also κρυσταλλο-πήξ, ῆγος, ὁ, ἡ, A. Pers. 501.
ice, Il. 22.152, Od. 14.477, Hdt. 4.28, S. Fr. 149; κρύσταλλος ἐπεπήγει οὐ βέβαιος Th. 3.23; ὁ παῖς τὸν κρύσταλλον prov., of persons who cannot keep a thing, but do not wish to let it go, Zen. 5.58.
numbness, torpor, Opp. H. 3.155.

children.label: II
children.definition: rock-crystal, D.P. 781, Str. 15.1.67, Ael. NA 15.8, etc.: also fem., AP 9.753 ( Claudian.): as Adj., οἱ κ. λίθοι D.S. 2.52.
of the look or transparency of crystal: κρυσταλλοφανῆ, τά, glass ware, Str. 16.2.25.
icy, glacial, Ptol. Tetr. 94, D.C. 49.31; of water, clear, PHolm. 25.33.
without the knowledge of, c. gen., Th. 1.101.
secretly, Aen.Tact. 2.4; by ballot, Th. 4.88; obscurely, κ. καὶ διʼ αἰνιγμάτων Plu. Col. 2.1125e.

definition: κρυφᾷ, Adv. Dor. for κρυφῇ, Pi. O. 1.47, Fr. 203.
κρυφάδην, Boeot. κρουφάδαν, = foreg., Corinn. Supp. 2.59:—also κρυφ-άδις, Hdn.Gr. 1.512; κρυφ-άδεια, ib. 496.
κρυφαῖος, α, ον, also ος, ον Phld. Piet. 101, Luc. Ocyp. 166:—

children.definition: hidden, Pi. I. 1.67, A. Ch. 83 (lyr.), S. Aj. 899, Pl. Ti. 77c; ἐν κρυφαίοις LXX Je. 23.24, al.
secret, clandestine, δρασμός A. Pers. 360; ἔκπλους ib. 385; ἔπος S. Fr. 935; ἀδικίαι Phld. l.c. Adv. - ως A. Pers. 370, Aen. Tact. 18.8.
a certain throw of the dice, Poll. 7.204.
secretly, in secret, S. Ant. 85, 291, 1254, X. Smp. 5.8, etc.:— Dor. κρῠφᾷ (q.v.); also ἐν κρυφῇ LXX Jd. 4.21, 9.31.

definition: κρυφηδόν, Adv., = foreg., opp. ἀμφαδόν, Od. 14.330, cf. Q.S. 14.60.

children.definition: concealment, hiding, PFlor. 284.8 (vi A.D.).
interpreter of dreams, Aq. Ge. 41.8, al.
secretly, Sch. Ar. Pax 730.
Man. 1.159, al., PMag.Par. 1.1353, PMag.Lond. 122.15, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).185: Comp., Dam. Pr. 275.

definition: κρύφιος [ ῠ], α, ον, also ος, ον E. IT 1328, Th. 7.25:—

children.definition: hidden, concealed, θυμός Pi. P. 1.84; ὄφις S. Ph. 1328.
secret, clandestine, ὀαρισμοί Hes. Op. 789; λέχος S. Tr. 360; εὐναί E. El. 719 (lyr.); ἔρωτες Musae. 1; ψᾶφοι Pi. N. 8.26; κ. εἰσῆλθον E. HF 598. Adv. - ίως Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 9.
occult, Procl. Inst. 121, Dam. Pr. 151; latent, ib. 192, 201. Adv. - ίως ib. 153.
κρύφιε such an one, LXX Ru. 4.1.
κρύφιος, ὁ, fabulous gem, Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 13.4.
κρύφιος, ὁ, title of a grade of initiates in the mysteries of Mithras, CIL 6.751a, 753 (pl.).
secrecy, obscurity, Suid. s.v. ἀδηλία, Sch. Opp. H. 2.258, Sch. E. Ph. 1214.
mysterious, Eust. 1942.62 ( Comp.).
secretly born, Hsch. s.v. κυθηγενέσι.
EM 20.49; cf. κρυφίνους.
Emp. 27.3 (dub.); κρυφὸν θέμεν to throw a cloud over . . , Pi. O. 2.97 ( κρύφιον codd.).

children.label: II
children.definition: lurking-place, LXX 1 Ma. 2.36, 1.53. (On the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.225.)

definition: κρύφω, late form of κρύπτω, only impf., Q.S. 1.393, AP 7.700 ( Diod.), Nonn. D. 7.45, al.

children.definition: secretly born, Orph. H. 50.3.
dwelling in secret places, Orph. H. 51.3 (Casaub. for κρυψίδρομος, running secretly).
keeping a matter secret, Hdn. Epim. 38.
hiding the forehead, Luc. Lex. 7.
hiding oneʼs thoughts, dissembling, X. Cyr. 1.6.27, Gal. 8.362, D.C. 67.1, Eun. Hist. p.254 D.; opp. παρρησιαζόμενος X. Ages. 11.5. Adv. - νως Poll. 4.51.
with concealed longing, EM 543.48.

definition: Κρύψιππος, ὁ, nickname of Chrysippus, D.L. 7.182.

children.definition: pigra, Gloss.

hiding, concealment, κρυφθῆναι κρύψιν E. Ba. 955, cf. Plb. 10.46.3; opp. φάσις, of stars, disappearance below the horizon, Gem. 13.2, al., Ti.Locr. 97b (pl.); occultation, Theo Sm. p.192 H. (pl.); heliacal setting, Metrod. Herc. 831.10, Ptol. Alm. 8.4, Tetr. 4, Theo Sm. p.137 H.; of new moon, Ptol. Tetr. 22; disappearance, Plu. Isid. 2.366d.
suppression, ἐπιμηνίων Gal. 19.495.
concealment of stolen goods, Arist. Rh. 1372a32.
mystery, secret, κρύψιν μεγάλην ἀνυμνοῦντες Dam. Pr. 52bis.
dissembling oneʼs anger, Eust. 54.8.
with undescended testicles, Sor. 1.109.
undescended testicles, Gal. 19.448.
icy, chill, Plu. QConv. 2.653a, Poll. 5.109.
hair-net, Serv.ad Verg. Aen. 4.138, Hdn.Gr. 1.323.
roll or knot of hair on the crown of the head, worn at Athens, κρωβύλον ἀναδούμενοι Th. 1.6, cf. Antiph. 189, Sch. Ar. Nu. 980.
Aeschin. 3.118.
πορνοβοσκός: prov., Κρωβύλου ζεῦγος ‘a precious pair’, Lib. Ep. 91.2, Hsch., etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: tuft of hair on a helmet, X. An. 5.4.13.
like the κρωβύλος, Luc. Lex. 13.

definition: κρῶγμα, ατος, τό, = sq., Hdn. Epim. 73.

children.definition: croaking, cawing of a crow or chough, AP 7.713 ( Antip.), Jul. Mis. 337c (pl.).

croak, of the κορώνη, Hes. Op. 747, cf. Ar. Av. 2, 24, Arat. 953, Luc. Asin. 12, Poll. 5.89; also of other birds, as cranes, Ar. Av. 710; of young halcyons, Luc. VH 2.40; also, of men, croak out, τι Ar. Lys. 506, Pl. 369; of a wagon, creak, groan, Babr. 52.5. (Onomatop.)

definition: κρωκαλέον παιδίον πανοῦργον, Hsch.; cf. κρόκαλον.

children.definition: young pig, Antiph. 215 (dub.).
heap of stones, = κλῶμαξ, Hsch.:—hence κρωμᾰκόεις, = κρημνώδης, Id.; κρωμᾰκωτός, ή, όν, Paphlagon. word, Eust. 330.40. [ κρώμᾱξ, ᾱκος, acc. to Hdn. Gr. (?) in Philol. 39.354.]
scythe, bill-hook, Pherecyd. 154 J.:—in Hsch. κρώβιον ( κρόβ- cod.).
Theognost. Can. 21, Zonar.

definition: κρωσσίον, τό, Dim. of sq., AP 9.272 ( Bianor).

children.definition: water-pail, pitcher, mostly in pl., A. Fr. 96 (anap.), S. OC 478, E. Ion 1173, Cyc. 89: in sg., Theoc. 13.46.
cinerary urn, πένθιμε κρωσσέ Erinn. 5, cf. Mosch. 4.34: also fem., με . . ὀλίγη ἐκρύψατο κ. Epigr.Gr. 697a.

definition: κρωτάνεροι βάναυσοι πολῖται, καὶ ἐξελευθεριῶται, Hsch.
κτά, κταίνω, κτάμεν, κτάμ-εναι, κτάμενος, κτάνε, κτάνθεν, v. κτείνω.

children.definition: murderer, Dosiad. Ara 10.

definition: κτάομαι, Ion. κτέομαι, only as v.l. in Hdt. 8.112: fut. κτήσομαι Archil. 6.4, Thgn. 200, A. Eu. 289, Th. 6.30, Pl. R. 417a, etc. (in pass. sense, Plot. 2.9.15, s.v.l.); κεκτήσομαι A. Th. 1022, E. Ba. 514, Pl. Grg. 467a ( ἐκτήσομαι in La. 192e, and prob. in Emp. 110.4): aor. ἐκτησάμην, Ep. κτ-, Od. 14.4, Pi. Pae. 2.59, etc.: pf. κέκτημαι Hes. Op. 437, etc., ἔκτημαι Il. 9.402, A. Pr. 795, Hdt. 2.44, and sts. in Pl. ( κεκτῄμεθα and ἐκτῆσθαι in following lines, R. 505b, ἐκτῆσθαι τοῦ κεκτῆσθαι ἕνεκα Tht. 198d); Ion. 3 pl. ἐκτέαται Hdt. 4.23; subj. κέκτωμαι Isoc. 3.49, Pl. Lg. 936b; opt. κεκτῄμην, ῇτο, ib. 731c, 742e, κεκτῴμην E. Heracl. 282 codd.: plpf. ἐκεκτήμην And. 1.74, 4.41, Lys. 2.17, etc.; poet. κεκτήμην E. IA 404; Ion. 3 pl. ἔκτηντο Hdt. 2.108; Att. 1 pl. ἐκτήμεθα f.l. in And. 3.37: for fut. and aor. Pass., v. infr. III.

children.label: I
children.definition: pres., impf., fut., and aor.,

procure for oneself, get, acquire, κτήμασι τέρπεσθαι τὰ γέρων ἐκτήσατο Πηλεύς Il. 9.400, etc.; [ οἰκῆας] Od. l.c.; γῆν A. Eu. l.c., cf. Pers. 770; of horses, win (as a prize), Pi. N. 9.52; κτήσασθαι βίον ἀπό τινος to get oneʼs living from a thing, Hdt. 8.106; win favour, and the like, χάριν ἀπό τινος, ἔκ τινος, S. Tr. 471, Ph. 1370; παρά τινος X. Smp. 4.43; τὴν εὔνοιαν τὴν παρὰ τῶν Ἑλλήνων Isoc. 5.68; κ. φίλους, ἑταίρους, S. Aj. 1360, E. Or. 804 (troch.); κτήσασθαι παῖδας ἐξ ὁμοσπόρου Id. IT 696, cf. S. OT 1499, Hdt. 8.105; παῖδας ἐς δόμους κτήσασθαι E. Fr. 491, cf. Supp. 225; πολλάκις δοκεῖ τὸ φυλάξαι τἀγαθὰ τοῦ κτήσασθαι χαλεπώτερον εἶναι D. 1.23.

data.quote: κτήμασι τέρπεσθαι τὰ γέρων ἐκτήσατο Πηλεύς
τὴν εὔνοιαν τὴν παρὰ τῶν Ἑλλήνων
πολλάκις δοκεῖ τὸ φυλάξαι τἀγαθὰ τοῦ κτήσασθαι χαλεπώτερον εἶναι

children.label: b
children.definition: bring upon oneself, αὑτῷ θάνατον S. Aj. 968; incur, θεᾶς ὀργήν ib. 777; κακά Id. El. 1004; ξυμφοράς E. Or. 543; ἔχθραν πρός τινα Th. 1.42; δυσσέβειαν κ. get a name for impiety, S. Ant. 924; κακὸν λόγον πρὸς ἀστῶν E. Heracl. 166, cf. IT 676; ἐκ τῶν πόνων τὰς ἀρετὰς κ. Th. 1.123.

data.quote: ἐκ τῶν πόνων τὰς ἀρετὰς κ.

children.label: c
children.definition: κ. τινὰς πολεμίους make them so, X. An. 5.5.17; οὔ ποτʼ εὔνουν τὴν ἐμὴν κτήσῃ φρένα S. Ph. 1281.

data.quote: οὔ ποτʼ εὔνουν τὴν ἐμὴν κτήσῃ φρένα

children.definition: procure or get for another, ἐμοὶ δʼ ἐκτήσατο κεῖνος Od. 20.265; μέγαν τέκνοις πλοῦτον ἐκτήσω A. Pers. 755 (troch.), cf. X. Oec. 15.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: pf. and plpf. with fut. κεκτήσομαι, to have acquired, i.e. possess, hold (opp. χρῆσθαι, Pl. Euthd. 280d), οὐδʼ ὅσα φασὶν Ἴλιον ἐκτῆσθαι Il. 9.402, cf. X. Cyr. 8.3.46, Pl. Phdr. 260b; ὅπλα μὴ ἐκτῆσθαι Hdt. 1.155, cf. S. Ph. 778; στρατὸν πλεῖστον ἐκτημένοι Hdt. 7.161; κοινὸν ὄμμʼ ἐκτημέναι A. Pr. 795; φωνὴν βάρβαρον κεκτ. Id. Ag. 1051; κεκτ. τινὰ σύμμαχον E. Ba. 1343; κ. κάλλος X. Smp. 1.8; ἀρετήν Pl. Prt. 340e; τέχνην Lys. 24.6; ποίησιν to be master of it, Pl. Lg. 829c: dub. in aor., ἀγορὰς κτησάμενοι having market-places, Hdt. 1.153 (leg. στησάμενοι): with impers. subject, πραγμάτων ἀγῶνας κεκτημένων involving effort, Epicur. Sent. 21:—the diff.between pres.and pf. appears from X. Mem. 1.6.3, ἃ [χρήματα] καὶ κτωμένους εὐφραίνει καὶ κεκτημένους . . ποιεῖ ζῆν: later, pres. in pf. sense, Ev.Luc. 18.12.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἄγος κεκτήσεται θεῶν A. Th. 1022; κακά E. Hel. 272; φθόνον Pl. Lg. 870c.

children.label: c
children.definition: have in store, opp. ἔχω, have in hand, ready for use, ἔχων τε καὶ κεκτημένος . . κακά S. Ant. 1278; ἔχειν τε καὶ κεκτῆσθαι τὸ ψεῦδος Pl. R. 382b. cf. Tht. 197b, 198d, Cra. 393b; κ. ἱμάτιον own, opp. ἔχειν (wear), Id. Tht. 197b.

data.quote: ἔχειν τε καὶ κεκτῆσθαι τὸ ψεῦδος

children.label: d
children.definition: to be a property-owner, τῶν ἐκτημένων ἐν τῇ χώρᾳ SIG 633.73 ( Milet., ii B.C.), cf. 888.15 (iii A.D.).

ὁ κεκτημένος owner, master (esp. of slaves), as Subst., Ar. Pl. 4, etc.; οἱ κ. A. Supp. 337; of a husband, E. IA 715; ἡ κεκτημένη my mistress, S. Fr. 762, Ar. Ec. 1126, Men. Pk. 61, al., cf. Phryn.Com. 48.

children.label: III
children.definition: aor. 1 Pass. ἐκτήθην in pass. sense, to be gotten, ἃ ἐκτήθη Th. 1.123, 2.36; to be obtained as property, δουλόσυνος πρὸς οἶκον κτηθεῖσα E. Hec. 449 (lyr.), cf. D.H. 10.27, etc.: fut. κτηθήσομαι LXX Je. 39 ( 32). 43. ( Act. κτάω very late, PLond. 1.77 (vi A.D.).)
getting wealth, Man. 4.41 (pl.). (Fort. κτεατ-.)
Pi. P. 1.2, Epic. ap. Sch. S. OC 378 ( Antim. (?)); κ. φιλίης, of a child, Epigr.Gr. 388 ( Apamea).

κτέανα, possessions, property, Hes. Op. 315, Sol. 4.12, Pi. O. 3.42, N. 9.32; δημοσίων κ. Xenoph. 2.8; used in lyr. by A. Th. 729, Ag. 1573, E. Ion 490; by S. (?) in hexam. ap. Sch. S. OC 378 (cf. Fr. 242); by Eub. in a mock heroic line, 139: in Prose, Hp. Ep. 27; property in cattle, Theoc. 25.109; cf. κτῆνος:— Hom. only in heterocl. dat. pl. κτεάτεσσι (cf. κτέαρ), Il. 23.829, Od. 14.115, cf. Pi. O. 5.24, E. Fr. 791.3 (hex.): dat. pl. κτεάτοις Hdn.Gr. 2.936. (Cf. Avest. šaēta- ‘property’, ‘wealth’.)

definition: κτέαρ, τό, = foreg., formed as nom. to dat. pl. κτεάτεσσι in later Poetry, Maiist. 33, AP 9.52 ( Carph.), 9.752 ( Asclep. or Antip.Thess.), 11.27 ( Maced.), Q.S. 4.543.
κτεάτειρα [ ᾰτ], ἡ (as if fem. of *κτεᾰτήρ),

children.definition: possessor, Νὺξ μεγάλων κόσμων κ. A. Ag. 356 (anap.).

gain, win, δουρὶ δʼ ἐμῷ κτεάτισσα Il. 16.57; πολλὰ κτεατίσσας Od. 2.102, 19.147, cf. Eumel. 2, etc.: — Med., get for oneself, acquire, Ep. fut. κτεατίσσομαι Man. 6.677, aor. κτεατίσσατο A.R. 2.788: pf. Pass. in med. sense, ὅσʼ Ἑκηβόλος ἐκτεάτισται h.Merc. 522: plpf., ἃ ἐκτεάτιστο Μίδης Call. Aet. 3.1.47 [Fr. 75.47 Pf.]; τὰ δὲ κτεατίζεται αὐτός Theoc. 17.105.

definition: κτείνω, Ep. subj. κτείνωμι Od. 19.490; Aeol. κτέννω Hdn.Gr. 2.303 (and aor. 1 part. κτένναις Alc. 33.5), but κταίνω Id. 140 acc. to Eust. 1648.5 (leg. Ἀλκμᾶνι); Ep. Iterat. κτείνεσκε Il. 24.393: fut. κτενῶ, Ep. κτενέω Od. 16.404, - έεις Il. 22.13, - έει ib. 124, al. ( κτενεῖ 15.65, 68), part. κτανέοντα only 18.309 (but in compos. κατα-κτανέουσιν 6.409): aor. 1 ἔκτεινα 19.296, etc.: aor. 2 ἔκτᾰνον 2.701, etc.: pf.not found uncompounded: plpf. ἀπ-εκτονήκειν Plu. Tim. 16:— Pass., fut. κτανθήσομαι Sch.T Il. 14.481: Ep. 3 pl. aor. ἔκτᾰθεν Il. 11.691, Od. 4.537, κτάθεν Q.S. 1.812; ἐκτάνθην AP 14.32, ( ἀπ-) LXX 1 Ma. 2.9, Ev.Marc. 8.31, D.C. 65.4: aor. 2 ἀπ-εκτάνην [ᾰ] Gal. 14.284: pf. ἐκτάνθαι ἀπ-) Plb. 7.7.4:—Hom.also uses non-thematic forms, 3 sg., 1 and 3 pl. aor. ἔκτᾰ Od. 11.410, al. ( κατ- Il. 15.432), ἔκτᾰμεν Od. 12.375, ἔκτᾰν 19.276, Il. 10.526 ( ἔκτα also in S. Tr. 38, E. HF 423 (lyr., with ᾱ)); 1 pl. subj. κτέωμεν Od. 22.216; inf. κτάμεν ( κατα-) Il. 9.458, κτάμεναι [ᾰ] 5.301, al.; part. κτάς ( κατα-) 22.323, also in Trag., A. Th. 965 (lyr.), E. IT 715: aor. Med. in pass. sense, 3 sg. ἀπ-έκτᾰτο Il. 15.437; inf. κτάσθαι ib. 558 (prob. in pass. sense); part. κτάμενος 22.75, Hes. Op. 541, Pi. Fr. 203 codd., A. Pers. 923 (lyr.), Cratin. 95:—

children.definition: kill, slay, freq. in Poets, also in early Att., Lex Draconis in IG 1(2).115.20; but in Prose and Com. ἀποκτείνω prevailed; usu. of men, less freq. of slaying an animal, as Il. 15.587, Od. 12.375, 19.543, Ar. Av. 1063 (lyr.); Οὖτίς με κτείνει δόλῳ seeks to kill me, Od. 9.408, cf. S. OC 993; ὁ κτανών the slayer, murderer, A. Eu. 422; οἱ κτανόντες Id. Ch. 41 (lyr.), 144, etc.
put to death, Th. 1.132, Arist. HA 625a16, al.; esp. in legal language, εἰ . . ἐν δίκῃ ἔκτεινεν ὁ κτείνας Pl. Euthphr. 4b, cf. Prt. 322d, Lg. 871e, al., Lys. 10.11.

data.quote: εἰ . . ἐν δίκῃ ἔκτεινεν ὁ κτείνας

children.definition: ὥστε καὶ κτείνειν so as to be fatal, of the plague, Th. 2.51 (so in Pass., εὖτʼ ἂν ὑπὸ τοῦ κακοῦ κτεινέωνται when the disease is proceeding towards a fatal termination, Aret. SD 1.5); τὰ φύλλα [ἀποκύνου] . . κτείνει κύνας Dsc. 4.80.

put an end to, θέρος [νοῦσον] κτείνει Aret. SD 1.16. ( Pass. in Hom. and Ion. Prose, Il. 11.668, 14.60, Od. 11.413, Hdt. 4.3, etc.; but Trag. almost always used θνῄσκω or καταθνῄσκω as the Pass., Com. Poets and Prose writers ἀποθνῄσκω.) (Cf. Skt. kṣatás ‘wounded’.)
comb, Pherecr. 100; πύξινος κ. AP 6.211 ( Leon.), Edict.Diocl. 13.3, cf. Luc. Am. 44: hence, of toothed objects,
comb in the loom, by which the threads of the warp are kept separate, AP 6.247 ( Phil.); κναφικὸς κ. comb for carding wool, Tim. Lex. s.v. κνάφος.
horn of the lyre, Hsch.: pl., of the constellation Lyre, Eratosth. Cat. 24.
fingers, χερῶν ἄκρους κτένας A. Ag. 1594.
ribs, Opp. C. 1.296, Hsch.
virilia, pubes, Hp. Aph. 7.39, Art. 51; pudenda muliebria, Call. Fr. 308, AP 5.131 ( Phld.), Ruf. Onom. 109, Sor. 2.18.
cutting-teeth, incisors, Poll. 2.91.
bivalve shellfish, scallop, Philyll. 13, Archipp. 24, Anaxandr. 41.62 (anap.), Alex. 170, prob. in Theoc. 14.17, cf. Arist. HA 525a22, al.

children.label: b
children.definition: κτένε, perh. = scallopings (ornaments on a garment), IG 1(2).386.8; cf. κτενωτός.
caruncula lachrymalis, Arist. HA 491b25 (cf. Gal. 4.796).
bandage, Sor. Fasc. 25. (For πκτεν-, cf. πέκω, Lat. pecten: the correct form ( κτείς) of the nom. is found in IG 2(2).1425.376; later κτήν, q.v.)

comb, τινα Anaxil. 39, cf. PSI 4.404.4 ( Pass., iii B.C.); curry horses, ψήκτραισιν ἵππων τρίχας E. Hipp. 1174: metaph., ὁ δὲ Πλάτων τοὺς ἑαυτοῦ διαλόγους κτενίζων καὶ βοστρυχίζων D.H. Comp. 25:— Med., κτενίζεσθαι τὰς κόμας comb oneʼs hair, Hdt. 7.208: so abs., Ar. Fr. 603, Antiph. 148.4:— Pass., ἐκτενισμένος with oneʼs hair combed, Archil. 165, cf. Semon. 7.65; εἰ κτενισθείη Hippiatr. 94.

data.quote: ὁ δὲ Πλάτων τοὺς ἑαυτοῦ διαλόγους κτενίζων καὶ βοστρυχίζων

children.definition: Dim. of κτείς 1, POxy. 1142.7 (iii A.D.); of κτείς 8, Epich. 42.3 (pl.).
Hsch.
comb-maker, Gloss.
combing, E. El. 529 (pl.), Diocl. Fr. 141.
hairdresser, Gal. 13.1038, PTeb. 322.23 (ii A.D.), Gloss.
for hairdressing, ζεῦγος κ. σιδηροῦν POxy. 1035.12 (ii A.D.).
combed, carded, λίνον Sm. Is. 19.9.
like a comb. Adv. - δῶς Gloss.
Gloss.
dealer in combs, Poll. 7.198.
Xanth. 3; τὸ κ. Phan.Hist. 29.
scalloped, χιτωνίσκος IG 2(2).1514.30; κτενωτή· ὑφαντή, Hsch.; cf. πεντέκτενος, κτείς 8b.
possession, Il. 10.216, 24.235, cj. in Simon. 107.9, Trag.Adesp. in Gött.Nachr. 1922.27.

funeral gifts, burnt with the dead, Mosch. 4.33, Hsch.: generally, funeral honours, ἐπὶ κτέρεα κτερεΐξαι Od. 1.291, cf. 2.222, Il. 24.38, etc.; ἔλαχον κτερέων Od. 5.311; τῶν ὁσίων ἀντίασεν κτερέων Epigr.Gr. 514 (Maced.).
wrappers for the dead, shroud, ἐνὶ κτερέεσσιν ἐλυσθείς A.R. 1.254.
Ep. Verb, = κτερίζω:
bury with due honours, σὸν ἑταῖρον ἀέθλοισι κτερέϊζε Il. 23.646; κτερεϊζέμεν Ἕκτορα δῖον 24.657; τύμβῳ κτερέϊξε παῖδα IG 12 (5).308 ( Paros), etc.
κτέρεα κ., v. κτέρεα.

definition: κτερίζω, fut. κτεριῶ Il. 18.334: aor. ἐκτέρῐσα 24.38, Simon. 109: ( κτέρεα):—

children.definition: Il. 18.334; τὸν δὲ κτεριοῦσιν Ἀχαιοί 22.336; ἔμʼ, εἴ κε θάνω, κτεριοῦσί γε δῖοιʼ Ἀχαιοί 11.455; τάφῳ κ. τινά S. Ant. 204; τούσδʼ εἷς τάφος ἐκτέρισε Simon. l.c.: abs., E. Hel. 1244; δημοσίᾳ κ. IG 2.1678 (iv B.C.), cf. Sammelb. 2119 (iii B.C.).

data.quote: ἔμʼ, εἴ κε θάνω, κτεριοῦσί γε δῖοιʼ Ἀχαιοί

children.definition: τοί κέ μιν ὦκα ἐν πυρὶ κήαιεν καὶ ἐπὶ κτέρεα κτερίσαιεν Il. 24.38, cf. Od. 3.285.

data.quote: τοί κέ μιν ὦκα ἐν πυρὶ κήαιεν καὶ ἐπὶ κτέρεα κτερίσαιεν

children.definition: undertaker, Hsch. s.v. ταφῆες.
line of fissure in the fibre of wood, Thphr. HP 5.1.9 sq.; κτηδόνες ξύλου grain of wood, Hero Bel. 96.12, cf. Suid.
fibres of the heart, Hp. Cord. 10, cf. Erot. s.v. ἶνες.

children.label: b
children.definition: layers in the cornea of the eye, Ruf. Anat. 10.

children.label: c
children.definition: κ. πιμελῆς fibres in a piece of fat, Sor. 1.118.
layers of slate, Dsc. 5.127.
gills of a mushroom, Id. 3.1.
shreds of lint, Gal. 8.415. (Cf. εὐκτέανος (B), εὐθυκτέανον, ἰθυκτέανον.)

anything gotten, piece of property, possession, sg. once in Hom., μή νύ τι . . δόμων ἐκ κτῆμα φέρηται Od. 15.19; later ταύτας [γυναῖκας] ἐξείλεθʼ αὑτῷ κ. S. Tr. 245; ἡδὺ κ. τῆς νίκης λαβεῖν Id. Ph. 81, cf. OT 549, Ant. 702, E. Or. 230, 703, etc.; κ. ἐς αἰεί Th. 1.22; ὡς ἡδὺ καὶ μακάριον τὸ κ. Pl. R. 496c, etc.; of a slave, παλαιὸν οἴκων κ. E. Med. 49, cf. Pl. Phd. 62d, X. Oec. 1.6, Vect. 4.42; κ. ἔμψυχον Arist. Pol. 1253b32; of a calf, J. AJ 6.14.3; κ. πάντων ἐστὶ τιμιώτατον ἀνὴρ φίλος Hdt. 5.24.

data.quote: μή νύ τι . . δόμων ἐκ κτῆμα φέρηται
ὡς ἡδὺ καὶ μακάριον τὸ κ.
κ. πάντων ἐστὶ τιμιώτατον ἀνὴρ φίλος

children.definition: possessions, in Hom. of heirlooms, δόμοις ἐν κτήματα κεῖται Il. 9.382, Od. 4.127; also, of all kinds of property, freq. in Od., κ. δαρδάπτουσιν 14.92, cf. 18.144, al.; διέλαχον . . κτημάτων παμπησίαν A. Th. 817, etc.; Ἔοως ὃς ἐν κτήμασι πίπτεις who fallest upon wealth, i.e. on the wealthy, S. Ant. 782 codd. (lyr.): sts., χρήματα καὶ κ. property in money and chattels, Pl. Lg. 728e, cf. Isoc. 1.28; = κτήνη, Pl. Grg. 484c, Phd. 62b; opp. ἀγροί, personal (opp. real) property, Is. 5.43; less freq. of landed property, κ. ἔχων ἐν Βοιωτίᾳ D. 18.41 (sg. as v.l.), Hdn. 2.6.3: later freq. in sg., estate, farm, field, etc., Act.Ap. 5.1, BGU 530.21 (i A.D.), etc.; ἀμπελικὸν κ. vineyard, PRyl. 157.4 (ii A.D.).
materials, κ. πιλητά Gal. UP 6.4, 7.22.
small estate, PMasp. 21.19 (vi A.D.).
possessed of wealth, opulent, Plb. 5.93.6, D.S. 18.10, Plu. Sol. 14; οἱ κ., = Lat. possessores, App. BC 1.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: belonging to an estate or farm, γεωργοί POxy. 136.18 (vi A.D.); τὰ τῶν κ. ἔργα PFlor. 161.6 (iii A.D.).

definition: κτημάτιον, τό, Dim. of κτῆμα, Alciphr. 1.36, PTeb. 616 (ii A.D.), PFay. 133 (iv A.D.).

children.definition: Lycurg. Fr. 93, Socr. Ep. 29.5.
estate bailiff, steward, Gloss.
purchase properties, of commissioners for temples, Supp.Epigr. 2.580.10 ( Teos, ii B.C.); Ἀπόλλωνι καὶ Ἀρτέμιδι LW 338 ( Mylasa).
commissioner who purchases temple- properties, Supp.Epigr. 2.538 ( Mylasa, ii B.C.), 565.11 ( Olymos, i B.C.); γενομένης τῆς ὠνῆς τοῖς κ. εἰς τὸ τοῦ θεοῦ ὄνομα LW 416 ( Mylasa).

data.quote: γενομένης τῆς ὠνῆς τοῖς κ. εἰς τὸ τοῦ θεοῦ ὄνομα

children.definition: purchase of properties, Supp.Epigr. 2.580.12 ( Teos, ii B.C.).

definition: κτήν, ὁ, later nominative form for κτείς (q.v.), ὁ κ. τοῦ ποδός,

children.definition: Jo.Alex. περὶ τῶν διαφόρως τονουμένων p.16 Egenolff (Vratisl. 1880).
evectio, Gloss.
cattle-lifting, PMasp. 2 ii 25 (vi A.D.).
like beasts, Hdt. 4.180.
cattle-doctor, Gloss.
belonging to beasts, Gloss.
one guilty of bestiality, Sch. Ar. Ra. 432, 965.

definition: κτῆνος, εος, τό, ( κτάομαι) mostly in pl. κτήνεα, contr. κτήνη,

children.definition: flocks and herds, h.Hom. 30.10, Hdt. 1.50, 2.41, Pl. Criti. 109c, PStrassb. 98.9 (ii B.C.), SIG 633.73 ( Milet., ii B.C.); κ. τὰ δημιοπληθῆ A. Ag. 129 (lyr.); of beasts in general, Heraclit. 29; opp. ἄνθρωποι, Democr. 57; of swine, Plb. 12.4.14; ὑϊκὰ κ. BGU 757.20 (i A.D.).

beast, as an ox or sheep, Hdt. 1.132, Hp. Cord. 2, X. An. 5.2.3; horse or mule for riding, Ev.Luc. 10.34, Act.Ap. 23.24; of a domestic animal, opp. θηρίον, M.Ant. 5.11. (Late dat. pl. κτῆσι PFlor. 258.6, etc.)
jumentarium, Gloss.
cattle-stall, Gp. 15.8 tit.
keep cattle, Str. 12.2.9, Ph. 2.89, Hippiatr. 53.
cattle-keeping, Str. 17.2.3, D.H. 3.36 (pl.), Ph. 1.304, BGU 969.12, al. (ii A.D.), Plu. Publ. 11 (pl.).
keeping cattle, pastoral, βίος D.S. 1.74; γῆ κ. a land of pasture, LXX Nu. 32.4: as Subst., cattle-keeper, Ph. 1.304: pl., PFay. 18 (b) (i B.C.), Dsc. 2.147, BGU 969.11 (ii A.D.).

definition: κτηνύδριον, τό, Dim. of κτῆνος, PStrassb. 92.12 (iii A.D.), PFlor. 120.6 (iii A.D.).

children.definition: like a beast, LXX Ps. 72(73).22, Aesop. 324b; αἴσθησις Ph. 1.151: Comp., Hsch. Adv. - δῶς, γράφειν Tz.ad Lyc. 797.

definition: κτησείδιον, τό, Dim. of κτῆσις, Arr. Epict. 1.1.10;

children.definition: Jul. Ep. 4.
possessing property, Paul.Al. L. 4.
belonging to property, χρήματα κ. property, A. Ag. 1009 (lyr.); κ. βοτόν a sheep of oneʼs own flock, S. Tr. 690.

children.label: II
children.definition: domestic, Ζεὺς κ. the protector of house and property, A. Supp. 445, Hp. Insomn. 89, Orac. ap. D. 21.53, Antipho 1.16: pl., τοὺς κ. Δίας Anticl. 13; also Ἀθηνᾶ κ. Hp. l.c.; ὁ θεὸς ὁ κ. Plu. Vit. aer. al. 2.828a; κ. βωμός the altar of Ζεὺς κτήσιος, A. Ag. 1038; θεοὶ κ., = Lat. Penates, D.H. 8.41.
possessing horses, pr. n. in Od., cf. Luc. Fug. 26.

acquisition (opp. ἀπόλαυσις, Arist. Rh. 1410a6), κ. τινὸς ποιεῖσθαι Th. 1.8, 13; ἡ φιλοσοφία κ. ἐπιστήμης Pl. Euthd. 288d; ῥᾳδίαν ἔχει <τὴν> κτῆσιν Alcid. Soph. 5; κατʼ ἔργου κτῆσιν according to success in the work, S. Tr. 230.

children.label: II
children.definition: pf.) possession, λέχους, πλούτου, etc., ib. 162, El. 960, etc.; κ. ἔχειν τῶν μετάλλων ἐργασίας Th. 4.105; ἡ τῶν χρημάτων κ. Pl. R. 331b; διὰ τὴν τῶν υἱέων κ. on account of your having sons, Id. Ap. 20b; ἱματίων Id. Phd. 64d; φέροντας . . ἀγαθοῦ κτῆσιν οὐδενός D. 18.308; κ. ἐκ δεσπότου καὶ δούλου [συνέστηκεν] Arist. Pol. 1277a8; holding, opp. χρῆσις (ʼusingʼ), Id. EN 1098b32; ownership, opp. χρῆσις (ʼusufructʼ), POxy. 237 viii 35, al.; τὰς κτήσεις βεβαίας εἶμεν IG 42(1).76.25 ( Epid., ii B.C.).

possessions, property, διὰ κτῆσιν δατέοντο Il. 5.158; κ. ὄπασσεν Od. 14.62; πατρῴα κ. S. El. 1290; μετρίης κτήσιος ἐπιμέλεσθαι Democr. 285; ἡ ἰδία κ. POxy. 237 viii 32 (i A.D.): in pl., Hdt. 4.114, etc.; ἀρετῆς βέβαιαι . . αἱ κ. μόναι S. Fr. 194; esp. lands, farms, D.H. 8.19, D.S. 14.29, etc.: also in sg., farm, estate, PFlor. 155.6 (iii A.D.).
to be possessed, Pl. Lg. 742a.

children.label: II
children.definition: κτητέον, one must get, Id. R. 373a.

acquisitive, skilled in getting, τῶν οὐκ ὄντων Isoc. 12.242: abs., industrious, Str. 16.4.26: ἡ -κὴ τέχνη the art of acquiring property, Pl. Sph. 219c, cf. Arist. Pol. 1253b23; τὸ κ. Phld. Oec. p.35 J.
acquired by purchase, δοῦλος, δούλη, PRyl. 111 (b).6 (ii A.D.), PLips. 4.11 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: possessive, [ ὄνομα] D.T. 634.25; ἀντωνυμίαι A.D. Pron. 16.15; τὰ κ. ib. 14.21. Adv. -κῶς Id. Synt. 160.13.
of an owner, PGiss. 124.7 (vi A.D.).
that may be gotten or acquired, ληϊστοὶ μὲν . . βόες . . , κτητοὶ δὲ τρίποδες Il. 9.407, cf. E. Hipp. 1295 (anap.), Pl. Prt. 324a, al.

data.quote: ληϊστοὶ μὲν . . βόες . . , κτητοὶ δὲ τρίποδες

children.definition: worth getting, desirable, Id. Smp. 197d, Hp.Mi. 374e.

children.label: II
children.definition: acquired, gained, Id. Lg. 841e; κτητή female slave, opp. γαμετή, Hes. Op. 406; κ. μέρος οἰκίας PLond. 3.1164 ( f). 11 (iii A.D.).
possessor, owner, D.S. 34/ 5.2.31, POxy. 237 viii 31 (i A.D.), A.D. Pron. 22.6, AP 7.206 ( Damoch.), Procop. Arc. 26: c. gen., οἰκιῶν κ. Act.Ap. 4.34.

definition: κτίδεος [ ῐ], α, ον (from ἰκτίς: κτίς only in Hsch. s.v. κτιδέα), for ἰκτίδεος (which is not in use),

children.definition: of a marten, κτιδέη κυνέη marten-skin helmet, Il. 10.335, 458.

definition: κτίζω, Emp. 23.6, etc.: fut. - ίσω A. Ch. 1060: aor. ἔκτῐσα Od. 11.263, etc.; poet. ἔκτισσα Pi. P. 1.62, A. Pers. 289 (lyr.), κτίσσα Il. 20.216, κτίσα Pi. P. 5.89: pf. ἔκτῐκα Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 1.8, D.S. 7.5, 15.13:— Med., poet. aor. ἐκτίσσατο Pi. O. 10(11).25, Fr. 1.4 ( ἐκτής- codd.):— Pass., fut. κτισθήσομαι Str. Chr. 5.38, D.H. 1.56: aor. ἐκτίσθην Th. 1.12, etc.: pf. ἔκτισμαι Hdt. 4.46, Hp. Art. 45, E. Fr. 360.9:—

children.definition: people a country, build houses and cities in it, κτίσσε δὲ Δαρδανίην Il. l.c.; κ. χώρην, νῆσον, Hdt. 1.149, 3.49.

found, build, Θήβης ἕδος ἔκτισαν Od. l.c., cf. Hdt. 1.167, 168, Th. 6.4, PCair.Zen. 169 (iii B.C.); ἀποικίαν A. Pr. 815:— Pass., to be founded, Σμύρνην τὴν ἀπὸ Κολοφῶνος κτισθεῖσαν founded by emigrants from Colophon, Hdt. 1.16, cf. 7.153, 8.62; μήτε ἄστεα μήτε τείχεα ἐκτισμένα no fixed cities or walls, Id. 4.46; -ομένη πόλις Phld. Rh. 2.155 S.

κ. ἄλσος plant a grove, Pi. P. 5.89; βωμόν set up an altar, Id. O. 7.42; ἑορτάν, ἀγῶνα, found, establish it, ib. 6.69, 10(11).25 ( Med.); τὸν Κύρνον . . κτίσαι, ἥρων ἐόντα establish his worship, Hdt. 1.167; δαῖτάς τινι A. Ch. 484 ( Pass.); τάφον τινί S. Ant. 1101; αἵρεσιν Phld. Rh. 1.77 S.; σύνοδον IG 2(2).1343.12 (i B.C.).

produce, create, bring into being, γόνῳ τινά A. Supp. 172 (lyr.); bring about, τελευτήν ib. 140 (lyr.), cf. Ch. 441 (lyr.); ὁ τὴν φιλίην ἐκτικώς Lyr.Alex.Adesp. l.c.; of painters, δένδρεα . . καὶ ἀνέρας ἠδὲ γυναῖκας Emp. l.c.; ἵπποισι τὸν χαλινὸν κτίσας having invented it, S. OC 715 (lyr.).
make so and so, ἐλεύθερον κ. τινά A. Ch. 1060; ἔνθεον κτίσας φρένα Id. Eu. 17, cf. 714; ποτανὰν εἴ σέ τις θεῶν κτίσαι E. Supp. 620 (lyr.), cf. A. Pers. 289 (lyr.).

data.quote: ποτανὰν εἴ σέ τις θεῶν κτίσαι

children.definition: perpetrate a deed, S. Tr. 898. (Cf. Skt. kséti ‘reside’, kṣitís ( = κτίσις) ‘habitation’.)
make tame, tame, Pi. Fr. 238 ( Pass.).

tame, docile, obedient, χρὴ δέ σε πατρὶ . . κτίλον ἔμμεναι Hes. Fr. 222; ἦσαν δὲ κτίλα πάντα καὶ ἀνθρώποισι προσηνῆ Emp. 130; μῆλα (sheep) Nic. Th. 471; κύνες Parth. 10.3; ἱερέα κτίλον Ἀφροδίτας Aphroditeʼs cherished priest, Pi. P. 2.17; κτίλα ὤεα, perh. their cherished eggs, Nic. Th. 452.

data.quote: χρὴ δέ σε πατρὶ . . κτίλον ἔμμεναι
ἦσαν δὲ κτίλα πάντα καὶ ἀνθρώποισι προσηνῆ

children.definition: tame, make tractable, in Med., ἐκτιλώσαντο τὰς λοιπὰς τῶν Ἀμαζόνων got them tamed, Hdt. 4.113:— Pass., pf. part. ἐκτιλωμένος Paus.Gr. Fr. 241.
Gloss.; cf. κτήν.

κτείνω, App. BC 1.71 (vv.ll. κτεινύντες, κτειννύντες), 4.35; κτιννύω, Polyaen. 1.23, 25, Plot. 3.2.15:— Pass., κτιννύμενος App. BC 1.2; κτιννύεσθαι J. AJ 18.8.3:—more freq. in compd. ἀποκτίννυμι (cf. ἀποκτείνυμι), cf. Phryn. PS p.51 B.; κτεινύω and ἀποκτιννύναι are correct acc. to Choerob. in An.Ox. 2.233.
founding, settling, Th. 6.5; ἀποικιῶν Isoc. 12.190, cf. Plb. 9.1.4 (pl.), etc.
achievement, Pi. O. 13.83.
creation, κ. κόσμου Ep.Rom. 1.20; ἀπʼ ἀρχῆς κτίσεως Ev.Marc. 10.6, 13.19, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: created thing, creature, LXX Ju. 9.12, Ev.Marc. 16.15, Ep.Rom. 8.19, etc.: in pl., LXX To. 8.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: authority created or ordained, 1 Ep.Pet. 2.13.

colony, foundation, Call. Aet. Oxy. 2080.77 [Fr. 43.75 Pf.]; Παρίων Str. 7.5.5, cf. D.H. 1.59; Λακωνικὸν κ. Str. 5.3.6; also, of a temple, J. BJ 2.6.1: generally, building, PSI 1.84.8 (pl., iv/v A.D.).
foundation, πόλεως IGRom. 4.914 ( Cibyra).
sanctuary of a founder, PLips. 97 xiii7 ( iv A.D., - ιον Pap.).

definition: κτιστήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq., AJA 23.364 ( Corinth, iv B.C.).

children.definition: founder, Arist. Fr. 484, OGI 111.9 ( Egypt, ii B.C.), Luc. Macr. 13; of Apollo as founder of Cyrene, Berl.Sitzb. 1903.85: pl., Call. Aet. Oxy. 2080.64 [Fr. 43.62 Pf.]; ὁ τῆς στοᾶς κ., i.e. Zeno, Ath. 8.345c, D.L. 2.120: metaph., ἰατρικῆς κ. IG 14.1759.
builder, POxy. 2144.8 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: restorer, τῆς πατρίδος Plu. Cic. 22.

children.label: III
children.definition: Creator, ὁ κ. ἁπάντων LXX Si. 24.8, al.
wrought, λάεσσιν h.Ap. 299.
built: neut. κ., τό, building, PFay. 117.23 (ii A.D.).
κτίστης 1, IGRom. 3.802 ( Syllium).

definition: κτιστύς, ύος, ἡ, Ion. for κτίσις, Hdt. 9.97.

children.definition: Pi. Fr. 105; Ἀσιάδος χθονός E. Ion 74; ὁ τῆς στοᾶς κ., of Zeno, Ath. 9.370c; ἀγαθῶν . . εὑρετὴν καὶ κτίστορα Diph. (?) 138.
SIG 711 L 5 (pl., Delph., ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: inhabitant, E. Or. 1621.

definition: κτοίνα or κτοῖνα, ἡ, ( κτίζω) Rhod. name for

children.definition: a local division, like Att. δῆμος, township, IG 12(1).694, 1033, al.; cf. κτύναι ἢ κτοῖναι· χωρήσεις προγονικῶν ἱερείων, ἢ δῆμος μεμερισμένος, Hsch. (also πτοίνα BCH 10.261).
member of a κτοίνα, IG 12(1).694.14:—also κτοιν-έτης, ib. 157.9, 12(3).1270 A 13 ( Syme).
murder, Zonar.

definition: κτυπέω, Ep. Iterat. κτυπέεσκον Q.S. 9.135: aor. 1 ἐκτύπησα E. Ph. 1181, Arr. Tact. 40.6; poet. κτύπησα S. OC 1606, E. Or. 1467 (lyr.): Ep. aor. 2 ἔκτῠπον Il. 8.75, al., S. OC 1456 (lyr.), κτύπον Il. 8.170:— Pass., v. infr.: ( κτύπος):—

children.definition: crash, as trees falling, μεγάλα κτυπέουσαι πῖπτον Il. 23.119; freq. of thunder, Ζεὺς ἔκτυπε 8.75, cf. 7.479, Od. 21.413, etc.; ἔκτυπεν αἰθήρ S. OC 1456 (lyr.); of the sea, Pl. R. 396b.

ring, resound, κτυπέει δέ θʼ ὑπʼ αὐτοῦ ὕλη (sc. χειμάρρου) Il. 13.140; ἀμφὶ δʼ ἐκτύπουν πέτραι rang with the cries of Heracles, S. Tr. 787; Διὸς βρονταῖσιν εἰς ἔριν κ. E. Cyc. 328; δρομήμασιν Id. Med. 1180; τοῖν ποδοῖν κ. stamp loudly with . . , Ar. Ec. 545, cf. Gal. 7.60; εἰ . . ἐμπεσὸν [δόρυ] τῷ θυρεῷ κτυπήσειε Arr. l.c.; σιδηρῷ ὑποδήματι Luc. Salt. 83: c. acc. cogn., φόβον κτυπεῖν, like κλάζειν Ἄρη, E. Rh. 308.

children.label: II
children.definition: make to ring or resound, χθόνα Hes. Sc. 61; τύμπανα Opp. C. 4.247: c. dupl. acc., κτύπησε κρᾶτα . . πλαγάν (v.l. πλαγᾷ) made it ring with a blow, E. Or. l.c.: metaph., κ. ἐν τοῖς συμβουλευτικοῖς τόποις τὰς ὀνομασίας Phld. Rh. 1.208 S.:— Pass., resound, Ar. Pl. 758, Th. 995 (lyr.); κτυπηθῆναι τὰ ὦτα Philostr. VA 6.26.

data.quote: κ. ἐν τοῖς συμβουλευτικοῖς τόποις τὰς ὀνομασίας

children.definition: Critias 25.32 D.; κ. τυμπάνων D.C. 51.17, cf. Jul. Or. 7.220b; κ. χειρός E. Andr. 1211 (lyr.).
one who makes a noise, Suid. s.v. πίτυλος.
Hsch.

crash, bang, din, κ. θεῶν ἔριδι ξυνιόντων Il. 20.66, cf. 12.338, A. Th. 100, etc.; of thunder, S. OC 1463 (lyr.), A. Pr. 923; of the trampling of feet, περί τε κ. ἦλθε ποδοῖιν Od. 16.6, cf. S. Ph. 202; rattling of chariots or sound of horses’ feet, Il. 10.535, al., S. El. 714, Ar. Eq. 552 (lyr.); of a storm, A. Ag. 1533 (lyr.); noise made by one knocking at the door, Id. Ch. 653; ὀξύχειρ κ., of the beating of breasts by mourners, ib. 23; στέρνων κ. E. Supp. 87: in pl., κ. χερῶν Id. Ph. 1351 (lyr.); of the sound of many voices, S. OC 1500; of gates shutting, Aen.Tact. 20.4; κτύπου ἀχὼ χάλυβος A. Pr. 133 (lyr.); rarely of musical sound, σαλπίγγων κ. B. Fr. 3.9.—Rare in Prose, Th. 7.70, Pl. Criti. 117e, X. Cyr. 7.1.35, Aen.Tact. l.c.

definition: ʼκτώ, for ὀκτώ, as pronounced by fishmongers, Amphis 30.12.

children.definition: Dim. of κύαθος II, Nic. Th. 591.
contained in a κύαθος, ὕδωρ a ladleful of water, Them. in Ph. 135.26, Simp. in Ph. 174.30, Phlp. in Mete. 24.22, Id. in GA 92.22.
ladle out wine, Antiph. 115, Diph. 107.

children.label: II
children.definition: κ. ταῖς ναυσὶν ἐκ θαλάττης draw water from the sea with the ships ( as one draws wine from a bowl), of the engines of Archimedes lifting the Roman ships out of the water, Plb. 8.6.6.

definition: κυάθιον, τό, Dim. of κύαθος, Pherecr. 107, PLond. 5.1657.11 (iv/v A.D.):—also κῠαθ-ίς, ίδος, ἡ, Sophr. 3.

children.definition: spoon-shaped end of certain probes, Heliod. ap. Orib. 46.11.26, cf. Gal. 19.122, Archig. ap. eund. 12.652, Hermes 38.282.
spoon-shaped probe, Diocl. Fr. 191.

ladle, for drawing wine out of the κρατήρ, Anacr. 63.5, Pl.Com. 176, Archipp. 21, X. Cyr. 1.3.9, PEleph. 5.3 (iii B.C.), etc.; cold metal ladles were applied to bruises, Arist. Pr. 890b7; κύαθον αἰτήσεις τάχα youʼll need a ladle shortly (from being so soundly beaten), Ar. Lys. 444; ὑπωπιασμέναι . . καὶ κυάθους προσκείμεναι with ladles applied, Id. Pax 542, cf. E. Fr. 374, Apolloph. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Attic measure holding two κόγχαι or four μύστρα, about 1/12 of a pint, Gal. 19.753, cf. 10.516.

children.label: III
children.definition: κύαθοι κλειδῶν ἀνεστηκότες filled-out hollows round the collar-bones, Philostr. Gym. 48.

definition: κυαθότης, ητος, ἡ, coined by Plato,

children.definition: cuphood, D.L. 6.53.
like a cup, Eratosth. ap. Ath. 11.482a; κλεῖδες Philostr. Gym. 29.
Hsch.
chosen by beans, i.e. by lot, X. Mem. 1.2.9, etc.; κ. ψηφοφορίαι voting by beans, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.12e.
choose by lot, δικαστάς IG 1(2).41.19, 2(2).1172.13; ἔκ τινων Arist. Ath. 8.1, 22.5:— Pass., IG 1(2).10.8, Jusj. ap. D. 24.150.
of the size of a bean, Dsc. 2.133, Luc. Herm. 40.
precious stone like a bean, Plin. HN 37.188.
fabacia, Gloss.
to be ripe for marriage (cf. κύαμος III), Ar. Fr. 582.
of beans, ἔτνος Henioch. 4.7, Gal. 13.12; ἄλευρον Id. 10.177.

definition: κυάμιον, τό, Dim. of κύαμος, Eust. 948.30, CIG 5109.30 ( Nubia).
κυαμιστός, ή, όν, f.l. for κυαμευτός, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.597a.

children.definition: bean-market, Plu. VOrat. 2.837c.
chosen by beans, i.e. by lot (rather than κῠᾰμοβόλος (parox.), voting with the bean), δικαστής S. Fr. 288.

bean, Vicia Faba, κ. μελανόχροες Il. 13.589, cf. Emp. 141, IG 2(2).1013.19, etc.; χλωροί Batr. 125; κ. Ἑλληνικός Dsc. 2.105; abominated by Pythagoreans, Arist. Fr. 195, etc.; also, of the plant, Thphr. CP 4.14.2.
Egyptian bean, Nelumbium speciosum, Id. HP 4.8.7; usu. Αἰγύπτιος κ., Nic. Fr. 81, D.S. 1.10, Dsc. 2.106, Gal. 6.532, 19.780.

children.label: II
children.definition: lot by which public officers were elected at Athens and elsewh. (because those who drew white beans were chosen), Plu. Per. 27; ὁ τῷ κυάμῳ λαχὼν Ἀθηναίων πολεμαρχέειν Hdt. 6.109; ἐπίσκοπος . . τῷ κυάμῳ λαχών Ar. Av. 1022; οἱ πεντακόσιοι <οἱ> λαχόντες τῷ κ. Lex ap. And. 1.96; βουλὴ ἡ ἀπὸ τοῦ κ. Th. 8.66, cf. Arist. Ath. 24.3, 32.1; ἄρχοντας ἀπὸ κ. καθιστάναι X. Mem. 1.2.9; κυάμοισι τὰς ἀρχὰς αἱρέεσθαι Luc. Vit.Auct. 6; κύαμον ἐδέξατο Schwyzer 701 B 30 ( Erythrae, v B.C.); κυάμῳ πατρίῳ S. Fr. 404.

data.quote: ὁ τῷ κυάμῳ λαχὼν Ἀθηναίων πολεμαρχέειν

children.label: III
children.definition: swelling of the paps at puberty, Ruf. Onom. 92, Poll. 2.163, cf. Eust. 749.21.

children.label: IV
children.definition: woodlouse, Gal. 12.367.
bean-eater, Ar. Eq. 41 (with allusion to κύαμος ΙΙ).
eating of beans, bean-diet, Luc. VH 2.24.
field of κύαμος 1.2, Thphr. HP 4.8.8, Str. 17.1.15, BGU 1119.11 (i B.C.).
bean-grower, POxy. 43v iii 2 (iii A.D.).
she of the dark Aegis, i.e. Pallas, Pi. O. 13.70.
with dark ἄμπυξ, Θήβα Pi. Fr. 29.3; Δᾶλος Theoc. 17.67; μίτρη Nonn. D. 6.114.
of dark hue, of the sea, B. 12.124.

definition: κυαναυγέτις, ιδος, pecul. fem. of sq., Orph. H. 23.1.

children.definition: dark-gleaming, ὀφρύες E. Alc. 261 (lyr.); τὰς βολὰς τῶν ὀφθαλμῶν ἐστὶ κ. Alciphr. 3.1; of the sea, κ. Ἀμφιτρίτη D.P. 169, etc.; πηγή Supp.Epigr. 4.467.25 ( Milet., iii A.D.); com. of dithyrambs, Ar. Av. 1389.

data.quote: τὰς βολὰς τῶν ὀφθαλμῶν ἐστὶ κ.

children.definition: dark-furrowed, Orac. ap. Hld. 2.26.
Dark-rocks, two small islands at the entrance of the Euxine, Hdt. 4.85, D. 19.273, Str. 7.6.1, cf. Συμπληγάδες: Κυάνεα πελάγη, of the adjacent sea, is f.l. in S. Ant. 966. [ ῡ, metri gr., S. l.c.]
E. El. 436, Ar. Ra. 1318; τριήρεις Id. Eq. 554.—Only in lyr.

definition: κυάνεος, α, ον, contr. κῠᾰνοῦς, ῆ, οῦν Pl. Ti. 68c, etc., prob. in A. Pers. 81 (lyr.), Euph. 51.7 (cf. κύανος II):—

children.definition: made of κύανος (q.v.), κάπετος Il. 18.564; δράκοντες 11.26, cf. 39, Hes. Sc. 167.

children.label: II
children.definition: of the colour of κ., dark-blue, glossy, of the swallow, Simon. 74; of the halcyon, Arist. HA 616a15; of the skin of the porpoise, ib. 566b12; of the deep sea, E. IT 7, cf. Arist. Pr. 932a31; πόντου κ. δῖναι Xenarch. 1.7; κ. χρῶμα Pl. l.c.; τὸ κ. ἐξ ἰσάτιδος καὶ πυρώδους Thphr. Sens. 77.

data.quote: τὸ κ. ἐξ ἰσάτιδος καὶ πυρώδους

children.definition: dark, black, of the mourning veil of Thetis, Il. 24.94; of clouds, 5.345, 20.418, Od. 12.75; of the brows of Zeus, Il. 1.528; χαῖται 22.402; γενειάδες Od. 16.176; ἄνδρες, of Africans, Hes. Op. 527; γαῖα ψάμμῳ κυανέη (of the bottom of Charybdis) Od. 12.243; κ. χθών, of Delos, Pi. Fr. 87.4; κ. θάλαμος, of the chamber of Persephone, Sapph. 119; φάλαγγες κ. dark masses of warriors, Il. 4.282; κυάνεον Τρώων νέφος 16.66: metaph., Κῆρες κ. Hes. Sc. 249; κ. δνόφος Simon. 37.8; λόχμα Pi. O. 6.40; Ἄιδης IG 14.1389ii25. [ ῡ, metri gr., in dactylic verse, Hom., etc.]
to be dark in colour, D.P. 1111, Phryn. PS p.80 B. [ ῡ, metri gr.]

definition: κυανίζω, = foreg., Dsc. 1.1, Placit. 3.5.12; of varicose veins, Gal. 13.460.

children.definition: bluish grey, ὄψιες (in glaucoma) Hp. Vid.Ac. 1.
with dark-blue depths, prop. of the sea; com. of a cup, Ar. Fr. 165.
dark-eyed, AP 5.60 ( Rufin.).
dark-blue, deep-blue, κ. ἀμφʼ ὕδωρ (i. e. the sea) E. Hel. 179 (lyr.), cf. Arist. GA 779b33, Col. 796a18.
dark-haired, Orph. A. 1194; χαίτη AP 6.250 ( Antiphil.).
with dark-blue κρήδεμνον, Q.S. 4.381.
with feet of κύανος, τράπεζα Il. 11.629. [ ῡ, metri gr.]
dark-veiled, of Demeter mourning for her daughter, h.Cer. 319, 360, 374; of Leto, Hes. Th. 406. [ ῡ, metri gr.].
dark-haired, B. 5.33, al., Q.S. 5.345.
dark-prowed, of ships, Il. 15.693, 23.852, Od. 9.482, 539: fem. κυανόπρῳρᾰ, B. 16.1.
with blue-black feathers, like the raven, ὄρνις E. Andr. 862 (lyr.): generally, dark-winged, τέττιξ Hes. Sc. 393.
= foreg., παῖς Ἀφροδίτας Cerc. 5.2.

definition: κύανος [ ῠ], ὁ (later ἡ, v. infr. I.3, 7),

children.definition: dark-blue enamel, esp. used to adorn armour, δέκα οἶμοι μέλανος κυάνοιο Il. 11.24, cf. 35; πτύχες κυάνου Hes. Sc. 143; also θριγκὸς κυάνοιο, of a cornice, Od. 7.87; so perh. in IG 1(2).367.7, 42(1).102.244 (Epid.).
lapis lazuli, κ. αὐτοφυής (opp. σκευαστός) Thphr. Lap. 39, al., Dsc. 5.91, etc. (perh. also in Pl. Phd. 113c); κ. ἄρρην, θῆλυς, Thphr. Lap. 31: also an imitation made in Egypt, ib. 55.
blue copper carbonate, Hp. Cord. 2, Gal. 12.233 ( ὁ and ἡ), Luc. Lex. 22; βαπτὴ κ. AP 6.229 ( Crin.).
