cypress, Cupressus sempervirens, εὐώδης Od. 5.64, cf. Hdt. 4.75, Hermipp. 63.14, Phld. Mort. 38, Dsc. 1.74, Arr. An. 7.19.4; ἐλαφρά Pi. Fr. 154; ῥαδινά Theoc. 11.45; ἄρρην καὶ θήλεια Thphr. HP 1.8.2.

Fr. 519, AP 6.202 ( Leon.), cf. 272 ( Pers.), 358 ( Diotim.); κ. Περσικαί Hecat. l.c.; κ. χερμάδων prob. for κύπας τις χ. in Lyc. 333:— Dim. κῠπασσίσκος, ὁ, Hippon. 18.

κύπειρις [ ῠ], ιδος, ἡ, = sq. 2, Nic. Al. 591:—also κύπηρις, εως, ἡ, POxy. 374 (i A.D.).

ship, Hsch.

of Cyprus, Cyprian, Pi. P. 2.16, Hdt. 3.19, etc.; λίθος K., a kind of σμάραγδος (found in Cyprus, Thphr. Lap. 25), Achae. 5, cf. Plin. HN 37.66; K. ἄρτοι Eub. 77; K. παραπέτασμα Ar. Fr. 611; K. τάριχος Posidipp. 17; βοῦς K., prov. of an unclean feeder, Diogenian. 3.49, Suid., etc.; K. κάλαμος, = δόναξ, Dsc. 1.85.
Κυπρία, ἡ, = Κύπρις, Pi. O. 1.75.

of copper, γραφεῖον PMag.Par. 1.1847.

definition: Κύπρις, ῐδος, ἡ, acc. Κύπριν and Κύπριδα, Il. 5.330, 458:—

a Venus, Opp. H. 4.235.

Cyprus-born, K. Κυθέρεια h.Hom. 10.1: standing alone, Hes. Th. 199 (acc. - γενέα (prob.)), Sol. 26, Pi. O. 10(11).105, etc.:—fem. Κυπρο-γένεια, ἡ, Κ. Ἀφροδίτη Ar. Lys. 551; K. θεά Panyas. 13.3: abs., Pi. P. 4.216, Plu. Art. 28:— Aeol. Κυπρογένηα Sapph. Supp. 14.8, Alc. 60, Theoc. 30.31.

definition: Κύπρος, ἡ, Cyprus, Od. 17.442, al. (never in Il., exc. in Adv. (v. infr.)). Adv. Κυπρόθεν,

Thphr. Od. 25, PPetr. 2p.114 (iii B.C.), etc.

definition: κύπτω, fut. κύψω LXX Ps. 9.31 ( 10.10): aor. ἔκυψα (v. infr.): pf. κέκῡφα Hp. Steril. 217:—

children.definition: bend forward, stoop, πλευρά, τά οἱ κύψαντι παρʼ ἀσπίδος ἐξεφαάνθη Il. 4.468; ἔλαβεν . . κύψας ἐκ πεδίοιο 17.621, cf. 21.69; ὁσσάκι γὰρ κύψειʼ ὁ γέρων πιέειν μενεαίνων κτλ. Od. 11.585; κ. ἐστὴν γῆν Hdt. 3.14; κάτω κ. Ar. V. 279 (lyr.), Thphr. Char. 24.8; κεκυφότες εἰς γῆν καὶ εἰς τραπέζας Pl. R. 586a; χαμᾶζε Plu. Ant. 45: freq. in aor. part. with another Verb, ἔθει κύψας ran with the head down, i.e. at full speed, Ar. Ra. 1091 (anap.); ὁμόσʼ εἶμι κύψας Id. Ec. 863; ἐς τὴν γῆν κύψασα κάτω βαδίζει Id. Fr. 395; κύψας ἐσθίει eats stooping, i.e. greedily, Id. Pax 33; sens. obsc., Hippon. 22 Diehl.

data.quote: πλευρά, τά οἱ κύψαντι παρʼ ἀσπίδος ἐξεφαάνθη
κεκυφότες εἰς γῆν καὶ εἰς τραπέζας
ἐς τὴν γῆν κύψασα κάτω βαδίζει

children.definition: hang the head from shame, οὗτος, τί κύπτεις; Ar. Eq. 1354, Th. 930; or sorrow, Amphis 30.6, Euphro 1.27, or thought, Epicr. 11.21, 23 (anap.).
bow down under a burden, D. 18.323.
κύψαι, = ἀπάγξασθαι, Archil. 35, cf. Phot.

to be bowed forward, opp. the erect figure of man, Arist. PA 657a15; κέρεα κεκυφότα ἐς τὸ ἔμπροσθε horns bent forward, of certain African oxen, Hdt. 4.183; ἐπὴν ὁ στόμαχος [τῆς ὑστέρης] ἐς τὸν ἀρχὸν κεκύφῃ Hp. l.c.

μάζα, Hom. Epigr. 15.6 ( κυρκαίη Suid. s.v. Ὅμηρος).
Κορύβας, Pherecyd. 48 J.; dat. pl. Κυρβάντεσι S. Fr. 862; gen. pl. Κυρβάντων Lyc. 78, Call. Jov. 46.

Persian bonnet or hat, with a peaked crown, prob. much like the τιάρα (q.v.), Hdt. 5.49, 7.64; ὥσπερ βασιλεὺς ὁ μέγας διαβάσκει ἐπὶ τῆς κεφαλῆς τὴν κ. τῶν ὀρνίθων μόνος ὀρθήν (sc. ὁ ἀλεκτρυών) Ar. Av. 487 (cf. Sch.); a cover for a poultice for a womanʼs breast is compared to it in shape, Hp. Mul. 2.186, cf. Aret. CA 1.10.

children.label: II

definition: κύρβεις, εων, αἱ, Ar. Av. 1354, Lys. 30.20, etc.; οἱ, Cratin. 274 (but ταῖς codd. of Plu. Sol. 25), Arist. Ath. 7.1, Euph. 6: κύρβιες AP 4.4 ( Agath.); acc. pl. κύρβιας A.R. 4.280, AP 4.3b.37 ( Agath.): sg., v. infr. III, acc. κύρβιν Nonn. D. 12.55; dat. κύρβιδι ib. 37: (perh. akin to κόρυμβος): —

children.definition: triangular tablets, forming a three-sided pyramid, turning on a pivot, upon which the early laws were inscribed, Cratin. l.c., Ar. l.c., Pl. Plt. 298e, Lys. 30.17, Arist. l.c.; described as being of wood, Plu. l.c.; of brass, Sch. Ar. l.c.; of stone, Apollod. Fr. Hist. 107(a) J.; by some identified with ἄξονες, Eratosth. ap. Sch. A.R. 4.280, Plu. l.c.; by others distd. from them, Ar.Byz. ap. EM 547.52, Sch. A.R. l.c., AB 274, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: pillars or tablets with inscriptions, Pl. l.c., Porph. Abst. 2.21; of maps, A.R. l.c.; of wall-pictures, Nonn. D. 12.32; κ. γηραλέαι, of Homerʼs poems, AP 15.36 ( Cometas), cf. 4.4 ( Agath.): metaph., the pillars of Heracles, ib. 4.3b. 37 ( Id.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Achae. 19; of a pettifogging lawyer, as if a walking statute-book, Ar. Nu. 448 (anap.); κ. ἑταιρικῶν κακῶν, of a ἑταίρα, Aristaenet. 1.17, cf. Zen. 4.77.
κ. ἀργυρᾶ ἐν σανιδίῳ προσηλωμένη IG ΙΙ(2).161 B 76, 199 B 10 ( Delos, iii B.C.).
Call. Fr. 564.
of Cyrus: οἱ K., his troops, X. HG 3.2.7, al.

definition: κυρέω, A. Pr. 332, S. Tr. 386: impf. ἐκύρουν [ῠ] Id. El. 1331: fut. κῠρήσω A. Ch. 707, Hdt. 1.112: aor. ἐκύρησα Hes. Op. 755, Archil. 18, Hom. Epigr. 6.6, Hdt. 1.31, E. Hec. 215 (lyr.): pf. κεκύρηκα Pl. Alc. 2.141b:—also κύρω [ῡ], Parm. 8.49, A.R. 2.363, AP 9.710, etc.: impf. ἔκῡρον S. OC 1159; Ep. κῦρον Il. 23.821, h.Cer. 189, h.Ven. 174: fut. κύρσω Democr. 243, S. OC 225 (lyr.): aor. ἔκυρσα, part. κύρσας Il. 3.23, Hes. Sc. 426, Op. 691, E. Med. 1363:— Med., κύρομαι [ῡ] in act. sense, Il. 24.530:—

children.definition: Ion. and (rarely) in other Prose:

children.label: I
children.definition: hit, light upon,

meet with, fall in with, ἄλλοτε μὲν . . κακῷ . . κύρεται ἄλλοτε δʼ ἐσθλῷ Il. 24.530; πήματι κύρσαι Hes. Op. 691; λέων ὣς σώματι κύρσας Id. Sc. l.c.; ἅρματι κύρσας having struck against it, Il. 23.428; μέγα δένδρεον αἰθέρι κῦρον reaching to . . , Call. Cer. 38, cf. A.R. 2.363, 4.945, AP 9.710; so ἐν πείρασι κ. Parm. 8.49.

data.quote: ἄλλοτε μὲν . . κακῷ . . κύρεται ἄλλοτε δʼ ἐσθλῷ

children.label: b
children.definition: κυρεῖν τινι befall or be granted to him, S. OC 1290, Tr. 291, E. Hec. 215 (lyr.); also εἰς ὅ τι κύρει ἕκαστα ‘which way the wind blows’, Timo 48.5 [822].

hit the mark, ἔκυρσας ὥστε τοξότης . . σκοποῦ A. Ag. 628; reach to or as far as, μελάθρου κῦρε κάρη h.Cer. 189; meet with, find, αἰδοίων βροτῶν κυρῆσαι Hom. Epigr. 6.6; πικροῦ δʼ ἔκυρσας . . μνηστῆρος A. Pr. 739; Ἰαόνων ναυβατᾶν κύρσαντες Id. Pers. 1012 (lyr.); αἰθερίας νεφέλας κύρσαιμι would I could reach . . , S. OC 1082 (lyr.).

children.label: b

Hdt. 1.31; καθαρσίου ib. 35 (v.l.); βασιληΐης ταφῆς ib. 112; δίκης Id. 9.116; ἀτιμίης πρός τινων Id. 7.158; κυρήσει νοστίμου σωτηρίας A. Pers. 797; στυγερᾶς μοίρας τῆσδε κυρήσας ib. 910 (anap.); κυροῦντα τῶν ἐπαξίων Id. Pr. 70; βίου λῴονος κυρῆσαι S. OT 1514; δυσπότμων γάμων κυρήσας Id. Ant. 870 (lyr.); μητρὸς ὡς κακῆς ἐκύρσατε E. Med. 1363, cf. Ion 1105 (lyr.); ἀμοιβῆς ἔκ τινος κυρεῖν Id. Med. 23, cf. Supp. 1170; ἀγαθῶν Pl. Alc. 2.141b, Herod. 3.57; ληΐης Id. 2.45; τόσσων ἐκύρησεν ὅσʼ οὐ πευσεῖσθε βέβαλοι Theoc. 3.51.

data.quote: τόσσων ἐκύρησεν ὅσʼ οὐ πευσεῖσθε βέβαλοι

children.definition: reach, find, τί νῦν . . κυρῶ; A. Ch. 214; βίον εὖ κυρήσας Id. Th. 699 (lyr.); ἐπʼ ἀκταῖς νιν κυρῶ E. Hec. 698; τέρμονα κύρειν dub. cj. in Id. Hipp. 746 (lyr.), cf. Opp. H. 1.34.

children.label: b
children.definition: obtain, κυρούντων τὰ πρόσφορα A. Ch. 714.

children.label: II
children.definition: happen, come to pass, τί ποτʼ αὐτίκα κύρσει; S. OC 225 (lyr.); καλῶς, εὖ κυρεῖ turns out well, A. Th. 23, S. El. 799; of a person, Ἀτρείδην εἰδέναι κυροῦνθʼ ὅπως how he fares, A. Ag. 1371; also ἕτερα ἀφʼ ἑτέρων κακὰ κυρεῖ follow, E. Hec. 690 (lyr.); ἄλλα δʼ ἐξ ἄλλων κ. Id. IT 865 (lyr.).
to be right, hit the mark, γνώμῃ κυρήσας by intelligence, S. OT 398: c. part., τόδʼ ἂν λέγων κυρήσαις in saying, A. Supp. 589 (lyr.); ἐπεικάζων κυρῶ; S. El. 663.

children.label: b
children.definition: to be successful, prosper, Democr. 243.

part., turn out, prove to be so and so, σεσωσμένος κυρεῖ A. Pers. 503, cf. Ag. 1201; ποῦ ποτʼ ὢν κυρεῖς; S. Ph. 805; θύων ἔκυρον Id. OC 1159; ἐχθρὸς ὢν κυρεῖ E. Alc. 954; εἰ κυρεῖ τις πέλας . . οἶκτον ἀΐων A. Supp. 58 (lyr.): with part. omitted, acting merely as the copula, ἐκτὸς αἰτίας κυρεῖς Id. Pr. 332, cf. Pers. 598; ποῦ γῆς κυρεῖ; S. Aj. 984; φονέα σε φημὶ . . κυρεῖν Id. OT 362; ἐν κακῷ τῳ φαίνῃ κυρῶν Id. Ph. 741; ἐν πύλαισι . . κυρεῖ E. Ph. 1067; ἔνθα πημάτων κυρῶ Id. Tr. 685.

data.quote: εἰ κυρεῖ τις πέλας . . οἶκτον ἀΐων

children.definition: κ. πρός . . refer to, οὔτʼ εἶπον οὐδὲν πρός <σε> κῦρον Trag.Adesp. 226; τὰ πρὸς διαβολὴν κυροῦντα Plb. 12.15.9.
butt with the horns, like goats or rams, Sch. Ar. l.c.: metaph., τὸ σκέλος κυρηβάσει he shall butt against my leg, Ar. l.c.: aor. Med. κυρηβάσασθαι Cratin. 462.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., = λοιδοροῦμαι, Hsch. ( κυριβ- cod.), Phot.
butting with the horns, Sch. Ar. Eq. 272, Suid.
quarreller, prob. in Hsch. ( κυριβ- cod.).
husks, bran, Cratin. 295, Hp. Nat.Mul. 58, Epicur. Fr. 293, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: bran-shop, Ar. Eq. 254.
dealer in bran, Ar. Fr. 696 (lyr.).

definition: κυρηβίων, ωνος, ὁ, nickname of Epicrates, D. 19.287, Ath. 6.242d.

children.definition: Hsch. (- ιβος cod.).
windfall, Phot., Suid.
Cyrenaic: οἱ K. the disciples of Aristippus of Cyrene, D.L. 2.85; Κυρηναϊκὴ φιλοσοφία, αἵρεσις, Str. 17.3.22, D.L. 1.18.

definition: Κυρήνη, ἡ, Cyrene, Hdt. 4.162, etc.:— Adj. Κυρηναῖος, α, ον, ib. 199, etc. [ ῠ in Hes. Fr. 128.2, Pi. P. 4.2, al., Call. Ap. 73, 94; ῡ Ar. Th. 98, A.R. 2.500.]

children.definition: authority, power, Arist. Mir. 837a5, etc.; possession, control, οἴνου Plb. 6.11A. 4; ταμιείου Id. 6.13.1; τοῦ ἐπαποστεῖλαι στρατηγόν Id. 6.15.6; κυρίαν ἔχειν περί τινος Id. 6.14.10.—The form κυρεία is freq. found in Pap. and Inscrr. from i B.C., as BGU 1123.6 (i B.C.), PAmh. 2.95i6 (ii A.D.), and codd., as Plb. 6.11A. 4, LXX Da. 11.5, Thd. Da. 4.19, 6.26(7), Ph. 2.52 (v.l.), Ath. 10.440f (v.l.), EM 427.9, and is required by metre in Man. 4.606: contr. from κυριεία (q.v.).

children.label: II
children.definition: κύριος (q.v.).

of or for an owner or master, Stud.Pal. 22.177.18 (ii A.D.); but usu. of the Roman Emperor, ὁ κ. φίσκος the fiscus, CIG 2827 (Aphrod.), Supp.Epigr. 2.567 (Caria (?)); κ. ψῆφοι, λόγος, OGI 669.13, 18 ( Egypt, i A.D.); κ. χρῆμα POxy. 474.41 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: belonging to the Lord (Christ): K. δεῖπνον the Lordʼs Supper, 1 Ep.Cor. 11.20; ἡ K. ἡμέρα the Lordʼs day, Apoc. 1.10; τὸ Κυριακόν (sc. δῶμα) the Lordʼs house, Edict. Maximini ap. Eus. PE 9.10.

children.label: III
children.definition: Subst. κυριακός, ὁ, spirit invoked in magic, PMag.Par. 1.916.

proprietary rights, Mitteis Chr. 31 v 37 (ii B.C.), IG 2(2).1006.28 (ii B.C.), SIG 685.133 (pl., Magn.Mae., ii B.C.), BGU 1187.7 (i B.C.):—written κυριήα Mon. Anc.Gr. 17.22:—later contr. κυρεία, κυρία (q.v.).

concerning rights of property, χρηματισμοί Sammelb. 5232.22 (i A.D.); δίκαιον Stud.Pal. 20.117.4 (v A.D.). Adv. -κῶς with full proprietary rights, PAmh. 2.99 ( b).5 (ii A.D.), PStrassb. 29.8, al. (iii A.D.).

to be lord or master of, πάντων X. Mem. 2.6.22, cf. Arist. EN 1160b35; τῆς Ἀσίας X. Mem. 3.5.11; μυρίων γῆς πήχεων Men. 1099, cf. PEleph. 14.14 (iii B.C.), etc.; τῶν γενημάτων PTeb. 105.47 (ii B.C.); τῆς θαλάττης Agatharch. 5; ὧν ἁ πόλις . . κυριεύει IG 5(2).510.4 ( Arc., ii B.C.); κυριεύειν τὴν γυναῖκα τοῦ ἀνδρός D.S. 1.27; σανίδων Phld. Mort. 24; νεκρῶν καὶ ζώντων Ep.Rom. 14.9; κρατεῖν καὶ κ. PStrassb. 14.22 (iii A.D.); gain possession of, seize, ζωγρίᾳ τινῶν Plb. 1.7.11, al., cf. Ph. Bel. 80.41: later c. acc., τὰ σώματα καὶ τὴν βοῦν κ. PGrenf. 1.21.13 (ii B.C.); τοῦ κυριεύοντος τὴν ὅλην οἰκουμένην PMag.Lond. 121.838: abs., to be dominant, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.244:— Pass., to be dominated, possessed, ὑπό τινος Arist. Mir. 838a10.

data.quote: τὰ σώματα καὶ τὴν βοῦν κ.

children.label: b
children.definition: κ. τοῦ σχήματος Ptol. Tetr. 169, cf. Vett.Val. 63.23:— Pass., οἱ -όμενοι τόποι Ptol. Tetr. 112.
to have legal power to do, c. inf., Lex ap. Aeschin. 1.35.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ κυριεύων (sc. λόγος, wh. is expressed in Arr. Epict. 2.19.1), a logical puzzle, Plu. QConv. 2.615a, Luc. Vit.Auct. 22, etc., cf. Stoic. 2.93.
EM 548.2:— Pass., κυρίζεσθε· τρίβεσθε, Hsch.

definition: κύριθον τὴν σφαῖραν, Hsch. κύριθρα, τά,

children.definition: wooden masks, Id.; cf. κυριττοί.
narrow-necked jug, = βομβύλιος, Poll. 10.68.
butting with the horns, Ael. NA 16.20.
slaying a sovereign lord, κ. πράξεις, of those who killed the son of Saul, J. AJ 7.2.1.
use words in their proper or literal sense, Alex.Aphr. in SE 166.6; opp. τροπολεκτεω, in Pass., Eust. 633.26, 836.58; κυριολεκτῶν, opp. καταχρηστικῶς, Phlp. in de An. 490.19.
use of literal, opp. figurative, expressions, Herm. in Phdr. p.192 A., Eust. 624.41.
Magnus ap. Gal. 8.640, Steph. in Hp. 2.420 D.
Agatharch. 21 (pl.), Phld. Rh. 1.174 S., Longin. 28.1, Magnus ap. Gal. 8.641; proper meaning of a word, A.D. Adv. 190.3; = ἀκριβολογία, Gal. 18(2).526.

definition: κύριος [ ῡ], α, ον, also ος, ον A. Supp. 732, E. Heracl. 143, Arist. Pol. 1306b20:—Thess. κῦρρος IG 9(2).517.20 ( Larissa, iii B.C.): ( κῦρος) (not in Hom.):

children.label: I
children.definition: having power or authority over, c. gen., Ζεὺς ὁ πάντων κ. Pi. I. 5(4).53, cf. P. 2.58; ἐμῶν τε καὶ σῶν κ. πιστωμάτων A. Ag. 878; πρὶν ἄν σε κ. στήσω τέκνων put thee in possession of . . , S. OC 1041; κύριοι πολιτείας Antipho 3.1.1; κ. καταλύσεως Th. 4.20; εἰρήνης καὶ πολέμου X. HG 2.2.18; -ώτατοι τοῦ ἱεροῦ Th. 5.53 (but ὁ -ώτατος θεὸς τοῦ ἱεροῦ, of the god to whom a temple is dedicated, OGI 90.39 ( Rosetta, ii B.C.)); τῶν αὑτοὺ κ. Pl. Lg. 929d, cf. Isoc. 19.34, etc.; θανάτου κ. τινός with power of life and death over, Pl. Criti. 120d; κ. περί τινος Arist. Pol. 1286a24.

data.quote: ἐμῶν τε καὶ σῶν κ. πιστωμάτων

children.definition: κύριός εἰμι c. inf., I have authority to do, am entitled to do, A. Ag. 104 (lyr.); οὗτος κ. ὁρκωμοτεῖν (prob. for - ῶν) E. Supp. 1189; κ. ἀπολέσαι, σῶσαι δʼ ἄκυροι And. 4.9, cf. Th. 5.63, 8.5; - ώτεροι δοῦναι better able to give, Id. 4.18; οὐ . . κ. οὔτε ἀνελέσθαι πόλεμον οὔτε καταλῦσαι X. An. 5.7.27; δοῦλοι κ. μαστιγοῦν τοὺς ἐλευθέρους Ephor. 29 J.; αἱ ἀρχαὶ κ. κρίνειν Arist. Pol. 1287b16; also κ. τοῦ μὴ μεθυσθῆναι having power not to . . , Id. EN 1113b32: c. acc. et inf., κ. εἶναι ἢ τοίαν εἶναι [πόλιν] ἢ τοίαν Pl. R. 429b.

data.quote: οὐ . . κ. οὔτε ἀνελέσθαι πόλεμον οὔτε καταλῦσαι
κ. εἶναι ἢ τοίαν εἶναι [πόλιν] ἢ τοίαν

children.definition: κ. γενέσθαι, ὅντινα δεῖ καταστήσασθαι Is. 6.4.
part., πριαμένους τι ἢ πωλοῦντας κυρίους εἶναι Th. 5.34; κ. ἦν πράσσων ταῦτα Id. 8.51, cf. Plb. 6.37.8, 18.37.10; κύριοι ἐόντω συλέοντες Schwyzer 337.13 (Delph.).

data.quote: πριαμένους τι ἢ πωλοῦντας κυρίους εἶναι

children.definition: having authority, supreme, τί τῶνδε κυριωτέρους μένεις; A. Supp. 965; -ώτερος σέθεν E. Ba. 505; ὁ πατὴρ μέχρι τούτου κ. [ἐστι] Arist. Rh. 1402a1; τὸ κ. the sovereign power in a state, Id. Pol. 1281a11, cf. Pl. R. 565a, etc.; τὰ κ. the supreme authorities, D. 19.259, Arist. Rh. 1365b27; τὰ τῆσδε τῆς γῆς κ. S. OC 915; at Athens, κ. ἐκκλησία a sovereign or principal assembly, Ar. Ach. 19, Arist. Ath. 43.4, IG 1(2).42.22, al., 2(2).493.8, etc.; ἀγορὰ κ. ib. 1298.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ τῆς ὥρας τῆς καταρχῆς κ. [ἀστήρ] Serapio in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.99: but usu. abs., authoritative, decisive, δίκαι E. Heracl. l.c., And. 1.88, Pl. Cri. 50b; μῦθος -ώτερος of more authority, E. IA 318 (troch.); - ωτάτη τῶν ἐπιστημῶν [ἡ πολιτική] Arist. Pol. 1282b15; αἱ -ώτεραι ἀρχαί Id. Cael. 285a26, cf. Metaph. 997a12; [ ἡ φρόνησις] τῆς σοφίας κυριωτέρα Id. EN 1143b34; - ωτέρα ἡ καθόλου [ἀπόδειξις] Id. APo. 86a23; τάραχος ὁ -ώτατος Epicur. Ep. 1p.30U.; of sovereign remedies, -ωτάτη τῶν καθάρσεων Pl. Sph. 230d; -ωτάτη κένωσις Gal. 1.299; important, principal, κ. δόξαι, of certain doctrines of Epicurus, Phld. Ir. p.86 W.; τὰ -ώτατα μέρη τῆς φύσεως Epicur. Sent. 9; -ώτερα μέρη τοῦ σώματος Philostr. Gym. 50; τὰ -ώτατα the principal organs, Gal. 1.385 (but, the most important matters, Epicur. Sent. 16); τὸ -ώτατον τῆς Ἐφέσου Philostr. VS 1.22.4: Gramm., κ. τόνος principal accent, D.T. Supp. 674.32.

ἄκυρος, valid, νόμος, δόγματα, D. 24.1, Pl. Lg. 926d; κ. ποιεῖν [τὴν γνῶσιν], opp. ἄκυρον π., D. 21.92, cf. 39.15; τὰς συνθήκας κυρίας ποιεῖν Lys. 18.15; ἡ συγγραφὴ ἥδε κ. ἔστω PEleph. 1.14 (iv B.C.); ἔστω τὰ κριθέντα κ. Lex ap. D. 21.94; so τὰς τῶν ἄλλων δόξας κ. ποιεῖν Pl. Tht. 179b.

data.quote: τὰς τῶν ἄλλων δόξας κ. ποιεῖν

children.definition: ordained, appointed, ἡ κυρίη ἡμέρη Hdt. 5.50, cf. 93 (pl.); ἡ κ. τῶν ἡμερέων Id. 1.48, 6.129; κ. ἐν ἡμέρᾳ A. Supp. 732; τόδε κ. ἦμαρ E. Alc. 105 (lyr.), etc.; κ. μήν, of a woman with child, i.e. the ninth month, Pi. O. 6.32; ὅταν τὸ κ. μόλῃ φάος (prob.) the appointed time, A. Ag. 766 (lyr.); κ. μένει τέλος Id. Eu. 544 (lyr.); ἡ κ. [ἡμέρα] D. 21.84, cf. Test. ib. 93; but αἱ κ. [ἡμεραι], = κριτικαί, Hp. Aff. 9.
legitimate, lawful, ὕπνος πόνος τε, κ. ξυνωμόται A. Eu. 127, cf. 327; κύριʼ ἔχοντες having lawful power, ib. 960 (lyr.).

ἡ κ. ἀρετή goodness proper, real goodness, Arist. EN 1144b4; [ φλοιὸς] ὁ κ. Thphr. HP 4.15.1; Rhet. and Gramm., κ. ὄνομα the real or actual, hence current, ordinary, name of a thing, opp. μεταφορά, γλῶττα, Arist. Rh. 1404b6, 1410b12, Po. 1457b3, cf. D.H. Comp. 21, D.L. 10.13, etc.; σπάνει κυρίου ὀνόματος for lack of a current term, D.H. Comp. 24; - ώτατα ὀνόματα most ordinary terms, ib. 3 (hence also κ. ὄνομα proper, personal name, Plb. 6.46.10, A.D. Pron. 10.11, al., Hdn. 7.5.8; ὄνομα alone in this sense, Diog.Bab.Stoic. 3.213); κ. [λέξεις] Phld. Rh. 1.181 S.; κατὰ τὸν κ. τρόπον, opp. καταχρωμένη, ib. 1.59 S.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. κυρίως, v. sub voc.

children.label: B
children.definition: Subst. κύριος, ὁ, lord, master, τοῖσι κ. δωμάτων A. Ch. 658, cf. 689, S. Aj. 734, etc.; ὁ κ. alone, head of a family, master of a house (cf. Sch. Ar. Eq. 965), Antipho 2.4.7, Ar. Pl. 6, Arist. Pol. 1269b10; τοὺς κ. τῶν οἰκιῶν PTeb. 5.147 (ii B.C.); also, guardian of a woman, Is. 6.32, PGrenf. 2.15 i 13 (ii B.C.), etc.: generally, guardian, trustee, Is. 2.10, D. 43.15, 46.19, Men. Epit. 89, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: κύριε, as a form of respectful address, sir, Ev.Jo. 12.21, 20.15, Act.Ap. 16.30 (pl.), PFay. 106.15 (ii A.D.), etc.

κυρία, ἡ, mistress, lady of the house, Philem. 223, LXX Is. 24.2, etc.; κ. τῆς οἰκίας Men. 403: in voc., madam, D.C. 48.44; applied to women from fourteen years upwards, Epict. Ench. 40. (In later Gr. freq. written κύρα, PGrenf. 1.61.4 (vi A.D.), etc.)

children.label: b
children.definition: Ἶσις, OGI 180 ( Egypt, i B.C.), etc.

Σεκνεβτῦνις ὁ κ. θεός PTeb. 284.6 (i B.C.); Κρόνος κ. CIG 4521 ( Abila, i A.D.); Ζεὺς κ. Supp.Epigr. 2.830 ( Damascus, iii A.D.); κ. Σάραπις POxy. 110.2 (ii A.D); ἡ κ. Ἄρτεμις IG 4.1124 ( Tibur, ii A.D.); of deified rulers, τοῦ κ. βασιλέος θεοῦ OGI 86.8 ( Egypt, i B.C.); οἱ κ. θεοὶ μέγιστοι, of Ptolemy XIV and Cleopatra, Berl.Sitzb. 1902.1096: hence, of rulers in general, βασιλεὺς Ἡρώδης κ. OGI 415 ( Judaea, i B.C.); of Roman Emperors, BGU 1200.11 ( Augustus), POxy. 37 i 6 ( Claudius), etc.
ὁ Κύριος, = Hebr. Yahweh, LXX Ge. 11.5, al.; of Christ, 1 Ep.Cor. 12.3, etc.
dominion, Ep.Eph. 1.21: in pl., Ep.Col. 1.16.
authority, PMasp. 151.199 (vi A.D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: proper, legitimate use of a term, Dam. Pr. 306; = Lat. proprietas, Dosith. p.376 K.
Phld. Piet. 107 ( Pass.).

definition: κυρίσσω, Att. κυρίττω, fut. - ίξω (v. infr.),

children.definition: butt with the horns, like rams, Arist. GA 769b20, cf. Phot.; of bulls, ὁ ταῦρος δʼ ἔοικεν κυρίξειν A. Fr. 23, cf. Pl. Grg. 516a; κ. ἀλλήλους σιδηροῖς κέρασι Id. R. 586b; μόσχος κυρίττων Gal. 4.692; ὁ κυρίττων (sc. λόγος), a logical puzzle, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.94: metaph., of floating corpses knocking against the shore, κ. ἰσχυρὰν χθόνα A. Pers. 310.
players who wear wooden masks, in Italy, Hsch.; cf. κύριθρα.
call by a proper name, Eust. 635.6 ( Pass.).
use of a proper name, Eust. 652.40, etc.
by a proper name, οὐ κ. εἶπε τὸν Πᾶνα Pediasim. ad Theoc. Syrinx 3.
like a lord or master, with full authority, τὰς πόλεις κ. παρείληφεν Isoc. 4.137; κ. ζημιοῦν Arist. Ath. 3.6, SIG 1004.11 ( Oropus, iv B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: surely, by fixed decree, A. Ch. 785 (lyr.).
regularly, lawfully, κ. ἔχειν to be fixed, hold good, Id. Ag. 178 (lyr.), Is. 7.26; κ. γίγνεσθαι Pl. Lg. 925c; κ. αἰτεῖσθαι, suo jure, S. Ph. 63; δόντος τοῦ πατρός D. 36.32.

children.label: III
children.definition: precisely, exactly, διόψεσθαι τὸ ἀληθές Pl. Prm. 136c.

children.label: IV
children.definition: properly, πρώτως καὶ κ. Arist. EN 1157a31; τὸ κ. [ἓν καὶ εἶναι] Id. de An. 412b9; esp. of words, in the proper sense, opp. μεταφορᾷ or κατὰ μεταφοράν, κ. κατά τινος κατηγορεῖσθαι Id. Top. 123a35, cf. 139b36; κ. λέγεσθαι Id. Metaph. 1015a14, cf. Str. 3.5.5, Phld. Po. 5.19, etc.; ἡ λέξις αὕτη τοῦτο σημαίνει κ. Plb. 2.22.1; properly speaking, D.T. 632.23: Comp. - ώτερον, λέγεσθαι Arist. EN 1098a6: Sup. - ώτατα, λέγεσθαι Id. Cat. 14a27.

data.quote: κατὰ μεταφοράν, κ. κατά τινος κατηγορεῖσθαι
ἡ λέξις αὕτη τοῦτο σημαίνει κ.

children.label: V
children.definition: in a special (i.e. exceptional) sense, Olymp. in Mete. 306.29.
mix: metaph., plot, κ. ὄλεθρόν τινι Ar. Th. 429, cf. 852: in literal sense, Hp. Mul. 1.57 ( Pass.), cf. EM 543.53.

that which one meets with or finds: hence, booty, prey, spoil, κ. γίγνομαι, c. dat., ἀνδράσι δυσμενέεσσιν ἕλωρ καὶ κύρμα γένησθε Il. 5.488; κυσὶ κύρμα γενέσθαι 17.272; οἰωνοῖσιν ἕλωρ καὶ κ. γ. Od. 3.271; θήρεσσιν 5.473; φώκῃσι καὶ ἰχθύσι 15.480.

data.quote: ἀνδράσι δυσμενέεσσιν ἕλωρ καὶ κύρμα γένησθε

children.label: II
children.definition: one who gets booty, swindler, Ar. Av. 431.

definition: κύρνα κρανία, Hsch. κύρνικα· κώδια, Id.

children.definition: Cyrnus, ancient name of Corsica, Hdt. 1.165:— Adj. Κύρνιοι, οἱ, Id. 7.165; Κυρνία γῆ, prov. of a nest of robbers, Diogenian. 5.35.

children.label: II
children.definition: κύρνος, ὁ, bastard (Maced.), Phot., cf. Hsch.
ὁ πρότερος, the elder Cyrus, Hdt. 1.46, etc.
ὁ νεώτερος, the brother of Artaxerxes, X. An. 1.1.1, etc.

supreme power, authority, κ. ἔχειν ἀμφί τινος A. Supp. 391; τῶν πρηγμάτων τὸ κ. ἔχειν Hdt. 6.109; ἅπαν τὸ κ. ἔχειν Th. 5.38, cf. Pl. Grg. 450e, al.; κ. ἔχειν περί τινος Id. Cra. 435c; τὸ κ. τῆς ἐνεργείας principle or origin of a function, Gal. 10.459.
one invested with authority, Pl. Lg. 700c.

children.label: II
children.definition: confirmation, validity, ἔχειν κ., = κεκυρῶσθαι, S. OC 1779 (anap.), cf. POxy. 2110.12 (iv A.D.), etc.; ἡ νῦν . . ὑπάρξει κ. ἡμέρα καλῶν S. El. 919; κ. λαβεῖν, of a law, to be ratified, D.C. 38.17, al.:— κῦρος and all derivs. are post- Hom. (Cf. Skt. śūas ‘valiant’, OIr. caur ‘hero’, Welsh cawr ‘giant’.)

data.quote: ἡ νῦν . . ὑπάρξει κ. ἡμέρα καλῶν

children.definition: confirm, ratify, δόμοις . . τήνδʼ ἐκύρωσας φάτιν A. Pers. 227 (troch.); τῇδʼ ἐκύρωσεν φάτις ib. 521; ταῦτα Hdt. l.c.; τὸν γάμον Id. 6.126; ἡ ἐκκλησία κυρώσασα ταῦτα διελύθη Th. 8.69; Ζεῦ, ταῦτα κυρώσειας Ar. Th. 369 (lyr.); μοῖραν Pl. R. 620e; τὴν γνώμην Plb. 1.11.1; τὰς διαλύσεις Id. 1.17.1:— Med., accomplish oneʼs end, λόγῳ κυροῦται τὰ πάντα Pl. Grg. 451c, cf. d:— Pass., to be ratified, determined, ἐκεκύρωτο ὁ γάμος Κλεισθένεϊ Hdt. 6.130; οὐδὲ κυρωθῆναι ἔμενον τὸ πρῆγμα Id. 8.56, cf. Th. 4.125; τοὺς κυρωθέντας [τῶν νόμων] And. 1.85, cf. D. 20.93; τὸ ψήφισμα τὸ κυρωθὲν περὶ τούτων IG 7.303.45 (Orop.); κυρωθέντος τοῦ δόγματος Plb. 1.11.3; of a contract, to be sanctioned, PPetr. 2p.44 (iii B.C.); in auctions, to be knocked down, BGU 992i9 (ii B.C.); ὁ κυρωθείς the highest bidder, to whom an object is knocked down, PRev.Laws 48.17 (iii B.C.): generally, ποῖ κεκύρωται τέλος; at what point hath the end been fixed or determined? A. Supp. 603, cf. Ch. 874, E. Hipp. 746 (v.l.); πρὶν κεκυρῶσθαι σφαγάς before it has been accomplished, Id. El. 1069: c. inf., ἐκεκύρωτο συμβάλλειν it had been decided to fight, Hdt. 6.110; ἐκυρώθη ναυμαχέειν Id. 8.56.

definition: κύω, post- Hom. form of κυέω ( aor. 1 in Ep., v. infr. II):

children.label: I
children.definition: pres. and impf., of females, conceive, Λάβδα κύει τέξει δὲ κτλ. Orac. ap. Hdt. 5.92.βʹ, cf. Ar. Fr. 609, Pl. Lg. 789e, etc.; κύω μῆνα ὄγδοον ἤδη Luc. DMeretr. 2.1; κ. ἀπό τινος Id. Gall. 19: metaph., κύει πόλις ἥδε Thgn. 39.

to be pregnant with, οὐδὲ κύουσι πολλὰ κυήματα Arist. HA 543b22; παιδίον Luc. DMeretr. 2.4: metaph., ἡ ψυχή μου ἀεὶ τοῦτο κύουσα (al. κυοῦσα) διῆγεν X. Cyr. 5.4.35:— Pass., to be borne in the womb, τὰ κυόμενα παιδία Arist. Pr. 860a21, Jul. Or. 2.99c.

children.label: II
children.definition: aor. Act. ἔκῡσα, causal, of the male, impregnate, metaph., ὄμβρος ἔκυσε γαῖαν A. Fr. 44.4:— aor. Med. ἐκῡσάμην, of the female, conceive, οὓς τέκε κυσαμένη Hes. Th. 125, cf. 405, h.Hom. 1.4; Ζηνί by Zeus, Asius Fr.Ep. 1.3 K.; ὅσσους . . Τυφάονι κύσατο Κητώ Euph. 112.—The forms κυέω and κύω seem synonymous, but κυέω ( κυῶ) is the better-attested form in Att. Prose ( κύοντα only v.l. in Pl. Tht. 151b, κύοντες is read in Arist. HA 544a23 (v.l. κύονες, ποιοῦντες) , κύοντα ib. 585a3, κυόμενα ( v.l. - ούμενα) Pr. l.c., κυόμενον ( v.l. - ούμενον) GA 730b4, but κυοῦντες HA 610b3; ἐκύομεν LXX Is. 59.13).—The pres. κύω has ῠ in verse, but forms of κῠέω can be restored by altering the accent.—The causal sense belongs only to the aor. ἔκῡσα.

definition: κύων [ ῠ], ὁ and ἡ, both in Hom., the masc. more freq., gen. κῠνός, dat. κῠνί, acc. κύνα, voc. κύον Il. 8.423, κύων Archipp. 6: pl., nom. κύνες, gen. κυνῶν, dat. κυσί Il. 17.272, al., Ep. κύνεσσι 1.4, acc. κύνας:—

children.definition: dog, bitch, Hom., etc.; of shepherds’ dogs, Il. 10.183, 12.303; watch-dogs, 22.66; but in Hom. more freq. of hounds, Il. 8.338, al.; κυσὶ θηρευτῇσι 11.325; κύνε εἰδότε θήρης 10.360; later, when of hounds, mostly in fem., S. Aj. 8, E. Hipp. 18, etc.; κ. Λάκαινα Pi. Fr. 106, S. l.c., X. Cyn. 10.1, cf. Arist. HA 608a27, al.; Μολοττικαὶ κ. Alexis Hist. ap. Ath. 12.540d, etc.; but Ἰνδικοί Arist. GA 746a34, cf. Hdt. 1.192: prov., κυσὶν πεινῶσιν οὐχὶ βρώσιμα ‘not fit for a dog’, Com.Adesp. 1205.4; χεῖρον ἐρεθίσαι γραῦν ἢ κύνα Men. 802; κύνα δέρειν δεδαρμένην ‘flog a dead horse’, Pherecr. 179; ἡ κ. κατακειμένη ἐν τῇ φάτνῃ ‘dog in the manger’, Luc. Ind. 30, al.; χαλεπὸν χορίω κύνα γεῦσαι itʼs ill to let a dog ‘taste blood’, Theoc. 10.11; νή or μὰ τὸν κύνα was a favourite oath of Socrates, Pl. Ap. 22a (cf. Sch.), Grg. 482b; used familiarly at Athens, Ar. V. 83; οἷς ἦν μέγιστος ὅρκος . . κύων, ἔπειτα χήν· θεοὺς δʼ ἐσίγων, of primitive men, Cratin. 231.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom. of women, to denote shamelessness or audacity; applied by Helen to herself, Il. 6.344, 356; by Iris to Athena, 8.423; by Hera to Artemis, 21.481: of the maids in the house of Odysseus, Od. 18.338, al.: later, in a coarse sense, Ar. V. 1402; ἡ ῥαψῳδὸς κ., of the Sphinx, S. OT 391, cf. A. Fr. 236 (lyr.); of men, κακαὶ κ. Il. 13.623; implying recklessness, 8.299, 527, Od. 17.248, 22.35; also of offensive persons, compared to yapping dogs, LXX Ps. 21(22).17, Ep.Phil. 3.2; κ. λαίθαργος, = λαθροδήκτης, metaph., of a person, S. Fr. 885, cf. E. Fr. 555: prov., μὴ δῶτε τὸ ἅγιον τοῖς κ. Ev.Matt. 7.6.

data.quote: μὴ δῶτε τὸ ἅγιον τοῖς κ.

children.definition: watch-dog, guardian, τῶν σταθμῶν κ., of Agamemnon, A. Ag. 896; δωμάτων κ., of Clytemnestra, ib. 607, cf. Ar. Eq. 1023.

ἀρέσκει τούτοις κυνῶν μεταμφιέννυσθαι βίον Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.8: hence, Cynic philosopher, Arist. Rh. 1411a24, AP 7.65 ( Antip.), 413 ( Id.), Plu. QConv. 2.717c, Ath. 5.216b, Epigr. ap. D.L. 6.19, 60, Baillet Inscriptions des tombeaux des rois 172.

children.label: III
children.definition: servants, agents or watchers of the gods, Διὸς πτηνὸς κύων, of the eagle, A. Pr. 1022, cf. Ag. 136 (lyr.), S. Fr. 884; of the griffins, Ζηνὸς ἀκραγεῖς κ. A. Pr. 803; of the Furies, μετάδρομοι . . πανουργημάτων ἄφυκτοι κ. S. El. 1388 (lyr.), cf. A. Ch. 924, E. Fr. 383; Pan is the κύων of Cybele, Pi. Fr. 96: Pythag., Περσεφόνης κύνες, of the planets, Arist. Fr. 196: so Com., Ἡφαίστου κ., of sparks, Alex. 149.16; of various mythical beings, as Cerberus, κ. Ἀΐδαο Il. 8.368, cf. Od. 11.623, X. An. 6.2.2; Harpies, A.R. 2.289; of Hecate, in Mithraic worship, Porph. Abst. 4.16; of the Βάκχαι, Λύσσας κ. E. Ba. 977 (lyr.); Λέρνας κ., of the hydra, Id. HF 420 (lyr.); of a great fish, Τρίτωνος κ. Lyc. 34.

children.label: IV
children.definition: dog-fish or shark, Od. 12.96, cf. Epich. 68, Cratin. 161, Arist. HA 566a31; κ. ἄγριος, κ. γαλεός and κ. κεντρίτης or κεντρίνη, Opp. H. 1.373, Ael. NA 1.55; ξιφίας κ., of the sword-fish, Anaxipp. 2.3.

children.label: V
children.definition: dog-star, i.e. the hound of Orion, Il. 22.29; in full, σειρίου κυνὸς δίκην S. Fr. 803, cf. A. Ag. 967; κυνὸς ψυχρὰν δύσιν S. Fr. 432.11; πρὸ τοῦ κυνός Eup. 147; μετὰ κυνὸς ἐπιτολήν, περὶ κ. ἐ., Arist. Mete. 361b35, HA 602a26; ἐπὶ κυνί ib. 600a4, Syngr. ap. D. 35.13; ὑπὸ κύνα Arist. HA 547a14, D.S. 19.109; περὶ κύνα Thphr. CP 3.3.3; μετὰ κύνα Id. HP 1.9.5; also of the whole constellation, Arat. 327, Gal. 17(1).17.

children.label: VI
children.definition: the ace, the worst throw at dice, Poll. 9.100, Eust. 1289.63.

children.label: VII
children.definition: frenum praeputii, Antyll. ap. Orib. 50.3.1: with pun on the prov. ap. Pherecr. l.c. (supr. I), Ar. Lys. 158: with pun on signf. V, AP 5.104 ( Marc. Arg.).

children.label: VIII
children.definition: fetlock of a horse, Hippiatr. 77.

children.label: IX
children.definition: unilateral facial paralysis, Gal. 8.573.

children.label: X
children.definition: Dsc. ap. Eust. 1857.19.

children.label: XI
children.definition: ξυλίνη κ., = κυνόσβατος, Orac. ap. Did ap. Ath. 2.70c.

children.label: XII
children.definition: piece in the game of πόλεις, Cratin. 56.3 (dub.). (Cf. Skt. śvā, gen. śúnas, Lith. šuõ, gen. šuñs, Lat. canis, Goth. hunds ( κύων), etc.)
κωαί· ἀστράγαλοι, Hsch. (ante κώϊον, fort. κῶια). κωάζω, = ἀστραγαλίζω, Id.
Id. (also in form κοιάζω).
of Cos: Κῳακαὶ προγνώσιες or αἱ Κῳακαί, title of work by Hippocrates of Cos.

definition: κῶας, τό, in Hom. nom. acc. sg. κῶας; pl. κώεα, dat. κώεσι; later contr. κῶς (q.v.):—

children.definition: fleece, στόρεσαν λέχος, . . κώεά τε ῥῆγός τε Il. 9.661, cf. Od. 23.180; ἀδέψητον βοέην στόρεσʼ, αὐτὰρ ὕπερθε κώεα πόλλʼ ὀΐων 20.3, cf. 142; χεῦεν ὕπο χλωρὰς ῥῶπας καὶ κῶας ὕπερθεν 16.47; φέρε δὴ δίφρον καὶ κῶας ἐπʼ αὐτοῦ 19.97; ἵδρυσεν παρὰ δαιτί κώεσιν ἐν μαλακοῖσι 3.38, cf. 17.32; of the Golden Fleece, κ. αἰγλᾶεν χρυσέῳ θυσάνῳ Pi. P. 4.231; ἔπλεον ἐπὶ τὸ κ. ἐς Αἶαν Hdt. 7.193; μέγα κ. Mimn. 11.1; τὸ χρύσειον κ. Theoc. 13.16.—Cf. κῴδιον.

data.quote: στόρεσαν λέχος, . . κώεά τε ῥῆγός τε
ἀδέψητον βοέην στόρεσʼ, αὐτὰρ ὕπερθε κώεα πόλλʼ ὀΐων
χεῦεν ὕπο χλωρὰς ῥῶπας καὶ κῶας ὕπερθεν
φέρε δὴ δίφρον καὶ κῶας ἐπʼ αὐτοῦ
ἵδρυσεν παρὰ δαιτί κώεσιν ἐν μαλακοῖσι
ἔπλεον ἐπὶ τὸ κ. ἐς Αἶαν

children.definition: arsenical sulphides of cobalt, Ps.-Democr.Alch. p.51 B. ( κοβ-), Zos.Alch. p.188B. ( κωβ-, v.l. κοβ-):—hence κωβαθηκαύστης, ου, ὁ, ‘arsenic-burner’, applied to Nilus, ib. 191 B. (vv.ll. κωβατικ-, κωβαθιοκ-).
pomegranate flowers, Hsch. κῶβαξ· ὁ μέγας τέττιξ, Id. κωβάριον, globus, Gloss.
needle, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: sexual intercourse, Id., Phot.
needlewoman, Hsch.

definition: κωβίδιον, τό, Dim. of sq., Anaxandr. 27.4, Sotad.Com. 1.22, Arist. Fr. 309. [- βῐ- Anaxandr. l.c. (anap., s.v.l.), but - βῑ- Sotad. l.c. (iamb.).]

children.definition: gudgeon kind, Semon. 15, Epich. 66, Hp. Int. 21, Pl. Euthd. 298d, Antiph. 26.19, Men. Kol.Fr. 7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dsc. 4.164; = τ. δενδροειδής, Plin. HN 26.71.
like the gudgeon, ἀφύη Arist. HA 569b23, cf. Hices. ap Ath. 7.285b.
like a κωβιός, Plu. Sollert. 2.980f.

definition: κῳδάριον [ ᾰ], τό, Dim. of κῴδιον, Cratin. 41, Ar. Ra. 1203, Anaxandr. 34.11.

children.definition: dealer in sheepskins, POxy. 1519.4 (iii A.D.).

head, ὁ δὲ φῆ, κώδειαν ἀνασχών Il. 14.499; of plants, head, e.g. of garlic, bulb, Nic. Al. 432; of the poppy, capsule, Gal. 12.73:—also κωδία, ἡ, dub. in Ar. Fr. 117 ( κώδυα Harp. Epit., κώδεια Suid.), f.l. for κώδεια in Poll. 2.38, for κωδύα in Dsc. 4.63 (pl.), Orib. 11 s.v. μικρὰ μήκων, for κώδυια in Arist. Pr. 914b27; κώδειον or κώδ-ιον, Gloss. (cf. κώδυον); κωδίς, Hsch.; cf. κωδύα, κώδων II.

children.label: II
children.definition: cup shaped like a poppy-head, in form κώδεα, Inscr.Délos 298 A 169 (pl.), 300 B 13 (iii B.C.).

definition: κῴδιο, barbarism for sq., Ar. Th. 1180.

children.definition: Dim. of κῶας, sheepskin, fleece, Ar. Eq. 400, Ra. 1478, Pl. Prt. 315d, Men. Sam. 189, IG 1(2).80.17, 11(2).287 A 24 ( Delos, iii B.C.), PPetr. 2p.108 (iii B.C.), etc.; of the Golden Fleece, Luc. Gall. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Δῖον κ. ramʼs fleece used in purificatory ceremonies, Polem.Hist. 87, 88.
clad in sheepskin, Str. 17.2.3.

head, i.e. capsule, of the poppy, Thphr. HP 9.12.4, Damocr. ap. Gal. 13.40, Dsc. 4.63 ( v.l. - ίαις), 64, Sor. 1.120 ( τῇ διακωδίων cod.), Ruf. Ren.Ves. 1.15; imitated as an ornament of ἧλοι, IG 2(2).1457.14, 1544.38, al.; head, i.e. fruit, of the Nile water-lily, Nymphaea stellata, Thphr. HP 4.8.10; of the Egyptian bean, Nelumbium speciosum, ib. 7. [ κωδύᾱ acc. to Hdn.Gr. 1.302, and so in Damocr. l.c., but κώδυα in Ar. Fr. 117 ap.Harp.Epit., Phot., cf. sq. [κώδυια]]
head: hence, bulb, cup of the κλεψύδρα, Arist. Pr. 914b27 (vv.ll. κωδύαν, κωδίαν: these forms, as well as κώδεια (q.v.), are prob. derived from κώδυια).
head, i.e. inflorescence, of purse-tassels, Muscari comosum, Thphr. HP 6.8.1. (From κωδύα as κάρυον from καρύα, etc.)

definition: κώδων, ωνος, ὁ ( Att. ἡ S. Aj. 17, dub. in Ar. Pax 1078),

children.definition: bell, ὑπʼ ἀσπίδος δὲ τῷ χαλκήλατοι κλάζουσι κ. φόνον A. Th. 386, cf. 399, E. Rh. 308; χαλκοστόμου κώδωνος ὡς Τυρσηνικῆς, i.e. a trumpet, S. l.c. (where Sch. expl. κώδων as τὸ πλατὺ τῆς σάλπιγγος, i.e. the mouth of the trumpet, cf. Ath. 5.185a, Poll. 2.203); carried on rounds of inspection to challenge sentries, τοῦ κώδωνος πα ενεχθέντος Th. 4.135; ἐφοδεύειν κώδωνι Plu. Arat. 7, cf. Luc. Merc.Cond. 24, Sch. Ar. Av. 843.

data.quote: ὑπʼ ἀσπίδος δὲ τῷ χαλκήλατοι κλάζουσι κ. φόνον

children.definition: crierʼs bell, hence ταῦθʼ οὗτος μόνον οὐ κώδωνας ἐξαψάμενος διαπράττεται ‘is his own trumpeter’, D. 25.90: metaph., ἡ κ. ἀκαλανθίς ( ὅτι λάλον τὸ ζῷον Sch.) Ar. Pax 1078 (perh. κύων is the true reading, v. App. Prov. 1.12); cf. κρόταλον.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.6.2.

try, prove by ringing, of money, Ar. Ra. 723 ( Pass.); ὅ τι ποιεῖκ. ib. 79: metaph., βούλομαι κωδωνίσας πέμψαι σε Anaxandr. 15.5:—wrongly expld. by Hsch. from the challenging of sentries (cf. κώδων I.1).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to have oneʼs name noised abroad, EM 325.21.
Dim. of κώδων, J. AJ 3.7.4, Phlp. in de An. 356.20, prob. in BGU 162.10 (ii/iii A.D.). cf. Hdn. Epim. 71.
of or with jingling bells, σάκος S. Fr. 859 (lyr.); κ. κόμποι E. Rh. 383 (anap.).
with jingling harness, coined by Ar. Ra. 963, as a parody on Aeschylus.
carry the bell round, inspect sentinels, Ar. Av. 842, Nicopho 26, D.C. 54.4:— Pass., ἅπαντα κωδωνοφορεῖται Ar. Av. 1160.
carry a bell, Philostr. VA 3.57.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., of a king, to be attended by men with bells, Str. 15.1.58.

definition: κωθάριον, τό, Dim. of sq., cj. in Anaxandr. 27.3 ( κωβῐδαρίων codd.).
κῶθος, ὁ, Sicel name for κωβιός, Numen. ap. Ath. 7.304e, 309c.

children.definition: Laconian drinking-vessel, used by soldiers, Archil. 4, Ar. Eq. 600, X. Cyr. 1.2.8, Critias 34 D., IG 2(2).47.6, etc.; κ. στρεψαύχην Theopomp.Com. 54; πυριγενής Henioch. 1; φαεινός Ar. Pax 1094 (parod.); of earthenware or metal, IG 42(1).121.79, al. (Epid.), Ath. 11.483b, c: κ. χαλκοῖ IG 1(2).313.55, al., cf. 22.1425.393.

children.label: II
children.definition: drinking bout, carousal, εἰσῆλθεν ἐπὶ κώθωνα πρὸς τὸν βασιλέα Macho ap. Ath. 13.583b, cf. Plu. Ant. 4, etc.; religious banquet, BCH 51.220 ( Thasos).

data.quote: εἰσῆλθεν ἐπὶ κώθωνα πρὸς τὸν βασιλέα

children.label: III
children.definition: Nic. Fr. 141, Apollod. ap. Ath. 7.309c.
deep potation (not of wine), Aret. SD 2.13.

make drunken, Hsch., Phot.:— Pass., drink hard, κ. ταῖς μεγάλαις (sc. κύλιξι) Arist. Pr. 872b28, cf. LXX Es. 3.15, Mnesith. ap. Ath. 11.484a, Phylarch. 1 J., Gal. UP 4.13; κ. ἀφʼ ἡμέρας, de die potare, Plb. 23.5.9; κεκωθωνισμένος inebriated, Eub. 126, cf. PSI 3.172.23 (ii B.C.).

definition: κωθώνιον, τό, Dim. of κώθων, AJA 31.350 (vase, v B.C.), IG 7.303.56 ( Oropus), PMag.Par. 1.2952, Gp. 20.10.

children.definition: tippling, Arist. Pr. 863b25, Mnesith. ap. Ath. 11.484a (pl.).
banqueting house, D.S. 5.19.
toper, Ath. 10.433b.
like a κώθων, Suid. s.v. προχόῳ.
one who cleans the fish κώθων, Sophr. 45.
κώθων-maker, Dinarch. Fr. 89.19.
with the lip or rim of a κώθων, κύλιξ Eub. 56.3 (- χειρος codd.).

definition: κώκαλον παλαιόν, καὶ εἶδος ἀλεκτρυόνος, Hsch.

children.definition: shriek, wail, in pl., λιγέα κ. A. Pers. 332; ὀξέα S. Aj. 321; ὔρθια Id. Ant. 1206.
born from Cocytus, Νύμφη Opp. H. 3.487.

shrieking, wailing, κωκυτῷ τʼ εἴχοντο καὶ οἰμωγῇ Il. 22.409, cf. 447, Pi. P. 4.113, A. Ch. 150 (pl.); κωκυτὸν ἱέναι, ἠχεῖν, S. Aj. 851, Tr. 867; ἀνάγειν E. Ph. 1350 (lyr.): also in late Prose, Luc. Luct. 12, Ach.Tat. 1.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Κωκῡτός, ὁ, Cocytus, River of Wailing (cf. Ἀχέρων), Od. 10.514, A. Ag. 1160, E. Alc. 458 (lyr.), etc.

definition: κωκύω [v. fin.], fut. - ύσω A. Ag. 1313, - ύσομαι Ar. Lys. 1222: aor. ἐκώκῡσα S. Ant. 28; Ep. κώκυσα Il. 18.37:— Med., AP 7.412 ( Alc. Mess.):—

children.definition: shriek, wail, in Ep. and Trag. always of women, Il. 18.37, Od. 2.361, etc.; κλαῖον καὶ ἐκώκῠον 19.541: freq. with Adv., λίγʼ ἐκώκῠε Il. 19.284, cf. Od. 4.259, etc.; ὀξὺ δὲ κωκύσασα (opp. βαρὺ στενάχων, of the man) Il. 18.71; κώκῡσεν δὲ μάλα μέγα 22.407: also in late Prose, Plu. Isid. 2.357c, etc.; even of men, Luc. DMort. 4[21].1, Longus 2.21; and so Ar., as an execration, μακρὰ κωκύειν κελεύω σε Ra. 34; οἰμώζοι γʼ ἂν καὶ κωκύοι Ec. 648.

lament or shriek over one dead, also prop. of women, κώκυσʼ ἐν λεχέεσσιν ἑὸν πόσιν Od. 24.295; ἐμὴν μοῖραν κ. A. Ag. 1313, cf. S. Ant. 28, al.: Com., of men, κωκύσεσθε τὰς τρίχας μακρά Ar. Lys. 1222: also in late Prose, as Porph. Abst. 4.9, etc. (Cf. Skt. káuti ‘cry’ (intens. kokūyatē), Lith. kaũkli ‘shriek’, etc.) [ ῠ in Hom. before a vowel, ῡ before a conson. (v. supr.): later ῡ sts. before a vowel, κωκῡοι Ar. Ec. l.c., κωκῡουσα Bion 1.23, Q.S. 3.779, κωκῡεσκε ib. 460.]
to be a κωλακρέτης, IG 1(2).25.9: aor. 1 ἐκωλακρέτησαν CIG 3660 ( Cyzicus).

IG 1(2).19.13, al., Arist. Ath. 7.3, Ar. V. 695, Av. 1541; κωλακρέτου γάλα, comically for the μισθὸς δικαστικός, Id. V. 724. (Written κωλαγρ- in Cod. Rav. of Ar., Tim. Lex.; derivation from κωλᾶς ἀγρεῖν or ἀγείρειν perh. implied by Suid. s.v. κωλακρέτης.)

definition: κωλανιζόμενοι τάχει χρώμενοι, ἀνέμοις ἴσα, Hsch. κωλαρίας· τοὺς ἐκ τῆς ἀγέλης παῖδας, Id. (Fort. κωραλίας.)

children.definition: Dim. of κῶλον, fragment of a verse, hemistich, Ael.Dion. Fr. 168, Sch. Ar. Pax 179.
ἀγκαλίς, δέσμη χόρτου, Hsch. κώλειρ, prize given in a contest, Id. κωλεός, ὁ, = κωλῆ, Epich. 82, 92, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.116. κωλετίναις ( -τήν- cod.) · ἀσκαλαβώταις, Hsch.

definition: κωλῆ, ἡ, contr. from κωλέα, which occurs in Anaxipp. 1.38, LXX 1 Ki. 9.24: κωλία (v. κωλίαν) is a dialectal form: ( κῶλον):—

children.definition: thighbone with the flesh on it, ham, esp. of a swine, Ar. Pl. 1128, Fr. 224, X. Cyn. 50.30, Pl.Com. 17 (pl.), Amips. 7; ἐρίφου Xenoph. 6.1; βοὸς κ. Luc. Lex. 6; the portion of the priestess at a sacrifice, IG 2(2).1361.5, SIG 1015.10 (Halic.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: membrum virile, Ar. Nu. 989, 1019.

definition: κωλήβη μήποτε ὁ λάσταυρος· κώληβοι γὰρ οἱ ταῦροι, Phot.

children.definition: thigh, leg, κωλῆνες νεβρῶν E. Fr. 677, cf. Eup. 47; κ. ὑείων κρεῶν hams, Hp. Epid. 7.62: in pl., bones of the leg, Arist. HA 516b1:— Dim. κωληνάριον, τό, Sch. Ar. Pl. 1129.

definition: κώληξ, ηκος, ὁ, = sq., Sch. Ar. Pl. 1129.

children.definition: hollow of the knee, = ἰγνύα, Il. 23.726, Nic. Th. 424.

definition: Κωλιάς (sc. ἄκρα), άδος, ἡ, Colias, a promontory of Attica, Hdt. 8.96; with a temple of Aphrodite, St.Byz.: hence, as epith. of the goddess, Ar. Nu. 52, Lys. 2; Κωλιάδες γυναῖκες Orac. ap. Hdt. l.c.

children.definition: γῆ), potterʼs clay of high repute, dug at Colias, Plu. Aud. 2.42d.
to be arranged according to κῶλα, τὰ κεκωλισμένα βιβλία Olymp.Hist. p.463 D.; esp. of poetical works, to be arranged according to metrical κῶλα, Ar.Cod.Ven.Subscr.
suffer from colic, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.73, Alex.Trall. 8.2.

suffering in the colon, having colic, prob.l. in Dsc. 2.54, Gal. 8.40; ἡ κ. διάθεσις colic, from its being seated in the colon and parts adjacent, Id. 8.384; κ. φάρμακα remedies for colic, Id. 13.266; κ. ἀντίδοτος Androm. ap. eund. 13.276. Adv. -κῶς Gal. 19.3.
one that goes on stilts, Hsch. s.v. καδαλίων.
stilt, Artem. 3.15 ( v.l. καλ-).
in members. Adv. - δῶς Sopat. in Rh. 8.9 W.
measurement of metrical phrases, Suid. s.v. Εὐγένιος.

limb, member of a body, esp. leg, A. Pr. 325, S. OC 183 (lyr.), Ph. 42, etc.; δρομάδι κ. E. Hel. 1301 (lyr.); κ. ταχύπουν Id. Ba. 168 (lyr.): mostly in pl., A. Pr. 81, S. OC 19; χεῖρες καὶ κῶλα E. Ph. 1185: generally, of arms and legs, and of animals, fore and hind legs, τὰ ἐμπρόσθια κ. Pl. Ti. 91e; τὰ ἔμπροσθεν καὶ τὰ ὄπισθεν κ. Arist. HA 498a3, cf. PA 690a20, etc.; δέρμα, τρίχας, ὄνυχάς τε ἐπʼ ἄκροις τοῖς κώλοις ἔφυσαν Pl. Ti. 76e.

data.quote: τὰ ἔμπροσθεν καὶ τὰ ὄπισθεν κ.
δέρμα, τρίχας, ὄνυχάς τε ἐπʼ ἄκροις τοῖς κώλοις ἔφυσαν

children.definition: limb, arm, σκολιῆς ἄγρια κ. βάτου AP 7.315 ( Zenod. or Rhian.): in pl., also, internodes of the νάρθηξ, Corn. ND 30.

children.label: II
children.definition: member,
side or front, of a square or triangular building, Hdt. 2.126, 134, 4.62, 108, Pl. Lg. 947e.

children.label: b
children.definition: upright of a ladder, Apollod. Poliorc. 182.5, al.
limb or lap of the race-course, διαύλου θάτερον κ. A. Ag. 344.

member or clause of a περίοδος, Arist. Rh. 1409b13, Phld. Rh. 1.165 S., D.H. Comp. 22, Quint. 9.4.22, Demetr. Eloc. 1, Hermog. Id. 1.3, 2.3; στίξομεν κατὰ κῶλον Castor in Rh. 3.721 W.; διελὼν πρὸς κῶλον, of Origen in his Hexapla, Eus. PE 6.16.
metrical unit containing fewer than three συζυγίαι without catalexis, Heph. Poëm. 1; element of a στροφή, D.H. Comp. 19, etc.
ῥινοῦ ἐΰστροφα κ., poet. for a sling, AP 7.172 ( Antip. Sid.).
κόλον (q.v.), Isid. Etym. 4.7.38, etc.; cf. κωλικός.
manufacturer of artificial limbs (as votive offerings), PGiss. 20.20 (ii A.D.).
cut off limbs: generally, cut or mow down, Δημήτερα Epic. ap. Plu. Isid. 2.377d.

hindrance, τί γὰρ ἐμπόδιον κ. ἔτι μοι; E. Ion 862 (anap.); κ. θεῶν ἢ ἡρώων Th. 5.30; βασιλικὸν κ. PFrankf. 1.100 (iii B.C.): pl., κωλύματα καὶ βλάβαι D.H. 9.9: c. inf., hindrance against, ἅμαξα κ. οὖσα προσθεῖναι [τὰς πύλας] Th. 4.67; κωλύματα μὴ αὐξηθῆναι [τὸ Ἑλληνικόν] Id. 1.16: c. gen., κ. φορᾶς impediment to motion, Pl. Cra. 418e; ἐνεργείας Ocell. 4.12: c. dat., [ τῷ αἵματι] Hp. Flat. 8: κ. καὶ σίνος πρὸς εὐκαρπίαν Thphr. CP 2.7.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: defence against a thing, σβεστήρια κ. Th. 7.53: c. gen., κ. δηλητηρίων Hdn. 1.17.10.
catch or clutch in a machine, Hero Spir. 1.17, al.
hindering, Th. 1.92; ταῖς κ. ταύταις ἱκανῶς . . εἰρχθῆναι by these impediments, Id. 4.63; a poetical word in Th., cf. D.H. Amm. 2.3.
talk grandly or at random, πρὸς τὸ παρὸν δόξης ἕνεκεν τῆς οἰκείας f.l. in Sever. Clyst. p.43 D. ( κυλικηγοροῦμεν cj. Dietz).

definition: κωλυσανέμας, ου, ὁ, or κωλῡσάνεμος, ὁ,

children.definition: checking the winds, epith. of Empedocles, Timae. 94, Suid. s.v. Ἐμπεδοκλῆς; cf. ἀλεξάνεμος.
interrupting the banquet, applied to a species of κοχλίας, Apollod. ap. Ath. 2.63d, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.726a.
one who obstructs the course, Luc. Trag. 198.
hinder, obstruct operations, Plb. 6.15.5, Ph. 1.64, 240, J. AJ 15.11.7.
hindering from work, τοῦ φιλοσοφεῖν Iamb. Protr. 21.κβ.

prevention, ἕνεκα κωλύσεως Pl. Sph. 220c; κωλύσεις τῶν συμπερασμάτων Arist. Top. 161a15, cf. Phld. Mort. 19; εἰς κώλυσιν μὴ ἐντελὲς τὸ κράτος εἶναι App. BC 1.1: in Astrol. sense, Vett.Val. 142.24 (pl.).

data.quote: εἰς κώλυσιν μὴ ἐντελὲς τὸ κράτος εἶναι

children.definition: one must hinder, X. Hier. 8.9, Gal. 10.649, al.
κωλῡ-τέος, α, ον, to be hindered or stopped, Hp. Art. 58, D.H. 10.40.
Archyt. 3; θεοὶ . . τῶν κακῶν κ. Porph. ap. Eus. PE 4.9; ἀριθμὸς κ. τῶν περαιτέρω ἐπιμορίων Iamb. in Nic. p.52 P.
preventive, σημεῖα κ. τινός of . . , D.H. 11.62; θῦσαι τὰ κωλυτήρια (sc. ἱερά) Iamb. VP 28.141, Apollon. Mir. 4: as Subst. κωλυτήριον, τό, παρατριμμάτων Dsc. 1.103.
hinderer, τῆς διαβάσεως Th. 3.23, cf. D. 18.72; πηλὸν . . κωλυτὴν παρασχεῖν Pl. Criti. 109a: abs., OGI 5.7 ( Scepsis, iv B.C.), Vett.Val. 139.19.
preventive, τινος of a thing, X. Mem. 4.5.7 ( Comp.), Arist. Rh. 1362a29, EN 1096b12, Thphr. Ign. 45, Epicur. Ep. 2p.52U., Porph. Abst. 2.47: abs., in Astrol., ἀστὴρ ἄπρακτος καὶ κ. Vett.Val. 178.30.
to be hindered, Arr. Epict. 2.5.8, al.; ὑπό τινος ib. 1.17.27.
Dim. of κωλήν, condemned by Phryn. 60: Lat. colyphium, Plaut. Pers. 92 (pl.), Juv. 2.53 (pl.), etc.

definition: κωλύω, fut. - ύσω Ar. Nu. 1448: aor. ἐκώλῡσα E. Alc. 897 (anap.), Pl. Mx. 244c; pf. κεκώλῡκα Din. 1.101, Phld. Rh. 2.63 S.:— Pass., fut. κωλυθήσομαι LXX Si. 20.2(1), Luc. VH 2.25: also in med. form - ύσομαι Th. 1.142: aor. ἐκωλύθην Id. 2.64, etc.: pf. κεκώλῡμαι ib. 37. [ ῡ always before a conson.: common before a vowel, κωλῡόμεσθα E. Ion 391, κωλῡέτω Id. Ph. 990, κωλῠεν Pi. P. 4.33, κώλῠει Alc. 55 ( = Sapph. 22 Lobel), Ar. Eq. (v. infr.), Fr. 100, Anaxil. 25, Men. Epit. 10.]:—

children.definition: hinder, prevent:—Constr.:

inf., κ. ἐκρέειν τὸν Νεῖλον Hdt. 2.20; κώλυεν [μιν] μεῖναι Pi. l.c.; τί δῆτα καὶ σὲ κωλύει <λαβεῖν> κέρδος; E. Fr. 794, cf. IT 507, etc.; ὅς σε κ. τὸ δρᾶν S. Ph. 1241; φεύγειν οὐδεὶς κ. νόμος D. 23.52: with neg. added (rare in Att. Prose), κ. τινὰ μὴ θανεῖν E. Ph. 1268; μὴ προσεύχεσθαι X. HG 3.2.22, etc.:— Pass., χρημάτων σπάνει Th. 1.142; τοῦ ὕδατος πιεῖν from drinking the water, Pl. R. 621b; κωλυόμεσθα μὴ μαθεῖν E. Ion 391; μὴ οὐ πονηρὸν εἶναι D.H. 2.3.

children.label: b
children.definition: part. pro inf., κ. τινὰ πόλεμον εἰσάγοντα Id. 7.25:— Pass., μὴ κωλύωνται περαιούμενοι Th. 1.26.

children.label: c
children.definition: κωλύειν εἴ τις ἐπαγγέλλεται, = τινὰ μὴ ἐπαγγέλλεσθαι, D. 4.15; ἐκωλύσαμεν, ἵνα γένησθε . . J. BJ 6.6.2.
κ. τινά τινος hinder one from a thing, X. HG 3.2.21, An. 1.6.2, etc.; κ. τινὰ ἀπό τινος Id. Cyr. 1.3.11, 3.3.51:— Pass., τῆς ὁρμῆς ἐκωλύθησαν Plb. 6.55.3.

prevent, E. IA 1390 (troch.), X. An. 4.2.24:— Pass., ἐν τούτῳ κεκωλῦσθαι ἐδόκει τὰ πράγματα Th. 2.8, cf. 4.14; ταῦτα . . μὴ ἐν ὑμῖν κωλυθῇ Id. 2.64; μηδὲ . . δαπάνῃ κεκωλύσθω let there be no hindrance by reason of expense, Id. 1.129.

data.quote: ἐν τούτῳ κεκωλῦσθαι ἐδόκει τὰ πράγματα

children.label: b
children.definition: withhold, τι ἀπό τινος LXX Ge. 23.6, Ev.Luc. 6.29.
hinder, Th. 1.35; τοὺς δρῶντας μοχθηρά Arist. EN 1113b26.

οὐδʼ ὁ κωλύσων παρῆν S. Ant. 261, cf. El. 1197; εἴσʼ οἳ κωλύουσιν Ar. Pax 499; of the tribuneʼs intercessio, Plu. TG 10; τὸ κωλῦον hindrance, X. An. 4.5.20, D. 1.12: freq. an inf. may be supplied, εἶτα τίς σε κωλύει (sc. γεωργεῖν); Ar. Fr. 100; αὐτοὶ ὠφελούμενοι τοὺς πολεμίους κωλύσετε [ὠφελεῖσθαι] Th. 6.91, cf. 2.37 ( Pass.).

οὐδὲν κωλύει there is nothing to hinder, c. acc. et inf., ὁμόψηφον τὸν Ἀργεῖον εἶναι κ. οὐδέν Hdt. 7.149; οὐδέν σε κωλύσει σεαυτὸν ἐμβαλεῖν ἐς τὸ βάραθρον Ar. Nu. 1448, cf. Pl. Phdr. 268e; ὃν διαμάττειν οὐ κ. Ar. Av. 463; τί κ. ἡμᾶς διελθεῖν; Pl. Tht. 143a, etc.; οὐδὲν κ., abs., as a form of assent, be it so, Ar. Eq. 723, 972, Pl. Euthd. 272d, etc.; τί γὰρ κ.; Id. Euthphr. 9d, cf. Plt. 292a, al.; τό γʼ ἐμὸν οὐδὲν κ. Id. Grg. 458d; μὴ τὸ σὸν κωλυέτω E. Ph. 990; οὐ τἀμὰ κωλύσει Plu. Symp. 2.151c, etc.; οὔτε ἐκεῖνο κωλύει ἐν ταῖς σπονδαῖς neither is that any hindrance, Th. 1.144 (wrongly expld. as = κωλύεται by D.H. Amm. 2.7); οὔτε μίαν δυοῖν τὴν αὐτὴν εἶναι κ. nor is there any hindrance to one of two being the same, Arist. Ph. 202b9.

data.quote: ὁμόψηφον τὸν Ἀργεῖον εἶναι κ. οὐδέν
οὐδέν σε κωλύσει σεαυτὸν ἐμβαλεῖν ἐς τὸ βάραθρον

children.definition: Arist. HA 609b19, Babr. 204, Hsch.; epith. of Dionysus, Suid.
shaped like a lizard, Hp. Epid. 4.56.

definition: κῶμα, ατος, τό, (perh. cogn. with κεῖμαι, κοιμάω)

children.definition: deep sleep, αὐτῷ . . μαλακὸν περὶ κῶμα κάλυψα Il. 14.359; ἦ με . . μαλακὸν περὶ κῶμʼ ἐκάλυψεν Od. 18.201; κακὸν δέ ἑ κῶμα καλύπτει Hes. Th. 798; αἰθυσσομένων δὲ φύλλων κ. κατάρρει Sapph. 4; ὕπνου κ. Theoc. Ep. 3.6: metaph., of the effect of music, Pi. P. 1.12.—Not in Trag.

data.quote: ἦ με . . μαλακὸν περὶ κῶμʼ ἐκάλυψεν

children.definition: lethargic state, coma, κῶμα συνεχές, οὐχ ὑπνῶδες Hp. Epid. 3.6, cf. Gal. 7.643, Sch. Nic. Al. 458.
of a κῶμος, Sch.D.T. p.542 H.

definition: κωμάζω, fut. - άσω [ᾰ] Pi. N. 9.1, - άσομαι Id. P. 9.89, AP 5.63 ( Asclep.), Luc. Luct. 13; Dor. - άξομαι Pi. I. 4(3).72: aor. ἐκώμᾰσα E. HF 180; poet. κώμ- Pi. N. 10.35; Dor. imper. - άξατε ib. 2.24: pf. κεκώμᾰκα AP 5.111 ( Phld.): ( κῶμος):—

children.definition: revel, make merry, νέοι κώμαζον ὑπʼ αὐλοῦ Hes. Sc. 281; κωμάζοντα μετʼ αὐλητῆρος ἀείδειν Thgn. 1065, cf. S. Fr. 764, E. Alc. 815, etc.; κ. μετὰ μέθης Pl. Lg. 637a; κ. καὶ παιωνίζειν D. 18.287; ὀρχούμενος καὶ κ. Theopomp.Hist. 153; κ. μεθʼ ἡμέραν Lys. 14.25, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.47 M.; go in festal procession, Σικυωνόθεν εἰς Αἴτναν Pi. N. 9.1; ὃς ἐν ταῖς πομπαῖς ἄνευ τοῦ προσώπου κ. D. 19.287: metaph., νήσους κώμασον εἰς μακάρων Call.? SH 980 ; esp. in Egypt, take part in religious processions, PGnom. 200, 214 (ii A.D.): hence trans., carry images, etc., in procession, ναόν, ξόανον κ., ib. 211, BGU 362 vii 17 (iii A.D.):— Pass., χρὴ τὰς θεὰς κωμάζεσθαι Sammelb. 421 (iii A.D.).

data.quote: ὃς ἐν ταῖς πομπαῖς ἄνευ τοῦ προσώπου κ.

children.label: II
children.definition: celebrate a κῶμος in honour of the victor at the games, κ. σὺν ἑταίροις Pi. O. 9.4, etc.: c. acc. cogn., ἑορτὰν κ. Id. N. 11.28; τὸν καλλίνικον μετὰ θεῶν ἐκώμασεν E. HF l.c.
approach with a κῶμος, sing in his honour, Pi. I. 7(6).20 (in fut. Med., Id. P. 9.89); ἡ Ἀφροδίτη κ. παρὰ τὸν Διόνυσον Plu. Ant. 26.

data.quote: ἡ Ἀφροδίτη κ. παρὰ τὸν Διόνυσον

children.definition: honour or celebrate him in or with the κῶμος, Pi. N. 10.35, I. 4(3).72; κ. Δία Τιμοδήμῳ celebrate Zeus for Timodemos’ sake, Id. N. 2.24.

children.label: III
children.definition: break in upon in the manner of revellers, serenade, of lovers, Alc. 56; ἐπὶ γαμετὰς γυναῖκας Is. 3.14, cf. Luc. DMar. 1.4; κ. ποτὶ τὰν Ἀμαρυλλίδα Theoc. 3.1, cf. Ath. 8.348c; παρά τινι Arr. An. 7.24.4; εἴς τινα Alciphr. 1.6; ἐπὶ τὰς ἑταιρίδων θύρας Ath. 13.574e: generally, burst in, εἰς τόπον APl. 16.102; of evil, ἄτη ἐς πόλιν ἐκώμασεν Tryph. 314; θρῆνος εἰς ὑμέναιον AP 7.186 ( Phil.); of Alexander, καθʼ ὅλης τῆς ὑφʼ ἡλίῳ Him. Ecl. 2.18: prov., ὗς ἐκώμασεν, ‘a bull in a china-shop’, Diogenian. 8.60; εἰς μελίττας ἐκώμασας ‘you have raised a hornetʼs nest about your ears’, Paus.Gr. Fr. 160, Zen. 3.53, etc.
to be drowsy, Hp. Morb. 2.22; but κωμαίνεσθαι· κείρασθαι, Hsch. (post κωμική).
of a village, St.Byz. s.v. Κώμη; epith. of Apollo at Naucratis, Herm.Hist. 2.
spice-nutmeg, Thphr. HP 9.7.2 (but acc. to Plin. HN 12.135, 13.18 a kind of cinnamon); also a fruit, Thphr. l.c.
debauchee, Eust. 1749.28.
Hsch.
to be κωμάρχης, GDI 3069 ( Selymbria), Keil-Premerstein Dritter Bericht No. 109 ( Lydia, iii A.D.): c. acc., administer as κωμάρχης, τὴν κώμην PAmh. 2.33.11 (ii B.C.).

definition: κωμάρχης, Dor. κωμ-άρχας, ου, ὁ, ( κώμη)

children.definition: head man of a village, X. An. 4.5.10, 24, al.codd., PRev.Laws 40.3 (iii B.C.), D.H. 4.14, IG 12(1).128 ( Rhodes), CIG 3420 ( Philadelphia), 3641b66 ( Lampsacus), OGI 527.10 ( Hierapolis), etc.
office of κωμάρχης, PTeb. 24.63 ( ii B.C., pl.).
leader of a κῶμος, Πολέμων 1.45 ( Attica, iv B.C., pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: PCair.Zen. 379.15 (iii B.C.), PTeb. 43.8 (ii B.C.), Poll. 9.11:—hence Com. Patron. κωμαρχίδης, Ar. Pax 1142.
procession of the images of the gods in Egypt, αἱ τῶν θεῶν κ. OGI 194.25 (i B.C.) , cf. PGnom. 199 (ii A.D.), Wilcken Chr. 41 iv 14 (iii A.D.); αἱ τοῦ νέου ἔτους κ. PStrassb. 90.18 (i B.C.).
revelling, prob. in J. AJ 17.9.5 (pl.).
meeting-place of κωμασταί 3 in Egypt, Sammelb. 5051 ( Taposiris).

children.label: II
children.definition: place of procession of the Sun and Star-gods, PMag.Par. 1.1608, PMag.Leid.W. 17.27, etc.
reveller, Pl. Smp. 212c, X. HG 5.4.7, etc.; member of a κῶμος, Πολέμων 1.46 ( Attica, iv B.C.); title of play by Epicharmus.
Ar. Nu. 606 (lyr.).
one who carries sacred images in procession, κ. θεῶν POxy. 519 (ii A.D.), cf. 1265.9 (iv A.D.).
of or fit for a κῶμος, ᾠδή Ael. NA 9.13; μέλη D.H. 19.8, cf. Ph. 1.372. Adv. -κῶς Ael. VH 13.1.
to be in a state of κῶμα, Hp. Epid. 7.11, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.19.7.
lethargic, Hp. Epid. 1.4.2 [1.26.βʹ], 3.6.
IG 4.497.11 ( Mycenae, ii B.C.).

unwalled village, opp. fortified city (said to be Dor. = Att. δῆμος, Arist. Po. 1448a36, cf. κωμῳδία), Hes. Sc. 18, Hdt. 5.98; opp. πόλις, Pl. Lg. 626c; κατοικῆσθαι κατὰ κώμας Hdt. 1.96; πόλεσιν ἀτειχίστοις καὶ κατὰ κ. οἰκουμέναις formed of scattered villages, Th. 1.5; πόλεως . . κατὰ κ. τῷ παλαιῷ τῆς Ἑλλάδος τρόπῳ οἰκισθείσης ib. 10, cf. 3.94; διοικίζεσθαι κατὰ κώμας X. HG 5.2.5; κατὰ κ. κεχωρισμένοι Arist. Pol. 1261a28.

children.label: II
children.definition: quarter, ward of a city, διελόμενοι τὴν μὲν πόλιν κατὰ κώμας, τὴν δὲ χώραν κατὰ δήμους Isoc. 7.46, cf. Pl. Lg. 746d.

data.quote: διελόμενοι τὴν μὲν πόλιν κατὰ κώμας, τὴν δὲ χώραν κατὰ δήμους

children.definition: leader of a κῶμος, OGI 97.10 ( Egypt, ii B.C., κωμεγ- lapis).
in villages, ζῆν Str. 3.2.15; οἰκεῖν D.S. 5.6, D.H. 1.9, etc.
villager, countryman, Pl. Lg. 762a, 763a, X. An. 4.5.24, Call. Hec. Fr. 23 M. [Fr. 342.2 Pf.], UPZ 120.3 (- ίτης, ii B.C.), D.H. 4.14, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: one of the same quarter or district, Ar. Nu. 965, OGI 488.3 ( Philadelphia), CIG 3695b ( Aesepus): more generally, Φεραίας κωμῆται χθονός dwellers in, E. Alc. 476; θυρέτρων τῶνδε κωμῆται θεοί neighbours, Ion Trag. 37.
of a κώμη, τὰ κ. funds of the κ., PRyl. 221.29 (iii A.D.), PTeb. 340i10 (iii A.D.); κ. κατάστασις Just. Nov. 38.6; delivered by a κ., χόρτος Sammelb. 4496.18 (vi A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: rustic, peasant, γύναιον Porph. Chr. 64.

definition: κωμῆτις, ιδος, fem. of κωμήτης, Ar. Lys. 5, Fr. 274.

children.definition: speak like a comic poet, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 22, EM 92.27.

of or for comedy, comic, later form for κωμῳδικός, κ. ὑποκριτής Aeschin. 1.157; ποητάς SIG 711 L 15 ( Delph., ii B.C.); κ. χορός, ὄρχησις, Arist. Pol. 1276b5, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.21; προσωπεῖον Luc. Bis Acc. 33; ἱλαρῷ καὶ κ. προσώπῳ Id. Cal. 24, cf. Plu. Ant. 29.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. κωμικός, ὁ, comedian, i.e. either comic actor, Alex. 98.13; or comic poet, Plb. 12.13.3, Phld. Mus. p.16 K. (pl.), Plu. Adul. 2.62e, etc.; ὁ κ., κατʼ ἐξοχήν, = Aristophanes, Luc. Prom.Es 2, etc. Adv. -κῶς Ph. 1.473, D.L. 5.88.

definition: κώμιον, τό, Dim. of κώμη, Str. 10.5.3, Plu. Amat.narr. 2.773b.
κῶμο, for κῶμος, barbarism in Ar. Th. 1176.

children.definition: office of κωμογραμματεύς, PTeb. 9.4 (ii B.C.), Sammelb. 5672, 6025 (both ii A.D.).
clerk of a κώμη, PPetr. 3p.224 (iii B.C.), PTeb. 19.9 (ii B.C.), OGI 665.31 ( Egypt, i A.D.), J. AJ 16.7.3, etc.
run through villages, Poll. 9.11.
settler in a κώμη, PRyl. 233.7 (ii A.D.), PLips. 99 ii 18 (iv A.D.).
official of a κώμη who leases out land, PTeb. 183 (ii B.C.).
fall into lethargic sleep, κεκωμῶσθαι Hp. ap. Gal. 19.111.
revel-smitten, i.e. inebriated, Hdn.Gr. 1.46.
village-town, i.e. a place not entitled to be called a πόλις, Str. 12.2.6, al., Ev.Marc. 1.38.

revel, carousal, merry-making, εἰς δαῖτα θάλειαν καὶ χορὸν ἱμερόεντα καὶ ἐς φιλοκυδέα κ. h.Merc. 481, cf. Thgn. 829, 940; πίνειν καὶ κώμῳ χρᾶσθαι Hdt. 1.21, cf. E. Alc. 804, etc.; κῶμοι καὶ εὐφροσύναι B. 10.12; δεῖπνα καὶ σὺν αὐλητρίσι κῶμοι Pl. Tht. 173d; ἑορταὶ καὶ κ. Id. R. 573d; ἐν κώμῳ εἶναι, of a city, X. Cyr. 7.5.25; ἔρχεσθαί τισιν ἐπὶ κῶμον Id. Smp. 2.1; ἐπὶ κῶμον βαδίζειν Ar. Pl. 1040; esp. in honour of gods, τοῖς ἐν ἄστει Διονυσίοις ἡ πομπὴ . . καὶ ὁ κ. Lex ap. D. 21.10, cf. IG 2.971, etc.; κώμῳ θυραμάχοις τε πυγμαχίαισι Pratin.Lyr. 1.8; χοροῖς ἢ κώμοις Ὑακίνθου E. Hel. 1469 (lyr.).

data.quote: εἰς δαῖτα θάλειαν καὶ χορὸν ἱμερόεντα καὶ ἐς φιλοκυδέα κ.

children.definition: band of revellers, κ. εὐίου θεοῦ Id. Ba. 1167 (lyr.); esp. of the procession which celebrated a victor in games, Pi. P. 5.22, etc.: generally, rout, band, κ. Ἐρινύων A. Ag. 1189; of an army, κ. ἀναυλότατος E. Ph. 791 (lyr.); κ. ἀσπιδηφόρος Id. Supp. 390; band of hunters, Id. Hipp. 55; of maidens, Id. Tr. 1184; of doves, Id. Ion 1197.

children.label: II
children.definition: the ode sung at one of these festive processions, Pi. P. 8.20, 70, O. 4.10, B. 8.103; μελιγαρύων τέκτονες κώμων Pi. N. 3.5, cf. Ar. Th. 104, 988 (both lyr.).
warden of a κῶμος, BGU 742i1 (ii A.D.).

definition: κωμύδριον, τό, Dim. of κώμη, Porph. Chr. 64.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dim. of κῶμος, Steph. in Rh. 285.19.
bundle, truss of hay, etc., Cratin. 299, Theoc. 4.18: in pl., of bamboos, Agath. 5.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: branch of laurel, placed before the gates, Hsch.

children.label: III
children.definition: κώμυς, ὁ, reed-bed, in pl., Thphr. HP 4.11.1.

treat after the manner of κωμῳδοί: hence, satirize, lampoon, ridicule, κωμῳδεῖ τὴν πόλιν ἡμῶν Ar. Ach. 631, cf. Pl. R. 395e, 452d, Ael. VH 13.43, etc.; κ. τοὺς τραγῳδούς Arist. Po. 1458b32; κ. τινὰ ἐπί τινι Ath. 8.344e, cf. Sch. Ar. V. 42: abs., Ar. Pl. 557:— Pass., Id. V. 1026, Ra. 368, Plu. QConv. 2.712a, etc.; μὴ κωμῳδεῖσθαι ὀνομαστί τινα Sch. Ar. Av. 1297; τὸ κοινὸν καὶ κεκωμῳδημένον, of the parasites, Alex. 116.2; κεκωμῳδημένα made matter for comedy, Pl. Lg. 816d.
κωμῳδεῖν τὰ δίκαια, = κωμῳδοῦντα εἰπεῖν τὰ δ., Ar. Ach. 655.
make fun of, ridicule, Lys. 24.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be a κωμῳδός 3, write comedies, c. acc. cogn., κ. κωμῳδίας Luc. Pisc. 25; write in a comedy (introducing a quotation), Phld. Vit. p.38 J.
matter for comedy, τὰ τοῦ γέλωτος κ. laughter such as comedy produces, Pl. Lg. 816d.
one must ridicule, Aristid. Or. 29(40).25.

comedy, Ar. Ach. 378, Nu. 522, Pl. R. 394c, etc.; κ. ἀρχαία Plu. Luc. 39, 2.711f, M.Ant. 11.6; μέση ibid., Ath. 11.482c; νέα Plu. QConv. 2.712b. M.Ant. l.c.; κ. παλαιαί, καιναί, Arist. EN 1128a22; κωμῳδιῶν ποιηταί OGI 51.34 ( Egypt, iii B.C.): generally, play, Plu. QConv. 2.665e: metaph., βίου τραγῳδία καὶ κ. Pl. Phlb. 50b. (From κῶμος: wrongly expld. by Dorian writers from κώμη, cf. Arist. Po. 1448a37.)

definition: κωμῳδιακός, ή, όν, = sq., Sch. Ar. Ach. 380.

children.definition: of comedy, comic, ἔπη Ar. V. 1047; τερπνόν τι καὶ κ. Id. Ec. 889; σκωραμὶς κ. ib. 371; μορμολυκεῖον Id. Fr. 31; ἐν μιμήσει κ. Pl. R. 606c. Adv. -κῶς Ath. 3.90b.
comic writer, Plb. 12.13.7, D.S. 12.14.

definition: κωμῳδιοποιός, later form for κωμῳδοποιός, Clearch. 3, Ath. 1.5b, etc., cf. Moer. p.240P.

children.definition: AP 13.6 ( Phal.).
AP 7.708 ( Diosc.), Phld. Mus. p.88 K.
rehearsing a comedy, training the chorus: generally, the comic poetʼs part, Ar. Eq. 516.
comic poet, because he trained the actors and chorus, Ar. Eq. 507, Pax 737, Lys. Fr. 53, Arist. de An. 406b17: κωμῳδιοδιδ. is f.l. in D.Chr. 15.7, Aristid. 2.129 J.
play the parasite, περί τινα Ar. V. 1318.
Ar. Pax 734, Poll. 4.111.
writing of comedies, Plu. Glor.Ath. 2.348b.
comic poet, Pl. Ap. 18d, Phd. 70c, R. 606c, al., Arist. Po. 1449a4, IG ΙΙ(2).113.26 ( Delos, iii B.C.), Phld. Mus. p.99 K., etc.

definition: κωμῳδός, ὁ, late Boeot. κωμαϝυδός (i.e. κωμαοιδός) IG 7.3195.23 (Orchom.):—prop.

children.definition: singer in the κῶμος or comic chorus, χορὸς κωμῳδῶν Arist. Po. 1449b1; κωμῳδοῖς χορηγεῖν Lys. 21.4, Arist. EN 1123a23: hence, in pl., in the sense performance of comedy, κωμῳδῶν ὄντων ἐν Κολυττῷ Aeschin. 1.157; ἀνειπεῖν Διονυσίων τοῖς κ. at the performance, IG 2(2).1202.15; οὐδέ τοι ὑποκριταὶ κωμῳδοῖς τε καὶ τραγῳδοῖς οἱ αὐτοί Pl. R. 395a, cf. Phdr. 236c, Lg. 935d; καινῇ κωμῳδῶν, v. καινός.

data.quote: οὐδέ τοι ὑποκριταὶ κωμῳδοῖς τε καὶ τραγῳδοῖς οἱ αὐτοί

children.definition: comic actor, Chares 4 J., PCair.Zen. 417.11 (iii B.C.), Plu. Cic. 5, IG 42(1).99.25 ( Epid., i/ii A.D.): generally, actor, M.Ant. 12.36, Ath. 14.620d.

children.label: b
children.definition: singer of comic lyrics, SIG 424.57 ( Delph., iii B.C.); χορευταὶ κωμῳδοῦ ib. 690.18 (ibid., ii B.C.).
comic poet, ὁ κ., of Aristophanes, Phryn. PS p.79 B., cf. Sch. D.T. p.19 H.: this sense is doubtful in Pl. Lg. l.c.
serio-comedy, title of plays by Alcaeus Comicus and Anaxandrides, Harp., Phot., Suid. s.v. ἀδηφάγος: metaph., of human life, Porph. Marc. 2, Id. ap. Stob. 3.21.28.
κῶναν Dsc. 1.72: gen. κώνης Hippiatr. 26. κώνα· βέμβιξ, Hsch.

definition: κωνάριον, τό, Dim. of κῶνος, Hero Spir. 1.41.

children.definition: pineal gland in the brain, from its shape, Gal. UP 8.14, al.
spin a top: generally, = περιδινέω, Ar. Fr. 520, Hsch., Phot., EM 551.24.

children.label: II
children.definition: κῶνος 1.3) cover with pitch, IG 11 (2).203 A 33 ( Delos, iii B.C.), PCair.Zen. 366.23 (iii B.C.), Phot., Suid., EM 551.22.
to be dosed with hemlock, Str. 10.5.6: Κωνειαζόμεναι, title of a play by Menander.
hemlock, Conium maculatum, Hp. Steril. 224, Thphr. HP 1.5.3, 9.8.3, Nic. Al. 186, Dsc. 4.78, etc.
Call. Iamb. 1.122, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: hemlock-juice, poison by which criminals were put to death at Athens, Ar. Ra. 124; κώνειον πεπωκώς Pl. Ly. 219e; τὸ κώνειον ἔπιεν X. HG 2.3.56, cf. And. 3.10; κώνεια πιεῖν Ar. Ra. 1051.
pitching: hence, daubing, f.l. for κόμμωσις, Arist. HA 623b31.
for pitching: neut. - κόν, τό, BGU 1532 (iii B.C.).
pitched wine, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.116.

cone-shaped, conical, Epicur. Nat. 14.5, Plu. Def.orac. 2.410d; esp. in Math., κ. ἐπιφάνεια, γραμμαί, τομαί, Archim. Sph. Cyl. 1.9, al., Papp. 672.10, 662.15; κωνικά, τά, Conic Sections, title of work by Apollonius Pergaeus, cf. Archim. Con.Sph. 3; κ. στοιχεῖα Id. Quadr. 3; κ. ὅροι Papp. 922.17; κ. προβλήματα Apollon.Perg. Con. 1 Praef.
Dim. of κῶνος, small cone, κωνία μαστῶν AP 5.12 ( Phld.).

children.label: II
children.definition: small pine-cone, Posidon. 3 J.
Hsch.
extracted from pine-cones, πίσσα Rhian. 75.

conical, σχῆμα Archim. Con.Sph.Praef., al., Ph. Bel. 86.51; of the creative fire, Cleanth.Stoic. 1.111; of the apex of the Roman flamen, D.H. 2.70; σκιά Cleom. 2.2, etc.; σκίασμα D.C. 60.26; τὸ κ. conoid, Archim. Con.Sph.Praef., etc. Adv. -δῶς Placit. 4.15.3, Cleom. 2.2, Phlp. in de An. 140.34.

children.label: II
children.definition: concise, pointed, ἑρμηνεία συνεστραμμένη καὶ οἷον εἰπεῖν κ. Corn. Rh. p.387 H.

data.quote: ἑρμηνεία συνεστραμμένη καὶ οἷον εἰπεῖν κ.

children.label: III
children.definition: ειδές, τό, = κωνάριον II, Gal. 2.723 (but κ. μόριον odontoid process of the second vertebra, 2.461).
pine-cone, Gloss.
Hero Metr. 3.22.
πεύκη, pine-cone, = στρόβιλος, Ps.- Hdt. Vit.Hom. 20, Thphr. HP 3.9.5, Theoc. 5.49, Dsc. 1.69, etc.; used in Orphic rites, Orph. Fr. 31.29.
edible seed of the πίτυς, Mnesith. ap. Ath. 2.57b; πιτύϊνοι κ. Alex.Mynd.ibid., cf. IG 2(2).1013.19, OGI 629.163 ( Palmyra, ii A.D.).
pine tree, Pl. Epigr. 27 Diehl (prob.), Plu. QConv. 2.640c.

cone, Democr. 155, Arist. Mete. 362b2, etc.; γραμμαὶ κατὰ κῶνον ἐκπίπτουσαι so as to form a cone, ib. 375b22, cf. 345b6; ὀρθογωνίου, ὀξυγωνίου, ἀμβλυγωνίου κώνου τομά, names for parabola, ellipse, and hyperbola, Archim. Con.Sph.Praef.

children.label: b
children.definition: ὁ κ. τῆς γῆς conical shadow of the earth, Simp. in de An. 133.5, cf. Phlp. in de An. 348.27; τῆς νυκτὸς ὁ κ. εἰς ὀξὺ λήγει Dam. Pr. 213.

data.quote: τῆς νυκτὸς ὁ κ. εἰς ὀξὺ λήγει

children.label: c
children.definition: ὁ τῆς ὄψεως κ. cone of vision, Gal. 7.95, cf. Phlp. in de An. 333.27 (pl.).
cone or peak of a helmet, AP 9.322 ( Leon.).
spinning top, Hsch.
iron pole round which grain is piled in conical shape, PGrenf. 2.17.3 (ii B.C.), Gal. 19.76.
στέφανος χρυσοῦς ἐπὶ κώνου δάφνης dub. sens. in Inscr.Délos 442 B 56 (ii B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: πρὸς τῷ ἀνδροφόνῳ κώνῳ dub. sens. in IG 3.61 A ii 15 (ii A.D.).
produce by means of conic sections, τριάδας Eratosth. 35.8

senses.definition: bearing cones, Thphr. HP 3.9.4; esp. κωνοφόρος (sc. πεύκη), ἡ, stone-pine, Pinus pinea, ib. 2.2.6; also of the thyrsus, AP 6.165.4 ( Phal.).

definition: κωνωπεών, ῶνος, ὁ, = sq. 2, AP 9.764 tit. ( Paul.Sil.).

children.definition: Dim. of κώνωψ, Gal. 7.96, Phlp. in de An. 291.33, Gp. 2.5.12.
couch with mosquito-curtains, LXX Ju. 10.21, 13.9, Sor. 1.85 (written κωνόπιον Stud.Pal. 20.211.11 (v/vi A.D.)). (Lat. cōnōpǐum, later cōnōpēum).
like a gnat, θηρία Thphr. HP 3.14.1, Dsc. 1.84.
gnat-catcher, a bird, Hsch.
Gnat-smeller, name of a parasite, Alciphr. 1.21.
gnat, mosquito, A. Ag. 892, Hdt. 2.95, Orac. ap. Ar. Eq. 1038, Arist. HA 535a3, 552b5; μήτε ὡς λέων ἀναστρέφου μήτε ὡς κ. Metrod. Fr. 60.

data.quote: μήτε ὡς λέων ἀναστρέφου μήτε ὡς κ.

definition: κῶος, ὁ, mostly in pl. κῶοι,

children.definition: caves, dens, Str. 8.5.7, St.Byz. s.v. Κῶς.
of, from the island Κῶς, Coan, IG 1(2).195.7, al., Hdt. 7.164, etc.; Κώϊος Call. Fr. 254.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. Κῷος (sc. βόλος), ὁ, the highest throw with the ἀστράγαλοι, opp. Χῖος, Hsch.; τὰ κῷα are the inner, τὰ χῖα the outer, sides of the huckle-bones (ἀστράγαλοι), Arist. HA 499b28 ( κῶλα and ἰσχία codd.), cf. Cael. 292a29 (v.l.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Κῷον (sc. ἱμάτιον), τό, a light semi-transparent garment, made at Cos, Hsch.
Ostr.Fay. 44 (ii/iii A.D.), BGU 531 ii 8: pl. written κόα, Sammelb. 7199.2, al. (ii A.D.).
Hsch. (also κώϊον); cf. κοῖον, κοῦα.
handle of an oar, Hsch.

definition: Κωπαΐς, αΐδος, contr. Κωπᾴς, ᾷδος, ἡ,

children.definition: of or near Copae (in Boeotia), ἡ K. λίμνη Lake Copais, Hdt. 8.135, Str. 9.2.27; ἡ K. alone, Ath. 7.207d.
ἐγχέλεις Κωπαΐδες eels from Lake C., Ar. Ach. 880; Κωπᾷδʼ ἔγχελυν ib. 962: without Subst., Κωπᾴδων σπυρίδας Id. Pax 1005 (anap.); Κωπᾴδων ἁπαλῶν τεμάχη Stratt. 44.

definition: κωπάω, v. - έω. κωπέτας· σφονδύλους μεγάλους ἰχθύων, Hsch.
κωπεύς, έως, ὁ, ( κώπη) always in pl. κωπέες, Att. κωπῆς,

children.definition: pieces of wood fit for making oars, spars, Hdt. 5.23, Ar. Ach. 552, Lys. 422, And. 2.11, IG 1(2).46.11, 2(2).1609.95, al.
propel with oars, βᾶριν AP 7.365 ( Zon.).

children.label: II
children.definition: κεκώπευται στρατός it has the sword drawn, Anon. ap. Hsch.
furnish with oars, in pf. Pass., κεκώπηται ἡ ναῦς Hsch.: pl. κεκώπηνται IG 2(2).1604.73.

children.label: II
children.definition: furnish with handles, κοῦφα κεκωπημένα BGU 1143.15 (i B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: = foreg. II, Hsch. s.v. κεκώπηται.
Thphr. HP 5.1.7: pl., ib. 4.1.4.
handle (v. fin.); esp.

handle of an oar, Hsch.: hence, the oar itself (not in Il.), ἐμβαλέειν κώπῃς Od. 9.489; κώπῃσιν ἁλὸς ῥηγμῖνα . . τύπτετε 12.214, cf. Sapph. 120, etc.; οἱ τὰς κ. ξύοντες Thphr. HP 5.1.6, cf. κωποξύστης; κώπαν σχάσον, metaph., ‘stay thy hand’, Pi. P. 10.51; νερτέρᾳ προσήμενος κώπῃ, = θαλαμίτης, metaph., of a man of low rank, A. Ag. 1618; πομπίμοις κώπαις ἐρέσσων S. Tr. 561; παραπέμπειν ἐφʼ ἕνδεκα κώπαις, a prov. of dub. origin, meaning ‘to escort with all the honours’, Ar. Eq. 546, cf. Eust. 1540.44, Suid. s.v. ἐφʼ ἕνδεκα; κώπαισι πλεῖν take to the oars, when the wind fails, Men. 241; κώπαις ποιεῖσθαι τὸν πλοῦν Arist. IA 710a19: poet., to express ships, κλεινᾷ σὺν κώπᾳ, of Agamemnonʼs fleet, E. IT 140 (lyr.), cf. Hel. 1272, 1452 (lyr.).
handle of a sword, hilt, ἐπʼ ἀργυρέῃ κώπῃ σχέθε χεῖρα Il. 1.219, cf. Od. 8.403; ξίφεος δʼ ἐπεμαίετο κώπην 11.531; χεῖρα κώπης ἐπιψαύουσαν S. Ph. 1255; φάσγανον κώπης λαβών E. Hec. 543.
handle of a key, κώπη δʼ ἐλέφαντος ἐπῆεν Od. 21.7.
haft of a torch, E. Cyc. 484 (anap.).
handle or spoke by which a mill is turned, PSI 5.530.10 (iii B.C.), Agatharch. 26, PRyl. 167.11 (i A.D.), Luc. Asin. 42.
haft of a whip, Hsch. s.v. Κερκυραία μάστιξ.
spars or bars used in building-operations, IG 1(2).313.135. (Cf. Lat. cap-io, Engl. haft, etc.)
hilted, φάσγανα Il. 15.713, al.
rowing, Arist. Mete. 369b11, Str. 9.2.17, PSI 4.289.2 (iii A.D.), Sch. Ar. Ra. 271.
pull an oar, row, opp. κυβερνῆσαι, Arist. Rh.Al. 1435a28, cf. Plb. 1.2.1, etc.
of any similar motion forwards and backwards, as of a carpenter using an auger, τρύπανον κ. E. Cyc. 461.
rower, Plb. 34.3.8, LXX Ez. 27.8, PSI 4.289.18 (iii A.D.); κ. πολύπους nautilus, Clearch. 47.
of rowers, ἐπίφθεγμα Hsch. s.v. ἄρρυ; πόνοι Sch. Opp. H. 4.76.
formed like an oar, dub. in Hsch. ( κωπῆλα cod.).
furnished with oars, στόλος A. Pers. 416; στρατός S. Fr. 142.16; σκάφος E. Hel. 1381; πλοῖον Th. 4.118; κωπῆρες (sc. πλοῖον), τό, Plu. Ant. 65, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: holding the oar, χείρ E. Tr. 160 (lyr.).
Hermipp. 54, Agath. 5.21, cf. Poll. 1.92; v. ἐπικωπητήρ.

definition: κωπίον, τό, Dim. of κώπη, Ar. Ra. 269, Ael. NA 13.19, PRyl. 110.14 (iii A.D.).

children.definition: false ribs, Poll. 2.181.
oar-maker, SIG 1000.17 ( Cos), Gloss.
oar-dealer, dub. in Jahresh. 23 Beibl. 172 (fort. ῥωπο-).
wreathed staff used in the δαφνηφόρια in Boeotia, Procl. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.321 B.

definition: κώρα, ἡ, Dor. for κούρη, Theoc. 6.36, Call. Lav.Pall. 27, 138, Cer. 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.

definition: κωράλιον παιδάριον, κόριον, Hsch.; cf. κοράλλιον.
κωραλίσκος, ὁ, Dim. of κὼρος ( κοῦρος A), Hdn.Gr. 2.926, Phot.; title of play by Epilycus.

children.definition: coral-fisher, Hsch.

definition: κωρία, ἡ, Dor. for κουρεύτρια, Hsch.
κωριδάμνας ἀκρίς, Hsch. κωρίθιον· χόρτον, Id.

children.definition: Semon. 15, Epich. 89.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
education, upbringing, κωρισμοῖς ἐδίδαξα μελίφροσι Hymn.Is. 41.

definition: κῶρος, ὁ, Dor. for κοῦρος (A), κόρος (B), Call. Lav.Pall. 85, Theoc. 1.47, etc.
κωρύκιον [ ῠ], τό, Dim. of κώρυκος, Poll. 10.172, Suid.:

children.definition: Corycian, ἄντρον, a cave on Mt. Parnassus, Hdt. 8.36 (also Κωρύκιον, τό, Plu. Pyth. 2.394f: pl., K. ἄντρα Aristonous 1.35); prov. for a ‘snug retreat’, Ceb. 26; Νύμφαι K. S. Ant. 1128 (lyr.); κορυφαὶ K. the peaks of Parnassus, E. Ba. 559 (lyr.).
πέτρα A. Eu. 22.
Dim. of κώρυκος I.1, Epich. 113, Ar. Fr. 415.

children.label: II
children.definition: leaf-gall in elms, Thphr. HP 3.14.1.
of Corycus, epith. of Hermes, Orph. H. 28.8.
exercise with punching-bag, Aret. CD 2.13 (pl.).

definition: κωρυκομαχία, Ion. -ίη, ἡ, = foreg., Hp. Vict. 2.64, 3.78.

children.definition: leathern sack or wallet for provisions, Od. 5.267, 9.213, Ar. Lys. 1210 (lyr.), Pherecr. 78, Antiph. 160.3.

leathern sack hung up for punching, Sor. 1.49, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.33.1, Philostr. Gym. 57, Luc. Lex. 5; ζυγομαχῶν τῷ κωρύκῳ (with play on Κωρύκῳ) Com.Adesp. 207; πρὸς κώρυκον γυμνάζεσθαι, prov. of labour in vain, Diogenian. 7.54: metaph., of parasites, ἑαυτοὺς ἀντὶ κωρύκων λέπειν παρέχοντες ἀθληταῖσιν Timocl. 29.

data.quote: ἑαυτοὺς ἀντὶ κωρύκων λέπειν παρέχοντες ἀθληταῖσιν

children.definition: leathern quiver, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: scrotum, Hippiatr. 73.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hegesand. 36.

Corycus, a promontory of Cilicia, h.Ap. 39, etc.:— Adj. Κωρυκαῖος, α, ον: the inhabitants were infamous for spying out the destination and value of ships’ cargoes and then piratically seizing them, Ephor. 27 J., etc.: hence Κωρυκαῖος, prov. of spies and eavesdroppers, Str. 14.1.32, Cic. Att. 10.18.1, prob. in Call. Iamb. 1.143; K. ἠκροάσατο, ‘a little bird told me’, Men. 150; μὴ κατακούσειεν δέ μου ὁ K., ‘low be it spoken’, Diox. 2:—also Κωρύκιον σκάφος piratical craft, Alciphr. 1.8.
like a sack, Thphr. HP 3.15.4.
Cos; Ep. Κόως h.Ap. 42: acc. Κῶν Il. 2.677; Κόωνδε, Adv. to Cos, 14.255, 15.28; cf. Κῷος, Κῳακός:—prov., ὃν οὐ θρέψει K., ἐκεῖνον οὐδὲ Αἴγυπτος Eust. 983.33.

definition: κῶς (A), τό, contr. for κῶας, Nicoch. 12.

children.label: II
children.definition: public prison, St.Byz., cf. Hsch.; cf. κῶος.

children.label: III
children.definition: κῶες, οἱ, prisoners, at Corinth, St.Byz.

children.label: II
children.definition: κως, Ion. for πως, Id.
ladle, stirrer, gloss on λάκτιν, EM 555.18 ( σκυτάλην codd.), Suid., Eust. 1675.56.
a musical air, Hedyl. ap. Ath. 4.176d.

definition: κωτάρχης, ου, ὁ, priest of the Κάβειροι at Didyma, CIG 2880, 2881: —also κώτ-αρχος, ib. 2882:—fem. κώτ-αρχις, ιδος, ἡ, Milet. 1(7) No.265.
κωτιλάς, άδος, ἡ, poet.fem. of κωτίλος,

children.definition: twitterer, Boeot. name for the swallow, Stratt. 47.6.
prattle, esp. flattery, Gloss.

prattle, chatter, usu. with collat. notion of coaxing, wheedling, αἱμύλα κωτίλλουσα Hes. Op. 374; μαλθακὰ κ. Thgn. 852; ἡδέα κωτίλλοντα καθήμενον οἰνοποτάζειν Phoc. 11; ἀνάνυτα κ. Theoc. 15.87; ἑλικτὰ ἔπη Lyc. 1466; κ. καὶ λιγαίνειν, of a speech in court, to be lively, tripping, D.H. Dem. 44.

children.label: II
children.definition: cajole, beguile with fair words, εὖ κώτιλλε τὸν ἐχθρόν Thgn. 363; μὴ κώτιλλέ με tease me not by prating, S. Ant. 756; τοιαῦτα κωτίλλουσα τὴν ἀχαΐνην Babr. 95.87.

chattering, babbling, Thgn. 295, S. Fr. 683.3; of women, Theoc. 15.89; κωτίλε ( -ιλλε codd.) ‘chatterbox’, gloss on τέττα, Hellad. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.531 B.; of the swallow, twittering, Anacr. 154, Simon. 243; generally, of animals, vocal, opp. σιγηλός, Arist. HA 488a33.

children.label: II
children.definition: lively, expressive, ῥήματα Theoc. 20.7; ὄμμα κ. speaking eye, AP 5.130 ( Phld.); persuasive, φίλτρα ib. 7.221; κ. ἁρμονία, μουσική, babbling, i.e. light, music, D.H. Dem. 49, Plu. Mus. 2.1136b; κῶλα πολὺ τὸ κ. ἔχοντα D.H. Dem. 40; κωτίλας ἄνακτα μοίσας IG 42(1).130.16 (Epid.).
ruppo rusco (?), Gloss.
make dumb, silence, πᾶσαν ἰωήν Opp. C. 3.286:— Pass., grow dumb or deaf, become stupid, ὑπʼ ἀπαιδευσίας κεκωφημένος Clearch. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: maim, injure, Hsch.
stupor, depression, Phld. D. 1.24.
hold oneʼs peace, LXX 2 Ki. 13.20, al.
mutilate, prob. l. S. Fr. 234.
maiming, mutilation, Hsch.
Hsch.
Ael. NA 8.13.
blunt, dull, obtuse, opp. ὀξύς, κ. βέλος Il. 11.390, cf. E. Fr. 495.27; κ. καλάμη AP 12.25 ( Stat.Flacc.).

mute, noiseless, κύματι κωφῷ Il. 14.16; κωφὴν γὰρ δὴ γαῖαν ἀεικίζει is maltreating dumb, senseless earth, 24.54; τὰ μὲν ἄλλα ἔσκε κωφά the other parts sounded dull, opp. to the ringing of the hollow parts when struck, Hdt. 4.200: neut. pl. as Adv., κωφὰ δὲ πόντος κεῖτο Orph. A. 1103; ὁ κ. λιμήν, prob. the bay of Munychia, as opp. to the noisy Piraeus, X. HG 2.4.31; κωφότερος ὁ ψόφος ἔσται, i.e. muffled, Aen.Tact. 19; τῶν μεταλλικῶν κωφότατος [ὁ σίδηρος] rings least, Plu. QConv. 2.721f; κωφοὶ ἄνεμοι D.S. 3.51.

Hom., of men or animals, dumb, Parm. 6.7, etc.; καὶ κωφοῦ συνίημι καὶ οὐ φωνεῦντος ἀκούω Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.47; οὐ . . παρὰ κωφὸν ὁ τυφλὸς ἔοικε λαλῆσαι, i.e. is not so dumb but that he will answer the blind fool who assails him, Cratin. 6; κωφότερος κίχλης Eub. 29; κ. χάρις a mute gift (sc. an epitaph), Epigr.Gr. 298 ( Teos); so κωφοῖς δάκρυσι IPE 2.299 ( Panticapaeum); κ. τάφοι prob. in IG 12(8).441.26; κ. προσωπεῖον mute figure on the stage, Ph. 2.520, cf. Plu. An seni 2.791e; κ. πρόσωπον Cic. Att. 13.19.3; κ. καὶ ἄλογος, of a house, with no echoes, Luc. Dom. 1.

children.label: b
children.definition: deaf, h.Merc. 92, Heraclit. 34. A. Th. 202, Ch. 881; λήθην κωφήν, ἄναυδον S. Fr. 670; ὅσοι γίνονται κ. ἐκ γενετῆς, πάντες καὶ ἐνεοὶ γίνονται Arist. HA 536b3 (hence of a deaf and dumb person, Hdt. 1.34, BGU 1196.49 (i B. C.), cf. Hsch.); c.gen., κωφὴ ἀκοῆς αἴσθησις Antiph. 196.5, cj. in Pl. Lg. 932a; κ. Ἑλλάδος φωνᾶς deaf of oneʼs Greek ear, i.e. ignorant of Greek, Dialex. 6.12; σπαράγματα κωφὰ τοῦ βεβαιοῦντος Plu. Col. 2.1108d.

children.label: c
children.definition: νοῦς ὁρῇ καὶ νοῦς ἀκούει· τἆλλα κωφὰ καὶ τυφλά Epich. 249; κ. πέτρος MoschioTrag. 7; μαψαῦραι Call. Fr. 67; ἐρημία D.S. 3.40: neut. pl. as Adv., κωφὰ χλιαίνεσθαι feebly, AP 12.125 ( Mel.).

data.quote: νοῦς ὁρῇ καὶ νοῦς ἀκούει· τἆλλα κωφὰ καὶ τυφλά

children.definition: ὄμμα κ. vacant, lack-lustre eye, Arist. Phgn. 807b23.
dull, Thphr. Sens. 19 ( Comp.).
dull, obtuse, ἐγὼ ὁ πάντα κ. S. Aj. 911, cf. Pi. P. 9.87; τὸ τῆς ψυχῆς ποιεῖν κ. Pl. Ti. 88b: κωφοί, οἱ, ‘the Dullards’, title of satyr-play by Sophocles.

children.label: b
children.definition: senseless, unmeaning, obscure, κ. καὶ παλαίʼ ἔπη S. OT 290; κ. διήγησις Plb. 3.36.4, cf. 5.21.4; ὑπόνοια Phld. Mus. p.71 K.; σκῶμμα Plu. QConv. 2.712a; but κ. εὐπραγίαι is prob.f.l.for κοῦφαι, D.C. 38.27. Adv. -φῶς obscurely, Vett.Val. 251.25: Comp. - ότερον, ἐνοχλεῖν less acutely, Phld. Vit. p.21 J.
deafness, Hp. Epid. 3.17.ζʹ, Pl. Alc. 1.126b, Plu. Superst. 2.167c; dullness of hearing, ib. Aud. 38b: metaph., D. 19.226, Phld. Rh. 2.118S.
numb, deaden, ὀδύνας κωφοῖ Hp. Liqu. 1, cf. Gal. 19.116:— Pass., Hp. Morb. 2.8: metaph. in Pass., κ. πρὸς μάθησιν Ph. 1.548; κεκωφωμένος πρὸς τὰ τεχνικὰ θεωρήματα S.E. M. 1.34.
deafen, in Pass., ὁκόσοισιν ἂν τὰ ὦτα κωφωθῇ Hp. Aph. 4.60, cf. Ph. 1.224.
put to silence, in Pass., become dumb, LXX Ps. 38(39).3.

children.label: II
children.definition: maim, injure, in Pass., Hp. Loc.Hom. 2, cf. Erot. s.v. κωφωθῇ.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., of water, lose its freshness, Hp. Vict. 1.35.
deafness, Hp. Epid. 5.52 ( κύφ- codd.).

definition: κώφωσις, εως, Ion. ιος, ἡ, = foreg. [κώφωμα], Hp. Aph. 4.28, Coac. 186, al., Gal. 9.758;

children.definition: injury, κ. ὀφθαλμῶν ἢ ἀκοῆς Hp. Mul. 1.41.
dullness, Pempel. ap. Stob. 4.25.52.

definition: κωχεύω, f.l. for ὀκωχεύω, S. Fr. 327.

children.definition: v.l. in Arist. HA 617b31 ap. Ath. 9.391c and Ael. NA 15.28, Alex.Mynd. ap. Ath. l.c.
